controls.control_name: Context of the Organisation and Scope

questions.question: Provide the documented internal and external issues affecting your ISMS.
questions.guidance: Context documentation review. Look for: SWOT/PESTLE analysis; regulatory landscape mapping; competitive environment; technology changes; threat landscape assessment; climate change consideration. Document must be dated and show review within 12 months.
questions.auditor_focus: Is this organisation-specific or a generic template?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Organisation-specific context document with dated SWOT/PESTLE analysis and regulatory requirements mapped including APRA and Privacy Act and technology landscape documented and threat environment assessed and climate change relevance determination documented and review evidence within 12 months and version control applied
questions.red_flags: Generic template without customisation; No regulatory mapping; Document undated or stale over 12 months; Missing threat landscape; No version control; Climate change not considered
questions.nc_pattern: Context documentation is generic or template-based without organisation-specific analysis.

questions.question: Show me your interested parties register with their documented requirements.
questions.guidance: Interested parties assessment. Look for: customers; regulators including APRA; shareholders; employees; suppliers; partners; climate-related stakeholders where relevant. Each party must have specific security requirements documented and not generic statements. Note: Interested parties may have climate change related requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Complete stakeholder register with all relevant parties identified and specific security requirements per party and traceability to controls in SoA and regular review evidence and named owner for register
questions.red_flags: Generic requirements like expects security; Missing key stakeholders; No traceability to controls; No review evidence; Incomplete coverage
questions.nc_pattern: Interested parties register lacks specific and traceable security requirements.

questions.question: Present your ISMS scope document.
questions.guidance: Scope boundary verification. Look for: physical and logical boundaries; business units; locations; systems; data types; cloud infrastructure including AWS and Azure and GCP; CI/CD pipelines; customer data processing activities; interfaces and dependencies with third parties. Scope must be available as documented information.
questions.auditor_focus: Does scope cover all information assets? Are cloud services explicitly included?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Clearly defined scope with physical and logical boundaries and all business units listed and cloud infrastructure explicitly included and data flows mapped and interfaces documented and dependencies identified and aligned with context document
questions.red_flags: Vague boundaries; Cloud services not explicitly included; Missing business units; No interface documentation; Scope disconnected from context
questions.nc_pattern: ISMS scope document lacks clear boundaries or excludes significant information processing activities.

questions.question: What is explicitly excluded from scope and what is the justification?
questions.guidance: Exclusion justification review. Look for: documented risk-based justification for each exclusion; compensating controls where applicable. Red flag: Excluding critical systems without valid reasoning.
questions.auditor_focus: Is the exclusion justified by risk assessment?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Each exclusion documented with specific risk-based justification and compensating controls identified where needed and exclusions reviewed during risk assessment and no critical systems excluded without strong rationale and annual review of exclusions
questions.red_flags: Exclusions without justification; Critical systems excluded without compensating controls; Generic not applicable statements; No review of exclusions
questions.nc_pattern: Scope exclusions lack documented risk-based justification or compensating controls.

questions.question: Provide evidence of context review within the last 12 months.
questions.guidance: Context review verification. Look for: management review minutes discussing context changes; updated context document with version history; change log showing updates. Verify review was substantive and not just checkbox exercise.
questions.auditor_focus: Was review triggered by actual changes or just an annual checkbox?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Management review minutes explicitly addressing context changes and version history showing updates and change log with rationale and evidence of substantive discussion and documented decisions on any changes needed
questions.red_flags: No review evidence; Review is checkbox exercise without substance; No version history; Context unchanged despite organisational changes
questions.nc_pattern: Context review not conducted within required intervals or lacks evidence of substantive management engagement.

questions.question: How does your scope address cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines and customer data flows?
questions.guidance: Cloud scope verification per Annex A 5.23. Look for: explicit coverage of cloud provider configurations; deployment pipelines; API endpoints; data processing locations; multi-tenant architecture; shared responsibility matrix per cloud provider. Verify cloud provider ISO 27001 certification status.
questions.auditor_focus: If cloud-based is scope detailed on shared responsibility?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Cloud infrastructure explicitly in scope with specific services listed and CI/CD pipeline security addressed and API endpoints documented and data processing locations mapped and multi-tenant considerations addressed and shared responsibility matrix referenced
questions.red_flags: Cloud services mentioned generically; No CI/CD coverage; Missing data flow documentation; Shared responsibility not addressed; Multi-tenancy ignored
questions.nc_pattern: Scope fails to adequately address cloud infrastructure and deployment pipelines or shared responsibility model.

questions.question: Provide meeting attendance records showing C-suite participation in ISMS governance.
questions.guidance: Executive engagement verification. Look for: CEO and CFO and COO names on attendance records; board meeting minutes discussing security; agenda items showing security as standing topic. Red flag: Delegation without attendance.
questions.auditor_focus: Did the CEO actually attend or did they delegate?
questions.what_good_looks_like: C-suite attendance documented at security governance meetings and board minutes showing security discussions and security as standing agenda item and evidence of executive questions and decisions and consistent attendance pattern
questions.red_flags: Delegation without executive attendance; Security not on board agenda; No evidence of executive engagement; Only signature on policy; Sporadic attendance
questions.nc_pattern: Leadership involvement limited to policy signature with no evidence of governance meeting participation.

questions.question: Show me the current information security policy with executive approval signature.
questions.guidance: Policy approval verification. Look for: executive signature from CEO or Board; approval date within 12 months; version control; organisation-specific content and not generic template.
questions.auditor_focus: Is the signature recent? Is policy organisation-specific?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Executive-signed policy dated within 12 months and clear version control and organisation-specific content throughout and aligned with business objectives and regulatory requirements addressed and communication plan documented
questions.red_flags: Unsigned or undated policy; Approval over 12 months old; Generic template content; No version control; Policy not aligned with business
questions.nc_pattern: Information security policy lacks current executive approval or contains generic template content.

questions.question: Present your RACI matrix defining security roles and responsibilities and authorities.
questions.guidance: Accountability mapping review. Look for: named individuals and not just roles; clear accountability for ISMS conformance; designated role for reporting ISMS performance to top management; control owners; incident response authorities. Matrix must align with organisation chart.
questions.auditor_focus: Are responsibilities clear? No gaps or overlaps?
questions.what_good_looks_like: RACI with named individuals and all security functions covered and clear single accountability per function and designated ISMS conformance owner and designated ISMS performance reporter to top management and alignment with organisation chart and no orphan responsibilities and regular review evidence and authority levels documented
questions.red_flags: Roles without names; Gaps in coverage; Multiple accountabilities; Misalignment with org chart; No review evidence; Unclear authorities
questions.nc_pattern: RACI matrix incomplete or has gaps in accountability or does not align with actual organisational structure.

questions.question: Provide evidence of security budget allocation and resource decisions.
questions.guidance: Resource commitment verification. Look for: budget documents; headcount approvals; tool procurement records; meeting minutes showing resource discussions and decisions.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented security budget with year-on-year comparison and headcount approvals for security roles and tool and technology investments approved and meeting minutes showing resource discussions and variance explanations where needed
questions.red_flags: No documented budget; Security resources declining; Resource requests denied without alternative; No evidence of resource discussions
questions.nc_pattern: Security resources not demonstrably allocated or decisions not documented.

questions.question: How does management demonstrate commitment to continual improvement?
questions.guidance: Improvement commitment evidence. Look for: management review outputs with improvement actions; security investment decisions; KPI reviews showing management response to metrics; improvement initiatives with executive sponsorship.
questions.auditor_focus: Are improvements driven by data or just compliance?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Management review outputs with specific improvement actions and investment decisions linked to security gaps and KPI reviews with documented management response and executive-sponsored improvement initiatives and evidence of data-driven decisions
questions.red_flags: Improvement actions not followed up; No investment in identified gaps; KPIs ignored; Improvements only after incidents; No executive sponsorship
questions.nc_pattern: Management commitment to improvement not evidenced through documented actions and resource allocation.

questions.question: How are security objectives communicated organisation-wide?
questions.guidance: Communication effectiveness review for importance of effective information security management. Look for: what to communicate; when to communicate; with whom to communicate; how to communicate. Including all-hands communications; intranet announcements; training materials; town hall presentations; security newsletters. Verify staff awareness through sampling to confirm importance of ISMS is understood.
questions.auditor_focus: Can random staff articulate security objectives?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple communication channels used and regular security updates and objectives included in training and town hall mentions documented and staff able to articulate objectives when sampled and communication effectiveness measured
questions.red_flags: Single communication channel; No regular updates; Staff unaware of objectives; Communication one-way only; No measurement of effectiveness
questions.nc_pattern: Security objectives not effectively communicated with evidence of limited staff awareness.

questions.question: Provide your documented risk assessment methodology.
questions.guidance: Risk methodology documentation. Look for: defined impact scales 1-5 with criteria; likelihood scales; risk calculation method; board-approved acceptance criteria; risk owner assignment process; reassessment triggers. Verify consistent application.
questions.auditor_focus: Is methodology documented AND consistently applied?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented methodology with clear 5-point impact and likelihood scales with criteria and board-approved acceptance criteria dated within 12 months and consistent application evidence across all departments and defined reassessment triggers and named methodology owner
questions.red_flags: No documented methodology; Inconsistent scoring across departments; No board-approved acceptance criteria; Methodology varies by business unit; No reassessment triggers
questions.nc_pattern: Risk assessment methodology not documented or inconsistently applied across the organisation.

questions.question: Show me your current risk register.
questions.guidance: Risk register completeness review. Look for: asset-threat-vulnerability mapping; consistent scoring; named risk owners; treatment status; residual risk levels. Check for regular updates and active management.
questions.auditor_focus: Are risks scored consistently? Are owners actively managing?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Complete asset-threat-vulnerability mapping and consistent scoring methodology applied and named owners with evidence of active management and treatment status current and residual risk documented and accepted and regular update evidence
questions.red_flags: Inconsistent scoring; No owners assigned; Stale entries over 12 months; Missing critical assets; No residual risk documentation; No update evidence
questions.nc_pattern: Risk register incomplete or inconsistently scored or lacking evidence of active ownership and management.

questions.question: Present your risk treatment plan with control selection rationale.
questions.guidance: Risk treatment traceability review. Look for: controls linked to specific risks; implementation timelines; responsible parties; progress tracking. Verify Golden Thread from risk to control selection.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you trace from identified risk to selected control?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Every control selection traced to specific risk and realistic timelines with progress tracking and named responsible parties and variances documented and escalated and clear linkage to SoA and Golden Thread demonstrable
questions.red_flags: Controls not linked to risks; Best practice justification only; No progress tracking; Timelines unrealistic; Disconnected from SoA
questions.nc_pattern: Risk treatment plan does not demonstrate traceability from identified risks to selected controls.

questions.question: Provide your Statement of Applicability addressing ALL 93 Annex A controls.
questions.guidance: SoA completeness check. Look for: all 93 Annex A controls from ISO 27001:2022 listed; applicability status per control; risk-based justification for inclusions; scope-based justification for exclusions; implementation status; evidence references. SoA must be maintained as documented information. Verify no gaps.
questions.auditor_focus: Are ALL 93 controls addressed with specific justification?
questions.what_good_looks_like: All 93 Annex A controls listed with applicability status and risk-based justification for each inclusion and specific justification for exclusions referencing scope or risk assessment and current implementation status with dates and valid evidence references per control and named control owners and version control showing updates
questions.red_flags: Missing controls; Generic N/A without justification; No evidence references; Outdated implementation status; Exclusions not risk-assessed; No owners
questions.nc_pattern: Statement of Applicability incomplete or missing justification for control exclusions.

questions.question: For each SoA exclusion show me the documented justification.
questions.guidance: Exclusion justification verification. Look for: specific risk-based rationale; reference to scope boundaries; alternative controls where applicable; annual review evidence. Reject generic N/A statements.
questions.auditor_focus: Is each exclusion justified with specific auditable rationale?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Specific justification per exclusion referencing scope or risk assessment and alternative controls documented where applicable and annual review of exclusions completed and no generic N/A entries and traceability to scope document
questions.red_flags: Generic N/A - not applicable entries; No risk assessment for exclusions; Alternative controls not considered; Exclusions never reviewed; No scope reference
questions.nc_pattern: Control exclusions lack specific risk-based justification with traceable rationale.

questions.question: Provide your control testing schedule for the certification period.
questions.guidance: Testing schedule completeness review. Look for: all applicable controls scheduled; testing methods defined; sample sizes documented; responsible parties assigned; 3-year cycle coverage plan. Verify no gaps.
questions.auditor_focus: Will all applicable controls be tested within the 3-year certification cycle?
questions.what_good_looks_like: All applicable controls scheduled with testing dates and methods defined per control type and sample sizes justified and documented and responsible parties assigned and complete 3-year coverage with no gaps and progress tracking mechanism
questions.red_flags: Incomplete coverage; No testing schedule exists; Some controls never tested; Missing 3-year plan; No sample size rationale; No progress tracking
questions.nc_pattern: Control testing schedule incomplete or does not ensure full coverage within certification cycle.

questions.question: Show me signed residual risk acceptance records.
questions.guidance: Risk acceptance verification. Look for: management signature; clear risk description; residual risk level quantified; acceptance authority appropriate to risk level. Verify understanding of what is being accepted.
questions.auditor_focus: Does management understand and formally accept residual risk exposure? Is acceptance authority commensurate with risk level?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Management-signed acceptance forms with clear risk description and residual risk level quantified using methodology and acceptance authority appropriate to risk magnitude and dated within 12 months and evidence of informed decision-making
questions.red_flags: No formal acceptance; Acceptance without apparent understanding; Inappropriate authority level; Undated or stale acceptance; Blanket acceptance without specifics
questions.nc_pattern: Residual risk not formally accepted by appropriate management authority with documented understanding.

questions.question: Are information security objectives SMART and tracked?
questions.guidance: Objectives assessment. Look for: Specific objectives; Measurable KPIs with targets; Achievable within resources; Relevant to business; Time-bound milestones. Verify current performance tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you show current performance against defined objectives?
questions.what_good_looks_like: SMART objectives documented with specific KPIs and targets defined with baselines and current performance tracked and reported and variance analysis performed and management review of progress and objectives aligned with business strategy
questions.red_flags: Vague objectives; No measurable KPIs; Targets without actuals; No tracking mechanism; Objectives ignored in reviews; Not aligned with business
questions.nc_pattern: Information security objectives not measurable or not actively tracked against defined targets.

questions.question: Provide evidence of adequate ISMS resourcing.
questions.guidance: Resource adequacy review. Look for: budget allocation documents; headcount records; tool investments; training budget. Compare requested vs approved resources.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented security budget with approval and headcount aligned with ISMS requirements and tool and technology investments and training budget allocated and comparison of requested vs approved showing adequate support
questions.red_flags: No documented budget; Chronic under-resourcing; Resource requests consistently denied; No training budget; Tools not funded
questions.nc_pattern: ISMS resourcing inadequate or not demonstrably allocated through documented budget and headcount.

questions.question: Show me your competence framework for security roles.
questions.guidance: Competence requirements verification. Look for: role-based competency requirements documented; skills matrices; certification requirements such as CISSP and ISO 27001 Lead Implementer; job descriptions with security responsibilities.
questions.auditor_focus: Are competency requirements clear and verified?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Competency requirements documented per role and skills matrix maintained and certification requirements specified where appropriate and job descriptions include security responsibilities and competency gaps identified and addressed
questions.red_flags: No documented requirements; Generic requirements for all roles; No skills tracking; Certification requirements not enforced; No gap analysis
questions.nc_pattern: Competence framework not documented or competency requirements not verified for security roles.

questions.question: Provide security awareness training records with completion rates.
questions.guidance: Training effectiveness review. Look for: training completion tracking with target 95% or above; content topics; delivery dates; assessment results; follow-up for non-completion. Include phishing simulation results.
questions.auditor_focus: What is completion rate? How are non-completers followed up?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training completion rate 95% or above and content covering key topics and regular delivery schedule and assessment results tracked and non-completion followed up with escalation and phishing simulation results showing improvement trend
questions.red_flags: Completion below 95% without follow-up; No assessment; Non-completers not pursued; No phishing simulation; Content not updated; No management escalation
questions.nc_pattern: Security awareness training completion below target with inadequate follow-up procedures.

questions.question: Present your internal and external communication plan for the ISMS.
questions.guidance: Communication planning review. Look for: what to communicate; when to communicate; with whom to communicate; how to communicate. Including incident notification procedures and regulatory notification requirements under CPS 234.
questions.auditor_focus: Are communication channels clear for incidents?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Communication plan with defined messages and audiences and timing and channels and incident notification procedures including regulatory requirements and escalation matrix and templates available and regular review of effectiveness
questions.red_flags: No communication plan; Missing incident notification; Unclear channels; No escalation matrix; Regulatory notification not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: ISMS communication plan incomplete or missing critical incident notification procedures.

questions.question: How is documented information controlled?
questions.guidance: Document control verification. Look for: document control procedure; version history; access controls on sensitive documents; retention schedules; review schedule; approval workflows.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there a single source of truth? Are outdated versions controlled?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Document control procedure with version control and single source of truth established and access controls on sensitive documents and retention schedules defined and review schedule maintained and approval workflows enforced and obsolete documents controlled
questions.red_flags: Multiple versions in circulation; No version control; No access controls; Missing retention schedules; No review schedule; Approval bypassed
questions.nc_pattern: Document control inadequate with multiple versions or missing version control and review schedules.

questions.question: How is competence verified for new hires and role changes?
questions.guidance: Competence verification process. Look for: pre-employment verification; onboarding security training completion; probation assessments; role transition procedures with security consideration.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Pre-employment verification completed and onboarding security training tracked to completion and probation assessments include security competence and role transitions trigger competence review and evidence available for recent hires
questions.red_flags: No pre-employment verification; Training not tracked; Probation ignores security; Role changes without review; No evidence for recent hires
questions.nc_pattern: Competence verification not performed or documented for new hires and role changes.

questions.question: Provide evidence that operational security processes are implemented.
questions.guidance: Operational implementation review. Look for: documented procedures for change management and incident response and access management and backup/recovery. Evidence of execution including logs and tickets and approvals.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented operational procedures and evidence of execution including tickets and logs and approvals and consistent application across operations and regular procedure review and exceptions documented and approved
questions.red_flags: Procedures exist but not followed; No evidence of execution; Inconsistent application; Procedures outdated; Exceptions undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Operational security procedures documented but not consistently implemented or evidenced.

questions.question: Show me evidence of risk assessment at planned intervals.
questions.guidance: Risk assessment scheduling verification. Look for: risk assessment schedule with minimum annual frequency; completed assessments with dates; documented results feeding into treatment plan updates.
questions.auditor_focus: When was last assessment? Is it current?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Risk assessment schedule documented and assessments completed as scheduled with minimum annual frequency and results documented and dated and findings feeding into treatment plan updates and trigger-based assessments evident
questions.red_flags: No assessment schedule; Assessments overdue; Results not documented; No link to treatment plan; Trigger-based assessments missing
questions.nc_pattern: Risk assessment not conducted at planned intervals or results not integrated with treatment planning.

questions.question: Provide evidence that risk treatment is implemented according to plan.
questions.guidance: Treatment implementation tracking. Look for: treatment plan progress tracking; control implementation evidence; timeline adherence documentation; variance explanations where needed.
questions.auditor_focus: Are controls being implemented on schedule?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Treatment plan with progress tracking and control implementation evidence per planned item and timelines met or variances explained and escalated and regular status reporting and management visibility of progress
questions.red_flags: No progress tracking; Implementation delayed without escalation; No evidence of control implementation; Timelines missed; No management visibility
questions.nc_pattern: Risk treatment implementation delayed or not tracked against approved plan.

questions.question: How are outsourced processes controlled?
questions.guidance: Outsourced process governance review. Look for: supplier agreements with security requirements; monitoring of third-party compliance; audit rights documentation; security questionnaires such as SIG and CAIQ.
questions.auditor_focus: For material suppliers is there ongoing monitoring?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Supplier agreements include security requirements and ongoing compliance monitoring documented and audit rights in contracts and security questionnaires completed and material suppliers identified and prioritised and regular reassessment schedule
questions.red_flags: No security in contracts; No ongoing monitoring; Audit rights missing; No supplier assessment; Material suppliers not identified
questions.nc_pattern: Outsourced processes not adequately controlled through supplier agreements and ongoing monitoring.

questions.question: Show me how security changes are managed.
questions.guidance: Change management security review. Look for: change management records; security impact assessments for changes; approval workflows; back-out procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: Are security implications assessed before changes?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Change management procedure with security assessment step and security impact assessments documented and approval workflow including security sign-off and back-out procedures defined and post-implementation review includes security
questions.red_flags: No security in change process; Security assessment skipped; No approval workflow; Back-out not defined; No post-implementation review
questions.nc_pattern: Security changes not managed through documented change management with security impact assessment.

questions.question: Provide evidence of risk reassessment triggered by significant changes.
questions.guidance: Trigger-based reassessment verification. Look for: evidence of reassessment after new systems and applications and organisational changes and regulatory updates and security incidents. Trigger criteria must be documented.
questions.auditor_focus: What triggers reassessment? Show me a recent example.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented trigger criteria for reassessment and evidence of reassessments following triggers including new systems and org changes and incidents and reassessment results documented and treatment plan updated accordingly and examples available
questions.red_flags: No trigger criteria defined; Changes made without reassessment; Incidents not triggering review; No examples available; Treatment plan stale
questions.nc_pattern: Risk reassessment not triggered by significant changes despite documented trigger criteria.

questions.question: Provide your internal audit schedule and completed audit reports.
questions.guidance: Audit program review. Look for: audit schedule covering all ISMS requirements; completed reports for each audit; findings documented with severity. Schedule must be planned and not ad-hoc.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented audit schedule covering all ISMS requirements and completed reports per schedule and findings documented with severity classification and audit conducted by planned dates and schedule maintained proactively
questions.red_flags: No audit schedule; Audits ad-hoc; Reports missing; Findings not classified; Schedule frequently missed; No forward planning
questions.nc_pattern: Internal audits not conducted according to planned schedule or reports incomplete.

questions.question: Show me your audit coverage matrix demonstrating ALL ISMS requirements are audited within the certification cycle.
questions.guidance: Coverage completeness verification. Look for: matrix showing each clause and control; audit date; next audit date; coverage across 3-year cycle. No gaps allowed.
questions.auditor_focus: Will 100% coverage be achieved in 3 years?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Coverage matrix listing all clauses and controls and audit dates recorded and next audit dates scheduled and complete 3-year coverage planned with no gaps and evidence of coverage tracking and adjustments documented
questions.red_flags: Incomplete coverage; Some clauses never audited; No 3-year plan; Coverage gaps; No tracking mechanism; Matrix not maintained
questions.nc_pattern: Audit coverage matrix incomplete or does not demonstrate full ISMS coverage within certification cycle.

questions.question: Provide evidence that auditors are independent from areas they audit.
questions.guidance: Auditor independence verification. Look for: auditor assignments showing no self-audit; auditor competency records including ISO 27001 Lead Auditor training; independence declarations.
questions.auditor_focus: Did the IT manager audit IT controls? Not allowed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Auditor assignments documented showing no self-audit and independence declarations signed and auditor competency records including Lead Auditor training and rotation where appropriate and independence conflicts identified and managed
questions.red_flags: Self-audit evident; No independence declarations; Competency not verified; Same auditor for related areas; Conflicts not managed
questions.nc_pattern: Internal auditors not demonstrably independent from areas audited or competency not verified.

questions.question: Present minutes from your last three Management Review meetings.
questions.guidance: Management review completeness check. Look for: minutes explicitly covering ALL mandatory inputs including: a) status of actions from previous reviews; b) changes in external and internal issues; c) feedback on information security performance including nonconformities and corrective actions and monitoring and measurement results and audit results; d) fulfilment of objectives; e) feedback from interested parties; f) results of risk assessment and treatment plan status; g) opportunities for continual improvement.
questions.auditor_focus: Are all mandatory inputs explicitly addressed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Minutes from three recent reviews and all mandatory inputs a through g explicitly addressed and documented and decisions recorded with owners and dates and follow-up actions tracked and attendance of appropriate management and agenda structured to ISO requirements
questions.red_flags: Missing mandatory inputs; Inputs addressed superficially; Decisions not recorded; No follow-up tracking; Poor attendance; Unstructured agenda
questions.nc_pattern: Management review meetings do not explicitly address all mandatory ISO 27001 inputs.

questions.question: Show me your information security KPIs and performance metrics.
questions.guidance: Metric effectiveness review. Look for: incident counts; MTTR; vulnerability remediation times; training completion; control effectiveness; access review completion. With targets and actuals.
questions.auditor_focus: Are metrics meaningful? What do they tell you?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Meaningful KPIs defined with targets and actuals tracked and reported and incident metrics including count and MTTR and vulnerability remediation times and training completion and control effectiveness measures and access review completion rates
questions.red_flags: Metrics collected but not meaningful; Targets without actuals; No trend analysis; Metrics ignored; KPIs not aligned with objectives
questions.nc_pattern: Information security KPIs not meaningful or not tracked with actuals or not aligned with objectives.

questions.question: Provide evidence that monitoring results are analysed and evaluated.
questions.guidance: Analysis effectiveness review. Look for: trend analysis reports; management presentations showing insights; action items from metric reviews; improvement initiatives triggered by data.
questions.auditor_focus: What changed as a result of the analysis?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Trend analysis documented and management presentations with insights and action items from reviews tracked to completion and improvement initiatives triggered by data analysis and evidence of decisions based on analysis
questions.red_flags: Analysis not documented; No management presentations; Action items not tracked; No improvements from data; Analysis without action
questions.nc_pattern: Monitoring results analysed but not evaluated or actioned to drive improvement.

questions.question: For CPS 234: Show me evidence of internal audit reviewing design AND operating effectiveness of controls.
questions.guidance: CPS 234 compliance verification. Look for: audit reports explicitly assessing both design adequacy and operational effectiveness. Not just control exists but control works as intended.
questions.auditor_focus: CPS 234 para 32 requires both design and operating effectiveness.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Audit reports explicitly assessing design adequacy meaning control appropriately designed and operating effectiveness tested meaning control works as intended and both dimensions covered per control and methodology documented and findings differentiated by type
questions.red_flags: Design only assessment; No operating effectiveness testing; Methodology unclear; Findings not differentiated; Control existence without effectiveness
questions.nc_pattern: Internal audit does not assess both design and operating effectiveness of controls as required by CPS 234.

questions.question: Provide your nonconformity register.
questions.guidance: NCR tracking review. Look for: all identified nonconformities; classification as major or minor; root cause analysis; corrective actions; closure status; effectiveness verification.
questions.auditor_focus: Are all NCs tracked to closure?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Complete NCR register with all nonconformities and classification applied and root cause analysis documented and corrective actions assigned with owners and dates and closure status tracked and effectiveness verification recorded
questions.red_flags: Incomplete register; No classification; Root cause missing; Actions not assigned; Closure not tracked; No effectiveness verification
questions.nc_pattern: Nonconformity register incomplete or nonconformities not tracked through to verified closure.

questions.question: Show me root cause analysis documentation for recent nonconformities.
questions.guidance: RCA quality review. Look for: 5 Whys or Fishbone diagrams documented; clear distinction between correction as symptom fix and corrective action as root cause elimination.
questions.auditor_focus: Is the ROOT cause identified or just the symptom?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Root cause analysis using structured method such as 5 Whys or Fishbone and clear identification of true root cause and distinction between correction and corrective action and analysis documented with evidence and multiple perspectives considered
questions.red_flags: Symptom treated as root cause; No structured analysis method; Correction confused with corrective action; Analysis superficial; Single perspective only
questions.nc_pattern: Root cause analysis does not identify true root cause and treats symptoms rather than underlying issues.

questions.question: Provide evidence of corrective action effectiveness verification.
questions.guidance: Effectiveness verification review. Look for: verification records showing action taken; verification method; evidence that recurrence prevented; verification date and by whom.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know the action worked?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Verification records per corrective action and verification method documented and evidence of recurrence prevention and verification performed after appropriate interval and verifier independent where practical and verification findings recorded
questions.red_flags: No verification performed; Verification immediate without time to prove effectiveness; Recurrence not checked; Self-verification; No findings recorded
questions.nc_pattern: Corrective action effectiveness not verified or verification method inadequate to demonstrate recurrence prevention.

questions.question: What ISMS improvements have been made in the past 12 months?
questions.guidance: Improvement evidence review. Look for: documented enhancements including new controls and process improvements and tool implementations and control strengthening. With business case and outcomes.
questions.auditor_focus: Is improvement genuine or just documentation updates?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented improvements over 12 months and new controls implemented and process improvements with measurable outcomes and tool implementations and control strengthening evidence and business case documented and outcomes measured
questions.red_flags: Documentation updates only; No substantive improvements; Improvements claimed without evidence; No outcomes measured; Reactive improvements only
questions.nc_pattern: ISMS improvements not evidenced or limited to documentation updates without substantive security enhancement.

questions.question: How are improvement opportunities identified?
questions.guidance: Opportunity identification review. Look for: documented sources including audit findings and incident lessons learned and risk assessment updates and management reviews and industry developments and threat intelligence.
questions.auditor_focus: Is improvement proactive or only reactive?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple sources documented for improvement identification including SMART improvement objectives and proactive monitoring of industry developments and threat intelligence integration and audit findings systematically reviewed and incident lessons learned captured and management review outputs actioned
questions.red_flags: Reactive improvements only; Single source; No proactive monitoring; Threat intelligence not used; Audit findings ignored; No systematic approach
questions.nc_pattern: Improvement opportunities identified reactively only without proactive identification mechanisms.

questions.question: Provide evidence of lessons learned from incidents being applied.
questions.guidance: Lessons learned application review. Look for: post-incident review reports; control improvements implemented; training updates; procedure changes. Traceable from incident to improvement.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you trace a specific incident to a specific improvement?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Post-incident reviews documented and lessons learned captured and control improvements implemented and evidenced and training updated where relevant and procedures changed and traceability from incident to improvement demonstrable
questions.red_flags: No post-incident reviews; Lessons identified but not applied; No traceability; Training not updated; Procedures unchanged despite incidents
questions.nc_pattern: Lessons learned from incidents not systematically applied to improve controls and training or procedures.

questions.question: Provide the documented information security policy with executive approval.
questions.guidance: Policy approval verification. Look for: CEO or Board signature; approval date within 12 months; version control; organisation-specific content aligned with regulatory requirements.
questions.auditor_focus: Is policy current and approved at appropriate level?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Executive-signed policy dated within 12 months and clear version control and organisation-specific content throughout and aligned with regulatory requirements and communication plan documented
questions.red_flags: Unsigned or undated policy; Approval over 12 months old; Generic template content; No version control; Policy not aligned with regulatory requirements
questions.nc_pattern: Information security policy lacks current executive approval or is not organisation-specific.

questions.question: Present your topic-specific policies for key security areas.
questions.guidance: Policy coverage assessment. Look for: access control; encryption and cryptography; acceptable use; incident response; data classification; remote work; supplier security; cloud security policies.
questions.auditor_focus: Coverage of all key areas? Are they consistent with main policy?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Topic-specific policies covering all key security domains and consistent with main policy and current versions and approved by appropriate authority and accessible to relevant personnel
questions.red_flags: Missing key topic policies; Inconsistent with main policy; Outdated versions; Conflicting requirements between policies
questions.nc_pattern: Topic-specific security policies missing or inconsistent with main information security policy.

questions.question: Provide distribution and acknowledgment records for all relevant personnel.
questions.guidance: Policy communication verification. Look for: distribution records; acknowledgment signatures electronic accepted; intranet or policy portal access logs. Target: 100% acknowledgment for applicable staff.
questions.auditor_focus: What is acknowledgment rate? How are non-acknowledgers followed up?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Distribution records showing all relevant personnel and acknowledgment rate approaching 100% and follow-up process for non-acknowledgers and new starter acknowledgment tracked and annual re-acknowledgment cycle
questions.red_flags: Low acknowledgment rate; No follow-up for non-acknowledgers; New starters not tracked; No re-acknowledgment cycle; Distribution incomplete
questions.nc_pattern: Policy acknowledgment rate below target with no documented follow-up for non-compliance.

questions.question: Show me evidence that policies are reviewed at planned intervals.
questions.guidance: Policy review cycle verification. Look for: review schedule minimum annual; review meeting minutes; version history showing updates; change log with rationale.
questions.auditor_focus: When was last review? What changed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Annual review schedule documented and review meeting minutes available and version history showing updates and change log with rationale for changes and next review date scheduled
questions.red_flags: No review schedule; Reviews overdue; No version history; Changes made without documented rationale; Review is checkbox exercise
questions.nc_pattern: Policies not reviewed at planned intervals or review process lacks documented rigour.

questions.question: How do policies address regulatory requirements?
questions.guidance: Regulatory alignment verification. Look for: policy coverage of information security capability; policy framework; information assets; third parties; incident management aligned with applicable regulations.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you map policy content to regulatory requirements?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Policies mapped to regulatory requirements with traceability matrix and coverage of all applicable regulatory areas and regular review for regulatory changes and gap analysis documented
questions.red_flags: No regulatory mapping; Missing coverage of key regulatory areas; Policies not updated for regulatory changes; No traceability
questions.nc_pattern: Policies do not demonstrably address applicable regulatory requirements.

questions.question: How are policy exceptions handled?
questions.guidance: Exception management review. Look for: exception request process; approval authority; compensating controls documentation; time-limited exceptions with review dates.
questions.auditor_focus: Are exceptions controlled or is policy bypassed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented exception request process and appropriate approval authority defined and compensating controls required and time-limited with review dates and exception register maintained
questions.red_flags: No exception process; Blanket exceptions; No compensating controls; Permanent exceptions without review; No exception tracking
questions.nc_pattern: Policy exceptions granted without documented process or compensating controls.

questions.question: Provide your RACI matrix or equivalent defining all security roles.
questions.guidance: Role definition verification. Look for: RACI with named individuals not just titles; all security functions covered; alignment with organisation chart; no orphan responsibilities.
questions.auditor_focus: Are all responsibilities assigned? Any gaps?
questions.what_good_looks_like: RACI with named individuals and all security functions covered and clear single accountability per function and alignment with organisation chart and no orphan responsibilities and regular review evidence
questions.red_flags: Roles without names; Gaps in coverage; Multiple accountabilities; Misalignment with org chart; No review evidence; Orphan responsibilities
questions.nc_pattern: Security roles and responsibilities not clearly defined or assigned to named individuals.

questions.question: Show me the CISO or ISO job description and reporting line.
questions.guidance: Security leadership assessment. Look for: job description with security responsibilities; reporting line to executive level; authority documented; independence from operations.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Job description with clear security responsibilities and reporting line to executive level documented and authority to make security decisions and independence from operational IT and appropriate seniority
questions.red_flags: No documented JD; Reports to operational IT only; No executive access; Authority unclear; Insufficient seniority
questions.nc_pattern: Security leadership role lacks documented authority or appropriate reporting line.

questions.question: Provide the asset owner register showing security responsibilities.
questions.guidance: Asset ownership verification. Look for: owner assignment for each asset; documented owner responsibilities for security decisions; sign-off records.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Asset register with named owner for each asset and documented owner responsibilities and sign-off acknowledging responsibilities and regular review of assignments and owner competence verified
questions.red_flags: No owners assigned; Responsibilities not documented; No sign-off records; Owners unaware of responsibilities; Stale assignments
questions.nc_pattern: Asset owners not assigned or do not understand their security responsibilities.

questions.question: How are security responsibilities verified during staff interviews?
questions.guidance: Responsibility awareness verification. Look for: sample interview questions used; expected answers; actual responses from recent interviews demonstrating awareness.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Interview questions documented and expected answers defined and recent interview records available and staff able to articulate responsibilities and gaps identified and addressed
questions.red_flags: No interview process; Staff unaware of responsibilities; No documentation of interviews; Gaps not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Staff unable to articulate their security responsibilities when interviewed.

questions.question: How are responsibilities communicated during onboarding?
questions.guidance: Onboarding process review. Look for: induction program security content; role-specific training; responsibility acknowledgment sign-off.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Induction program includes security responsibilities and role-specific content provided and acknowledgment sign-off obtained and records maintained and evidence available for recent new starters
questions.red_flags: No security in induction; Generic content only; No acknowledgment; Records not maintained; Cannot evidence recent starters
questions.nc_pattern: Security responsibilities not communicated during onboarding process.

questions.question: How are responsibilities updated when roles change?
questions.guidance: Role change management review. Look for: role change procedures; access review triggers; responsibility reassignment; documentation updates.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me a recent role change example.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Role change procedures documented and access review triggered on role change and responsibilities reassigned and documented and example of recent role change available and timely updates made
questions.red_flags: No role change procedures; Access not reviewed; Responsibilities not updated; No documentation; Delays in updates
questions.nc_pattern: Security responsibilities not updated when personnel change roles.

questions.question: Provide your segregation of duties matrix showing incompatible roles.
questions.guidance: SoD matrix review. Look for: incompatible combinations documented including requestor and approver and developer and deployer and admin and auditor; system enforced where possible.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive SoD matrix with all incompatible role combinations and system enforcement where possible and regular review of matrix and aligned with access control and covers all critical processes
questions.red_flags: Missing key combinations; No system enforcement; Matrix not reviewed; Misaligned with actual access; Limited scope
questions.nc_pattern: Segregation of duties matrix incomplete or does not cover all incompatible role combinations.

questions.question: Show me how segregation is enforced in your CI/CD pipeline.
questions.guidance: DevOps segregation verification. Look for: developers cannot deploy to production; four-eyes principle on deployments; approval gates enforced in pipeline.
questions.auditor_focus: Can a single person make production changes?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Developers cannot deploy to production and four-eyes principle enforced and approval gates in pipeline and audit trail of deployments and separation of dev and prod environments
questions.red_flags: Single person can deploy; No approval gates; Shared credentials; No audit trail; Dev and prod not separated
questions.nc_pattern: CI/CD pipeline allows single person to make production changes without approval.

questions.question: How is segregation maintained for financial and payment systems?
questions.guidance: Financial controls verification. Look for: payment approval limits; dual authorisation requirements; system controls preventing self-approval; audit trails.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Payment approval limits documented and dual authorisation enforced and system prevents self-approval and complete audit trails and regular review of limits and thresholds appropriate to risk
questions.red_flags: No approval limits; Self-approval possible; No dual authorisation; Incomplete audit trails; Limits not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Financial system segregation inadequate with potential for self-approval or single person authorisation.

questions.question: Provide evidence of periodic review of access combinations for conflicts.
questions.guidance: Access conflict review verification. Look for: quarterly or annual access review reports; conflict detection results; remediation of identified conflicts.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regular access reviews conducted and conflict detection performed and conflicts identified documented and remediation tracked and evidence of reviews detecting actual conflicts
questions.red_flags: No periodic reviews; Conflicts not detected; No remediation tracking; Reviews superficial; No evidence of detections
questions.nc_pattern: Access reviews not conducted or not detecting segregation of duties conflicts.

questions.question: How are exceptions to segregation handled?
questions.guidance: SoD exception management review. Look for: exception approval process; compensating controls documented; time-limited access with review; monitoring of exceptions.
questions.auditor_focus: Are exceptions controlled or permanent workarounds?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Exception approval process documented and compensating controls required and time-limited with end date and enhanced monitoring in place and regular review of exceptions and exception register maintained
questions.red_flags: No exception process; Permanent exceptions; No compensating controls; Exceptions not monitored; No register
questions.nc_pattern: Segregation of duties exceptions granted without compensating controls or time limits.

questions.question: How does management require personnel to apply security policies?
questions.guidance: Management enforcement review. Look for: policy acknowledgment requirements; performance expectations; employment contract clauses; consequences for non-compliance documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Policy acknowledgment mandatory and performance expectations include security and contract clauses cover security obligations and consequences for non-compliance documented and communicated
questions.red_flags: No acknowledgment required; Security not in performance; No contract clauses; No consequences documented; Expectations unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Management requirements for security policy compliance not documented or enforceable.

questions.question: How is compliance with security policies monitored?
questions.guidance: Compliance monitoring verification. Look for: compliance monitoring mechanisms; automated checks where possible; manual reviews; non-compliance reporting.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance monitoring mechanisms in place and automated checks where possible and manual reviews conducted and non-compliance reported and trends tracked and remediation tracked
questions.red_flags: No monitoring mechanisms; Monitoring not occurring; Non-compliance not reported; No evidence of checks; Trends not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Security policy compliance not actively monitored or non-compliance not reported.

questions.question: Is security included in performance evaluations?
questions.guidance: Performance integration review. Look for: performance criteria including security compliance; training completion; incident involvement tracked in performance.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security compliance in performance criteria and training completion tracked and incident involvement considered and documented in evaluations and example available and consistent application
questions.red_flags: Security not in performance criteria; Training not tracked; Incidents ignored; No documentation; Inconsistent application
questions.nc_pattern: Security compliance not included in personnel performance evaluations.

questions.question: How are contractors required to follow security policies?
questions.guidance: Contractor compliance review. Look for: contract clauses; policy acknowledgment for non-employees; compliance monitoring; access restrictions appropriate to role.
questions.auditor_focus: Are contractors treated equivalently to employees?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security clauses in contracts and policy acknowledgment required and compliance monitoring applied and access restrictions appropriate and equivalent treatment to employees for security obligations
questions.red_flags: No contract clauses; No acknowledgment required; No monitoring; Unrestricted access; Lower standards than employees
questions.nc_pattern: Contractors not required to follow security policies or compliance not monitored.

questions.question: Provide evidence of management communications about security.
questions.guidance: Management visibility review. Look for: management communications; all-hands mentions; newsletters; security awareness campaigns sponsored by management.
questions.auditor_focus: Is security visibly supported by management?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regular management communications about security and all-hands presentations and newsletters and awareness campaigns with management sponsorship and consistent messaging
questions.red_flags: No management communications; Security not mentioned; No visible support; Ad-hoc only; No sponsorship
questions.nc_pattern: Management does not visibly communicate support for information security.

questions.question: Provide your authority contact register.
questions.guidance: Authority contact verification. Look for: contact list including relevant regulators and law enforcement and privacy authorities; contact details; circumstances for contact; responsible contact persons.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Complete authority contact register with regulators and law enforcement and privacy authorities and contact details current and circumstances defined and responsible persons assigned and regular review
questions.red_flags: Incomplete register; Missing key authorities; Outdated contacts; No circumstances defined; No responsible persons
questions.nc_pattern: Authority contact register incomplete or contact details not current.

questions.question: Show me your notification procedures for material security incidents.
questions.guidance: Regulatory notification review. Look for: notification procedures; timeline requirements; escalation matrix; notification templates; decision criteria for materiality.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you meet regulatory notification requirements?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Notification procedures documented and timeline requirements clear and escalation matrix defined and templates available and materiality criteria documented and tested through exercises
questions.red_flags: No notification procedures; Timeline unclear; No escalation matrix; No templates; Materiality not defined
questions.nc_pattern: Security incident notification procedures do not meet regulatory timeline requirements.

questions.question: Provide your material weakness notification procedures.
questions.guidance: Weakness notification review. Look for: notification procedures for material control weaknesses; escalation criteria; notification content requirements; timeline compliance.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Material weakness notification procedures documented and escalation criteria defined and notification content specified and timeline compliance tracked and regular review of procedures
questions.red_flags: No weakness notification procedures; Triggers unclear; No escalation criteria; Timeline not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Material control weakness notification procedures not documented or triggers unclear.

questions.question: How are legal and regulatory changes monitored and assessed?
questions.guidance: Regulatory monitoring review. Look for: regulatory monitoring process; legal updates tracking; impact assessment procedure; implementation timeline tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you stay current with regulatory changes?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regulatory monitoring process documented and legal updates tracked and impact assessments conducted and implementation timelines tracked and responsible party assigned and regular reporting
questions.red_flags: No monitoring process; Legal updates not tracked; No impact assessments; Timelines not tracked; No accountability
questions.nc_pattern: Legal and regulatory changes not systematically monitored or assessed for impact.

questions.question: Provide evidence of authority relationship maintenance.
questions.guidance: Relationship management review. Look for: meeting records with regulators; correspondence; participation in regulatory consultations; industry forum participation.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regular engagement with authorities and meeting records maintained and correspondence documented and participation in consultations and proactive relationship management and industry forum involvement
questions.red_flags: No engagement; Reactive only; No records; No participation; No industry involvement
questions.nc_pattern: Authority relationships not proactively maintained or engagement not documented.

questions.question: Provide a list of security forums and professional associations you engage with.
questions.guidance: Community engagement review. Look for: memberships in professional associations; threat intelligence sharing communities; vendor groups; CERT contacts documented.
questions.auditor_focus: Active membership or just passive subscription?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Active memberships in relevant associations and threat intelligence sharing participation and vendor community engagement and CERT relationships established and participation documented
questions.red_flags: No memberships; Passive subscriptions only; No threat sharing; No CERT contact; No documentation
questions.nc_pattern: Security community engagement limited to passive subscription without active participation.

questions.question: How are personnel supported to participate in security communities?
questions.guidance: Professional development review. Look for: membership sponsorship; conference attendance; time allocation for professional development; training budgets.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Membership sponsorship provided and conference attendance supported and time allocated for development and training budgets available and participation encouraged by management
questions.red_flags: No sponsorship; No conference attendance; No time allocation; No budget; Participation discouraged
questions.nc_pattern: Personnel not supported to participate in security professional communities.

questions.question: How is external threat intelligence received and processed?
questions.guidance: Intelligence processing review. Look for: intelligence feeds subscriptions; CERT advisories monitoring; vendor security bulletins; processing workflow documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple intelligence sources subscribed and CERT advisories monitored and vendor bulletins tracked and processing workflow documented and timely assessment and action tracking
questions.red_flags: No intelligence feeds; CERT not monitored; Bulletins ignored; No workflow; Delayed processing
questions.nc_pattern: External threat intelligence not systematically received or processed.

questions.question: Show me how intelligence from external sources has been acted upon.
questions.guidance: Intelligence action verification. Look for: recent examples of advisory received and assessment conducted and action taken or determined not applicable with timeline.
questions.auditor_focus: Is intelligence actionable or just filed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Recent examples of intelligence actioned and timeline documented and assessment records available and actions tracked to completion and not applicable determinations justified
questions.red_flags: No examples available; Intelligence not actioned; No assessment records; Actions not tracked; Filed without review
questions.nc_pattern: External threat intelligence received but not assessed or actioned.

questions.question: Do you share lessons learned with the security community?
questions.guidance: Community contribution review. Look for: conference presentations; industry working group participation; anonymised incident sharing; publications.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Conference presentations given and working group participation and anonymised incident sharing and blog posts or publications and active contribution documented
questions.red_flags: No presentations; No working group participation; No sharing; No publications; Consumption only
questions.nc_pattern: Organisation does not contribute lessons learned to security community.

questions.question: Describe your threat intelligence collection process.
questions.guidance: Intelligence program review. Look for: documented program with sources; collection methods; analysis process; dissemination procedures; responsibilities assigned.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented threat intelligence program and sources identified and collection methods defined and analysis process documented and dissemination procedures in place and responsibilities assigned
questions.red_flags: No documented program; Ad-hoc collection; No analysis process; No dissemination procedures; Responsibilities unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Threat intelligence program not documented or operates ad-hoc without structure.

questions.question: What threat intelligence sources do you utilise?
questions.guidance: Source coverage review. Look for: commercial feeds; open source intelligence including MITRE ATT&CK and vulnerability databases; government sources including ACSC and CERT-Australia for Australian entities; ISACs; vendor bulletins. Consider strategic and tactical and operational intelligence.
questions.auditor_focus: Appropriate sources for your risk profile?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple source types utilised and commercial feeds where appropriate and open source intelligence monitored and government sources tracked and ISAC participation and vendor bulletins received
questions.red_flags: Limited sources; No commercial feeds for high-risk profile; Open source ignored; Government sources not used; No ISAC
questions.nc_pattern: Threat intelligence sources insufficient for organisation risk profile.

questions.question: How is threat intelligence analysed and prioritised?
questions.guidance: Analysis methodology review. Look for: analysis methodology documented; relevance assessment criteria including industry and technology and geography; prioritisation based on risk profile.
questions.auditor_focus: Is analysis documented or just forwarding alerts?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Analysis methodology documented and relevance criteria defined including industry and technology and geography and prioritisation based on risk profile and documented analysis records and actionable outputs produced and trends identified and integration with risk assessment
questions.red_flags: No methodology; Alerts forwarded without analysis; No relevance assessment; No prioritisation; No documented analysis
questions.nc_pattern: Threat intelligence not analysed or prioritised based on organisation risk profile.

questions.question: Show me how threat intelligence feeds into risk assessment.
questions.guidance: Intelligence integration review. Look for: evidence of threat updates informing risk register; emerging threats added; risk scoring adjusted based on intelligence.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there integration or are they separate processes?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Threat intelligence updates risk register and emerging threats documented and risk scoring adjusted and integration documented and regular updates and clear linkage between intelligence and risk
questions.red_flags: Separate processes; Risk register not updated; Emerging threats not captured; No integration; Intelligence ignored in risk
questions.nc_pattern: Threat intelligence not integrated with risk assessment process.

questions.question: How is actionable intelligence communicated?
questions.guidance: Intelligence dissemination review. Look for: distribution process; urgency levels defined; response coordination; notification channels; tracking to resolution.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you show a recent actionable alert and response?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Distribution process documented and urgency levels defined and response coordination clear and notification channels established and tracking to resolution and recent example available
questions.red_flags: No distribution process; Urgency not defined; No coordination; Ad-hoc notification; No tracking
questions.nc_pattern: Actionable threat intelligence not communicated effectively or tracked to resolution.

questions.question: Provide your project management methodology showing security integration.
questions.guidance: Security integration review. Look for: project lifecycle with security gates; templates including security sections; mandatory security checkpoints at initiation and design and go-live.
questions.auditor_focus: Is security embedded or an afterthought?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Project methodology includes security gates and templates have security sections and mandatory checkpoints at key stages and security embedded throughout and not just at go-live
questions.red_flags: No security gates; Templates lack security; No mandatory checkpoints; Security at go-live only; Afterthought approach
questions.nc_pattern: Security not integrated into project management methodology.

questions.question: Show me security requirements templates used in project initiation.
questions.guidance: Requirements capture review. Look for: security requirements checklist; risk assessment template; early engagement trigger with security team.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security requirements checklist available and risk assessment template used and early engagement triggers defined and security team involved at initiation and requirements documented before design
questions.red_flags: No checklist; No risk template; Late engagement; Security not at initiation; Requirements not captured early
questions.nc_pattern: Security requirements not captured at project initiation stage.

questions.question: How is threat modeling performed for new projects?
questions.guidance: Threat modeling review. Look for: threat modeling methodology such as STRIDE or PASTA; completed examples; timing in project lifecycle defined.
questions.auditor_focus: When is threat modeling done? By whom?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Threat modeling methodology documented and completed examples available and timing defined in lifecycle and qualified personnel conduct and results feed into design and tracked to resolution
questions.red_flags: No threat modeling; No methodology; No examples; Timing undefined; Unqualified personnel; Results ignored
questions.nc_pattern: Threat modeling not performed for new projects or methodology undefined.

questions.question: Provide evidence of security architecture review for recent projects.
questions.guidance: Architecture review verification. Look for: architecture review records; security sign-off; issues identified and tracked; remediation before go-live.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me a recent project's security review.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Architecture review records available and security sign-off documented and issues identified and tracked and remediation completed before go-live and recent examples available
questions.red_flags: No architecture reviews; No sign-off; Issues not tracked; Remediation incomplete; No recent examples
questions.nc_pattern: Security architecture reviews not conducted for projects or issues not tracked.

questions.question: How are security requirements tracked through the project lifecycle?
questions.guidance: Requirements traceability review. Look for: requirements traceability; status reporting; security items in project dashboard; closure verification.
questions.auditor_focus: Are security items visible to project managers?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Requirements traced through lifecycle and status reported and security in project dashboards and closure verified and visible to project managers and complete audit trail
questions.red_flags: No traceability; Status not reported; Not in dashboards; Closure not verified; Not visible to PMs
questions.nc_pattern: Security requirements not tracked through project lifecycle.

questions.question: Is security sign-off mandatory before go-live?
questions.guidance: Go-live gate review. Look for: sign-off procedure documented; criteria for approval; authority to block deployment; exception process.
questions.auditor_focus: Can projects go live without security approval?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security sign-off procedure documented and approval criteria defined and authority to block deployment and exception process documented and evidence of enforcement
questions.red_flags: No sign-off procedure; Criteria undefined; No blocking authority; No exception process; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: Security sign-off not mandatory before project go-live or can be bypassed.

controls.control_name: Inventory of Information and Associated Assets

questions.question: Provide your complete information asset inventory.
questions.guidance: Asset inventory review. Look for: hardware; software; data repositories; services; cloud resources; personnel assets documented with classification and criticality ratings.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive asset inventory including all asset types and classification applied and criticality ratings assigned and owners documented and regular updates and reconciliation with discovery
questions.red_flags: Incomplete inventory; Missing asset types; No classification; No criticality; No owners; Outdated
questions.nc_pattern: Information asset inventory incomplete or missing significant asset categories.

questions.question: Show me how asset owners are assigned and documented.
questions.guidance: Ownership verification. Look for: owner assignment process; documented responsibilities for each owner; sign-off records acknowledging ownership.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Owner assignment process documented and responsibilities defined and sign-off records available and owners understand accountability and regular review of assignments and coverage complete
questions.red_flags: No assignment process; Responsibilities unclear; No sign-off; Owners unaware; Assignments stale; Gaps in coverage
questions.nc_pattern: Asset owners not assigned or do not understand their security responsibilities.

questions.question: How are cloud services and SaaS applications tracked?
questions.guidance: Cloud asset discovery review. Look for: cloud asset discovery process; shadow IT detection; approved cloud services list; unapproved service handling.
questions.auditor_focus: What is your shadow IT detection capability?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Cloud discovery process in place and shadow IT detection capability and approved services list maintained and unapproved services addressed and regular reconciliation and CASB or similar deployed
questions.red_flags: No cloud tracking; No shadow IT detection; No approved list; Unapproved services ignored; No reconciliation
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud services and SaaS applications not tracked or shadow IT not detected.

questions.question: Provide evidence of asset inventory review within the last 12 months.
questions.guidance: Inventory currency review. Look for: review records; updates made; reconciliation with discovery tools; verification of owner assignments.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Inventory reviewed within 12 months and updates documented and reconciliation with discovery tools and owner assignments verified and regular review cycle and changes tracked
questions.red_flags: No recent review; Updates not documented; No reconciliation; Owners not verified; Irregular reviews
questions.nc_pattern: Asset inventory not reviewed within required intervals.

questions.question: How is asset criticality determined?
questions.guidance: Criticality assessment review. Look for: criticality criteria including business impact and data sensitivity and regulatory requirements; documented classification per asset.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Criticality criteria documented and business impact considered and data sensitivity assessed and regulatory requirements factored and classification per asset and critical assets identified
questions.red_flags: No criticality criteria; Business impact ignored; Sensitivity not assessed; Regulatory not considered; Critical assets unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Asset criticality not determined using documented criteria.

questions.question: Is there automated asset discovery?
questions.guidance: Discovery automation review. Look for: discovery tools deployed; integration with CMDB; reconciliation process with manual inventory; coverage percentage.
