questions.auditor_focus: What percentage of assets are automatically discovered?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Automated discovery tools deployed and integrated with CMDB and reconciliation with manual inventory and high coverage percentage and gaps identified and addressed
questions.red_flags: No automated discovery; No CMDB integration; No reconciliation; Low coverage; Gaps not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Automated asset discovery not implemented or coverage inadequate.

controls.control_name: Acceptable Use of Information and Assets

questions.question: Provide your acceptable use policy.
questions.guidance: AUP coverage review. Look for: internet use; email; mobile devices; social media; personal devices BYOD; removable media covered.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive AUP covering all use cases and internet and email and mobile and social media and BYOD and removable media and current and communicated
questions.red_flags: Missing use cases; Outdated policy; Not comprehensive; BYOD not addressed; Removable media ignored
questions.nc_pattern: Acceptable use policy incomplete or does not cover all information asset use cases.

questions.question: Show me data handling procedures by classification level.
questions.guidance: Data handling review. Look for: handling matrix with storage requirements; transmission methods; disposal procedures per classification level.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Handling procedures per classification level and storage requirements defined and transmission methods specified and disposal procedures documented and practical and staff trained
questions.red_flags: No handling procedures; Classification not linked; Storage undefined; Transmission unclear; Disposal missing
questions.nc_pattern: Data handling procedures not defined for each classification level.

questions.question: Provide acknowledgment records for the acceptable use policy.
questions.guidance: AUP acknowledgment review. Look for: signed acknowledgments; electronic acceptance records; annual re-acknowledgment; new starter sign-off.
questions.what_good_looks_like: High acknowledgment rate and electronic acceptance tracked and annual re-acknowledgment and new starter sign-off and follow-up for non-acknowledgers and records maintained
questions.red_flags: Low acknowledgment rate; No tracking; No re-acknowledgment; New starters missed; No follow-up
questions.nc_pattern: Acceptable use policy acknowledgment rate below target or new starters not tracked.

questions.question: How is compliance with acceptable use monitored?
questions.guidance: AUP compliance monitoring review. Look for: technical controls including DLP and web filtering and USB control; manual audits; violation detection and response.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Technical controls deployed and DLP and web filtering and USB control and manual audits conducted and violations detected and response documented
questions.red_flags: No technical controls; Monitoring not active; Violations not detected; No response process; Manual only
questions.nc_pattern: Acceptable use policy compliance not actively monitored or violations not detected.

questions.question: How are acceptable use violations handled?
questions.guidance: Violation handling review. Look for: violation response procedure; disciplinary linkage; escalation path; recent examples anonymised.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Violation response procedure documented and disciplinary linkage clear and escalation path defined and consistent enforcement and examples available anonymised
questions.red_flags: No response procedure; No disciplinary link; No escalation; Inconsistent enforcement; No examples
questions.nc_pattern: Acceptable use violations not handled consistently or consequences not enforced.

questions.question: Provide your asset return process for departing personnel.
questions.guidance: Offboarding process review. Look for: offboarding checklist; asset return verification; HR and IT integration; final clearance dependency on return.
questions.auditor_focus: Is return verification linked to final pay?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Offboarding checklist includes asset return and return verification documented and HR and IT integrated and final clearance linked to return and consistent process
questions.red_flags: No offboarding checklist; No verification; HR IT not integrated; Clearance not linked; Inconsistent process
questions.nc_pattern: Asset return process not documented or not integrated with offboarding.

questions.question: What assets are tracked for return?
questions.guidance: Asset return scope review. Look for: complete list including laptops; phones; tablets; access cards; keys; tokens; documents; software licenses; company data.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Complete asset list for return and all device types and access cards and keys and tokens and documents and licenses and data and comprehensive coverage
questions.red_flags: Incomplete list; Missing asset types; Access cards missed; Data not addressed; License return ignored
questions.nc_pattern: Asset return tracking does not cover all asset types.

questions.question: How is asset return verified and documented?
questions.guidance: Return verification review. Look for: return receipt; condition assessment; data verification wiped; sign-off by multiple parties; audit trail.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me a recent leaver's asset return record.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Return receipts issued and condition assessed and data wipe verified and multiple sign-offs and audit trail maintained and recent examples available
questions.red_flags: No receipts; Condition not assessed; Data wipe not verified; Single sign-off; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Asset return not verified or documented with appropriate sign-off.

questions.question: What happens when assets cannot be returned?
questions.guidance: Non-return handling review. Look for: remote wipe capability for devices; written confirmation of destruction; cost recovery procedures; risk assessment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Remote wipe capability and destruction confirmation obtained and cost recovery process and risk assessment conducted and documented process and tracking of non-returns
questions.red_flags: No remote wipe; No destruction confirmation; No cost recovery; No risk assessment; Non-returns not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Non-returned assets not managed with appropriate risk assessment and mitigation.

questions.question: How does the process apply to contractors?
questions.guidance: Contractor asset return review. Look for: contract end procedures; asset return clauses; verification equivalent to employees.
questions.auditor_focus: Are contractors treated the same as employees?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Contract end procedures documented and asset return in contracts and verification equivalent to employees and consistent process and tracking maintained
questions.red_flags: No contractor procedures; Not in contracts; Lower standards; Inconsistent process; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Contractor asset return process less rigorous than employee process.

questions.question: Provide your information classification scheme.
questions.guidance: Classification scheme review. Look for: classification levels defined; clear criteria for each level; examples provided.
questions.auditor_focus: Are levels clearly defined with examples?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Classification levels clearly defined and criteria for each level documented and examples provided and practical to apply and staff trained and aligned with regulatory requirements
questions.red_flags: Levels unclear; No criteria; No examples; Impractical scheme; Staff untrained; Not aligned with regulatory
questions.nc_pattern: Information classification scheme not clearly defined or lacks practical criteria.

questions.question: How does classification address confidentiality and integrity and availability?
questions.guidance: CIA coverage review. Look for: classification criteria covering all three dimensions; impact assessment methodology; aggregation considerations.
questions.auditor_focus: Is it more than just confidentiality?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Classification covers confidentiality and integrity and availability and impact methodology for each and aggregation considered and comprehensive framework
questions.red_flags: Confidentiality only; Integrity ignored; Availability missing; No impact methodology; Aggregation not considered
questions.nc_pattern: Classification scheme addresses confidentiality only without integrity or availability.

questions.question: How are privacy requirements incorporated into classification?
questions.guidance: Privacy integration review. Look for: personal information identification; Privacy Act alignment; consent-based handling requirements; special categories including health and financial.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Personal information identified and Privacy Act aligned and consent requirements addressed and special categories defined and PII classification clear and handling procedures linked
questions.red_flags: PII not identified; No Privacy Act alignment; Consent ignored; Special categories missing; PII handling unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Privacy requirements not incorporated into information classification scheme.

questions.question: Who is responsible for classifying information?
questions.guidance: Classification responsibility review. Look for: data owner responsibility documented; guidance available; classification review process; escalation for uncertainty.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Data owner responsibility documented and guidance available and review process defined and escalation path for uncertainty and staff competent to classify
questions.red_flags: Responsibility unclear; No guidance; No review process; No escalation; Staff incompetent
questions.nc_pattern: Responsibilities for information classification not clearly assigned.

questions.question: How is classification reviewed and updated?
questions.guidance: Classification review cycle. Look for: review triggers including business change and regulatory update; periodic reassessment; declassification procedures.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review triggers defined and periodic reassessment conducted and declassification procedures documented and recent review evidence and changes tracked
questions.red_flags: No review triggers; No reassessment; No declassification procedures; No recent review; Changes untracked
questions.nc_pattern: Information classification not reviewed or updated when circumstances change.

questions.question: Provide your information labelling procedures.
questions.guidance: Labelling procedures review. Look for: procedures for electronic documents; emails; physical documents; storage media; databases with format and location standards.
questions.auditor_focus: Are labelling requirements clear and practical?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Labelling procedures for all information types and format standards defined and location requirements clear and practical to apply and staff trained and enforcement mechanisms
questions.red_flags: Incomplete procedures; Format undefined; Location unclear; Impractical requirements; Staff untrained
questions.nc_pattern: Information labelling procedures not documented for all information types.

questions.question: How are electronic documents and emails labelled?
questions.guidance: Electronic labelling review. Look for: header and footer requirements; subject line prefixes; metadata tagging; email classification integration.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me examples of correctly labelled documents.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Electronic labelling requirements documented and header and footer standards and subject line prefixes and metadata tagging and email classification integration and examples available
questions.red_flags: No electronic labelling; No standards; No metadata; Email classification missing; No examples
questions.nc_pattern: Electronic documents and emails not consistently labelled with classification.

questions.question: How are physical assets labelled?
questions.guidance: Physical labelling review. Look for: storage media labels; document stamps; secure area signage; asset tags with classification.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Physical labelling procedures and media labels and document stamps and secure area signage and asset tags and consistent application and verification process
questions.red_flags: No physical labelling; Inconsistent application; Missing labels; No signage; No verification
questions.nc_pattern: Physical information assets not consistently labelled with classification.

questions.question: Is there automated classification and labelling?
questions.guidance: Automation review. Look for: DLP tools; email classification add-ins; Microsoft Information Protection or equivalent; auto-labelling rules.
questions.auditor_focus: What percentage is auto-labelled vs manual?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Automated labelling deployed and DLP integration and email classification tools and auto-labelling rules and coverage metrics and manual fallback process
questions.red_flags: No automation; DLP not integrated; No email classification; No auto-rules; Coverage unknown
questions.nc_pattern: Automated classification and labelling not implemented where practical.

questions.question: How are staff trained on labelling requirements?
questions.guidance: Labelling training review. Look for: training content; examples of correct labelling; common mistakes highlighted; verification during audits.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training includes labelling and examples provided and common mistakes covered and verification during audits and staff competent and refresher training
questions.red_flags: No training; No examples; Mistakes not covered; No verification; Staff incompetent
questions.nc_pattern: Staff not trained on information labelling requirements.

questions.question: Provide your information transfer policy and procedures.
questions.guidance: Transfer policy review. Look for: procedures covering email; file sharing; physical media; verbal communication; security requirements by classification.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Transfer procedures cover all methods and email and file sharing and physical media and verbal and requirements by classification and practical and enforced
questions.red_flags: Missing transfer methods; Classification not linked; Requirements unclear; Impractical; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: Information transfer procedures not documented for all transfer methods.

questions.question: What secure transfer mechanisms are available?
questions.guidance: Secure transfer capability review. Look for: encrypted email; SFTP; secure file sharing platforms; courier services; cryptographic keys for sensitive transfers.
questions.auditor_focus: Are secure mechanisms easily accessible to staff?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple secure mechanisms available and encrypted email and SFTP and secure sharing platforms and courier services and cryptographic key management and staff aware and accessible
questions.red_flags: Limited mechanisms; Encrypted email missing; No SFTP; No secure sharing; Staff unaware; Difficult to access
questions.nc_pattern: Secure transfer mechanisms not available or not easily accessible to staff.

questions.question: How are transfer agreements managed with external parties?
questions.guidance: External transfer management review. Look for: NDAs; data sharing agreements; security requirements in contracts; due diligence before transfer.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me a recent external transfer agreement.
questions.what_good_looks_like: NDAs in place and data sharing agreements and security in contracts and due diligence conducted and recent examples and regular review of agreements
questions.red_flags: No NDAs; No sharing agreements; Security not in contracts; No due diligence; No examples
questions.nc_pattern: External information transfer agreements not in place or lacking security requirements.

questions.question: How is confidential information transferred externally?
questions.guidance: Confidential transfer review. Look for: encryption requirements; approved channels; recipient verification; delivery confirmation; transfer logging.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you demonstrate a secure external transfer?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Encryption required and approved channels defined and recipient verification and delivery confirmation and transfer logging and recent example demonstrable
questions.red_flags: No encryption; Unapproved channels; No recipient verification; No confirmation; No logging
questions.nc_pattern: Confidential information transfer procedures not followed or not logged.

questions.question: How are removable media transfers controlled?
questions.guidance: Removable media review. Look for: USB policy; encrypted device requirements; approval process; scanning before use; tracking and disposal.
questions.auditor_focus: Are USB devices encrypted and tracked?
questions.what_good_looks_like: USB policy documented and encryption required and approval process and scanning before use and tracking and secure disposal and enforcement
questions.red_flags: No USB policy; No encryption; No approval; No scanning; Not tracked; No disposal process
questions.nc_pattern: Removable media transfers not controlled or encrypted devices not required.

questions.question: Provide your access control policy.
questions.guidance: Access policy review. Look for: access principles including need-to-know and least privilege; approval process; review requirements; segregation of duties addressed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access control policy documented and need-to-know and least privilege principles and approval process and review requirements and segregation addressed and current and communicated
questions.red_flags: No access policy; Principles undefined; No approval process; No review requirements; SoD not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Access control policy not documented or does not define access principles.

questions.question: How is least privilege implemented?
questions.guidance: Least privilege review. Look for: default deny approach; minimum necessary access; granular permissions; privilege escalation controls.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you demonstrate least privilege in action?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Default deny implemented and minimum access granted and granular permissions and privilege escalation controlled and regular review and demonstrable
questions.red_flags: Default allow; Excessive access granted; Coarse permissions; Uncontrolled escalation; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Least privilege principle not implemented in access control.

questions.question: What is your access request and approval workflow?
questions.guidance: Access workflow review. Look for: request process; business justification requirements; owner approval; security review for sensitive access.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Request workflow documented and business justification required and owner approval and security review for sensitive and approval documented and enforced
questions.red_flags: No workflow; No justification required; No approval; No security review; Not documented; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: Access request and approval workflow not documented or not consistently followed.

questions.question: How often are access rights reviewed?
questions.guidance: Access review schedule verification. Look for: review schedule with quarterly for privileged and semi-annual for standard; recertification process; reviewer assignments.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me recent access review evidence.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review schedule documented and quarterly for privileged and semi-annual for standard and recertification process and reviewers assigned and evidence available
questions.red_flags: No review schedule; Privileged not quarterly; Reviews overdue; No recertification; No evidence
questions.nc_pattern: Access rights reviews not conducted at required intervals.

questions.question: How is access logging and monitoring implemented?
questions.guidance: Access monitoring review. Look for: access logs maintained; monitoring for anomalies; alerting on suspicious patterns; log retention.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access logs maintained and anomaly monitoring and alerting on suspicious patterns and appropriate retention and regular review and integration with SIEM
questions.red_flags: No access logs; No anomaly monitoring; No alerting; Retention inadequate; Logs not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Access logging and monitoring not implemented or logs not reviewed.

questions.question: How is physical and logical access coordinated?
questions.guidance: Integrated access review. Look for: integrated access management; facility access linked to system access; synchronized revocation on termination.
questions.auditor_focus: Is badge access revoked with system access?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Integrated access management and facility linked to system access and synchronized revocation and single source of truth and verified on termination and coordinated processes
questions.red_flags: Separate management; Facility not linked; Revocation not synchronized; Multiple sources; Not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Physical and logical access not coordinated or revocation not synchronized.

questions.question: Describe your identity lifecycle management process.
questions.guidance: Lifecycle review. Look for: lifecycle stages including creation and modification and suspension and deletion; unique identifier assignment; no identifier reuse.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Lifecycle stages documented and creation and modification and suspension and deletion and unique identifiers and no reuse and complete coverage
questions.red_flags: Lifecycle incomplete; Stages missing; Identifiers reused; Not documented; Gaps in process
questions.nc_pattern: Identity lifecycle management process not fully documented.

questions.question: How are identities verified before account creation?
questions.guidance: Identity verification review. Look for: verification process; manager approval; HR confirmation for employees; identity documentation for contractors.
questions.auditor_focus: What verification is required for new accounts?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Verification process documented and manager approval required and HR confirmation and identity documentation for contractors and evidence maintained
questions.red_flags: No verification; No approval; No HR confirmation; Contractor verification weak; No evidence
questions.nc_pattern: Identities not verified before account creation.

questions.question: How are shared and generic accounts controlled?
questions.guidance: Shared account review. Look for: policy on shared accounts; exceptional use cases documented; compensating controls including enhanced logging; regular review.
questions.auditor_focus: What shared accounts exist and why?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Shared account policy and exceptions documented with justification and compensating controls and enhanced logging and regular review and minimised use
questions.red_flags: No policy; Exceptions not documented; No compensating controls; No enhanced logging; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Shared and generic accounts not controlled or justified with compensating controls.

questions.question: What is the SLA for account deprovisioning on termination?
questions.guidance: Deprovisioning timeliness review. Look for: target timeframe same day for terminations and immediate for terminations for cause; automated triggers from HR systems; verification of complete deprovisioning across all systems including cloud.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me recent termination timing evidence.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Same-day SLA documented and immediate for terminations for cause and automated HR triggers and verification process and evidence of recent terminations and complete deprovisioning and metrics tracked
questions.red_flags: SLA too long; No automation; No verification; No evidence; Incomplete deprovisioning; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Account deprovisioning not completed within target SLA on termination.

questions.question: How are dormant accounts identified and managed?
questions.guidance: Dormant account review. Look for: inactivity threshold such as 90 days; detection mechanism; review process; automatic disable or delete procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: How many dormant accounts exist currently?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Inactivity threshold defined and detection mechanism and review process and automatic disable and current dormant count known and regular reporting
questions.red_flags: No threshold; No detection; No review; No automation; Dormant count unknown; No reporting
questions.nc_pattern: Dormant accounts not identified or managed.

questions.question: How are identity changes managed for role changes and transfers?
questions.guidance: Role change review. Look for: role change triggers; access review; removal of previous access; new access provisioning; timing requirements.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there an access review at every role change?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Role change triggers defined and access review mandatory and previous access removed and new access provisioned and timing requirements and evidence available
questions.red_flags: No triggers; No access review; Previous access retained; New access delayed; No timing requirements
questions.nc_pattern: Identity and access changes not managed when personnel change roles.

questions.question: Provide your authentication policy including password and MFA requirements.
questions.guidance: Authentication policy review. Look for: password policy with minimum length 12 characters; complexity; history; MFA requirements for different system types.
questions.auditor_focus: Do requirements meet current best practice?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Password policy with 12 character minimum and complexity requirements and history enforced and MFA requirements defined and best practice alignment and regular review
questions.red_flags: Weak password requirements; No complexity; No history; MFA not required; Below best practice; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Authentication policy does not meet current best practice requirements.

questions.question: How is initial authentication information provided securely?
questions.guidance: Initial credential review. Look for: secure distribution method; forced change on first use; identity verification before password reset.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Secure distribution method and forced change on first use and identity verification for resets and documented process and audit trail
questions.red_flags: Insecure distribution; No forced change; No identity verification; Process undocumented; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Initial authentication information not distributed securely.

questions.question: Where is MFA implemented?
questions.guidance: MFA coverage review. Look for: MFA coverage including VPN; privileged accounts; cloud services; email; remote access; technology used including TOTP and push and hardware keys.
questions.what_good_looks_like: MFA on VPN and privileged accounts and cloud services and email and remote access and technology documented and comprehensive coverage and enforced
questions.red_flags: Limited MFA coverage; Privileged without MFA; Cloud without MFA; Remote access without MFA; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: MFA not implemented comprehensively across all required access points.

questions.question: What is your password reset process?
questions.guidance: Password reset review. Look for: self-service capability; identity verification requirements; help desk procedures; reset logging.
questions.auditor_focus: Is reset process secure against social engineering?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Self-service available and identity verification required and help desk procedures documented and reset logging and secure against social engineering and tested
questions.red_flags: No self-service; No identity verification; Help desk undocumented; No logging; Vulnerable to social engineering
questions.nc_pattern: Password reset process vulnerable to social engineering attacks.

questions.question: How are users educated on credential protection?
questions.guidance: Credential awareness review. Look for: training content; phishing awareness; credential sharing prohibition; reporting suspicious requests.
questions.auditor_focus: Is training effective? Check phishing simulation results.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training includes credential protection and phishing awareness and sharing prohibition and reporting process and effectiveness measured and phishing simulation results
questions.red_flags: No training; Phishing not covered; Sharing permitted; No reporting process; Effectiveness unmeasured
questions.nc_pattern: Users not educated on credential protection or training ineffective.

questions.question: What is your access provisioning process?
questions.guidance: Provisioning process review. Look for: request workflow; approval chain; documentation; provisioning timeframe; verification of correct access.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Request workflow documented and approval chain defined and documentation maintained and timeframe SLA and verification of correct access and consistent process
questions.red_flags: No workflow; No approval chain; No documentation; No SLA; No verification; Inconsistent
questions.nc_pattern: Access provisioning process not documented or not consistently followed.

questions.question: How frequently are access rights reviewed?
questions.guidance: Review frequency verification. Look for: review schedule by access type; privileged accounts quarterly minimum; standard semi-annual; evidence of reviews.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review schedule documented and privileged quarterly and standard semi-annual and evidence of completed reviews and reviewers assigned and on-time completion tracked
questions.red_flags: No schedule; Privileged not quarterly; Standard not semi-annual; No evidence; Reviews overdue
questions.nc_pattern: Access rights reviews not conducted at required frequency.

questions.question: What triggers an access modification?
questions.guidance: Access modification triggers review. Look for: role change; transfer; project end; access review finding; security incident; manager request documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: All triggers documented and role change and transfer and project end and review findings and incidents and manager requests and consistently applied
questions.red_flags: Triggers not documented; Missing trigger types; Inconsistent application; Triggers missed; No tracking
questions.nc_pattern: Access modification triggers not documented or not consistently applied.

questions.question: What is your access revocation SLA on termination?
questions.guidance: Revocation timeliness review. Look for: same-day target; automated triggers; verification of complete revocation; exception handling.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me timing for recent terminations.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Same-day SLA and automated triggers and complete revocation verified and exception handling documented and evidence for recent terminations and metrics tracked
questions.red_flags: SLA exceeded; No automation; Revocation incomplete; No exception handling; No evidence; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Access revocation not completed within SLA on termination.

questions.question: Is there segregation between access request and approval?
questions.guidance: Request approval segregation review. Look for: requestor cannot approve own access; manager or owner approval; independent verification for sensitive access.
questions.auditor_focus: Can users approve their own access?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Requestor cannot approve own access and manager or owner approval required and independent verification for sensitive access and system enforced and audit trail
questions.red_flags: Self-approval possible; No manager approval; No independent verification; Not system enforced; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Users can approve their own access requests without independent approval.

questions.question: Provide your supplier security assessment process.
questions.guidance: Supplier assessment review. Look for: risk-based classification; assessment methodology including questionnaires and audits; due diligence procedures; minimum requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Risk-based classification and assessment methodology and questionnaires and audits and due diligence procedures and minimum requirements and complete coverage
questions.red_flags: No classification; No methodology; No questionnaires; No due diligence; No minimum requirements; Incomplete coverage
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier security assessment process not documented or not applied to all suppliers.

questions.question: Show me your critical supplier register.
questions.guidance: Critical supplier identification review. Look for: identification criteria; current critical suppliers listed; enhanced requirements; assessment frequency.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Identification criteria documented and critical suppliers listed and enhanced requirements and more frequent assessment and regular review and complete coverage
questions.red_flags: No identification criteria; Critical suppliers not listed; No enhanced requirements; Assessment infrequent; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Critical suppliers not identified or not subject to enhanced security requirements.

questions.question: What security requirements are included in supplier contracts?
questions.guidance: Contract security requirements review. Look for: standard clauses including data protection; incident notification; audit rights; compliance requirements; liability.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Standard security clauses and data protection and incident notification and audit rights and compliance requirements and liability and contractually binding
questions.red_flags: No standard clauses; Data protection missing; No incident notification; No audit rights; Compliance not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Security requirements not included in supplier contracts or not enforceable.

questions.question: How is ongoing supplier security monitoring performed?
questions.guidance: Ongoing monitoring review. Look for: periodic reassessment; certification tracking; security scorecard monitoring; audit exercises.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me evidence of ongoing monitoring.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Periodic reassessment conducted and certification tracking and security scorecard and audit exercises and evidence available and consistent monitoring
questions.red_flags: No periodic reassessment; Certifications not tracked; No scorecard; No audits; No evidence; Monitoring not consistent
questions.nc_pattern: Ongoing supplier security monitoring not performed or not documented.

questions.question: How do regulatory requirements apply to your suppliers?
questions.guidance: Regulatory flow-down review. Look for: third party capability assessment; security requirements in agreements; incident notification obligations; testing requirements.
questions.auditor_focus: Are regulatory requirements flowed down to material suppliers?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regulatory requirements mapped to suppliers and capability assessment and security in agreements and incident notification and testing requirements and flow-down documented
questions.red_flags: Regulatory requirements not mapped; No capability assessment; Not in agreements; Notification not required; Testing not required
questions.nc_pattern: Regulatory security requirements not flowed down to material suppliers.

questions.question: Provide template security clauses used in supplier agreements.
questions.guidance: Template clause review. Look for: standard security schedule; compliance obligations; data handling requirements; termination provisions.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Standard security schedule and compliance obligations and data handling and termination provisions and comprehensive coverage and legally reviewed and enforceable
questions.red_flags: No template clauses; Compliance not addressed; Data handling missing; Termination unclear; Not comprehensive; Not enforceable
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier agreement security clauses not standardised or not comprehensive.

questions.question: What incident notification requirements are in agreements?
questions.guidance: Incident notification clause review. Look for: notification timeframes such as 24-72 hours; escalation contacts; severity definitions; coordination requirements.
questions.auditor_focus: Can suppliers meet your notification requirements?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Notification timeframes defined and escalation contacts and severity definitions and coordination requirements and suppliers can comply and tested
questions.red_flags: No timeframes; Contacts undefined; Severity not defined; Coordination unclear; Suppliers cannot comply; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier incident notification requirements not defined or unrealistic.

questions.question: Do agreements include audit rights?
questions.guidance: Audit rights review. Look for: right to audit; assessment access; evidence provision requirements; audit cost allocation; advance notice requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Right to audit in contracts and assessment access and evidence requirements and cost allocation and notice requirements and exercised rights documented
questions.red_flags: No audit rights; Access restricted; Evidence not required; Cost prohibitive; Notice too long; Rights not exercised
questions.nc_pattern: Audit rights not included in supplier agreements or not exercised.

questions.question: What certification requirements apply to suppliers?
questions.guidance: Certification requirements review. Look for: ISO 27001; SOC 2 Type II; other certifications by criticality; annual evidence provision.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Certification requirements documented and ISO 27001 or SOC 2 by criticality and annual evidence provision and tracked and enforced and current certificates on file
questions.red_flags: No certification requirements; Not tied to criticality; Evidence not required; Not tracked; Not enforced; Certificates expired
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier certification requirements not defined or not enforced.

questions.question: How are subcontractor security requirements addressed?
questions.guidance: Subcontractor requirements review. Look for: flow-down of requirements; approval for subcontracting; visibility into subcontractor use.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you know who your suppliers' suppliers are?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Requirements flow to subcontractors and approval required for subcontracting and visibility into subcontractor use and tracked and monitored
questions.red_flags: No flow-down; No approval required; No visibility; Not tracked; Not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Subcontractor security requirements not addressed in supplier agreements.

controls.control_name: Managing Security in the ICT Supply Chain

questions.question: How are ICT supply chain risks identified and managed?
questions.guidance: Supply chain risk review. Look for: supply chain risk assessment; vendor concentration risk; geographic considerations; single points of failure identified.
questions.auditor_focus: Are supply chain risks in your risk register?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Supply chain risks assessed and vendor concentration and geographic considerations and single points of failure and in risk register and treatment plans
questions.red_flags: No supply chain assessment; Concentration not assessed; Geography ignored; SPOFs not identified; Not in risk register
questions.nc_pattern: ICT supply chain risks not identified or not included in risk register.

questions.question: How is the security of ICT products verified?
questions.guidance: Product security verification review. Look for: product security assessments; vulnerability disclosure programs; secure development evidence; security certifications.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you assess product security before purchase?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Product security assessments and vulnerability disclosure reviewed and secure development evidence and certifications verified and before purchase and documented
questions.red_flags: No product assessments; Disclosure not reviewed; No secure dev evidence; Certifications not verified; Post-purchase only
questions.nc_pattern: ICT product security not verified before purchase.

questions.question: Do you require Software Bill of Materials?
questions.guidance: SBOM requirements review. Look for: SBOM requirements in contracts; component traceability; open source identification; vulnerability tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you identify vulnerable components in your software?
questions.what_good_looks_like: SBOM required in contracts and component traceability and open source identified and vulnerability tracking and can identify vulnerable components
questions.red_flags: No SBOM requirements; No traceability; Open source unknown; Vulnerabilities not tracked; Cannot identify components
questions.nc_pattern: Software Bill of Materials not required or component vulnerabilities not trackable.

questions.question: How are software updates and patches verified?
questions.guidance: Patch verification review. Look for: integrity verification; trusted sources; testing before deployment; rollback capability.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you verify patch authenticity?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Integrity verification performed and trusted sources used and testing before deployment and rollback capability and verification documented
questions.red_flags: No integrity verification; Untrusted sources; No testing; No rollback; Verification undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Software updates and patches not verified for integrity before deployment.

questions.question: How are supply chain security incidents managed?
questions.guidance: Supply chain incident review. Look for: notification handling; impact assessment; coordinated response; communication with affected parties.
questions.auditor_focus: How would you respond to a supplier breach?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Notification handling process and impact assessment and coordinated response and communication plan and tested through exercises and documented
questions.red_flags: No notification process; No impact assessment; No coordinated response; No communication plan; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Supply chain security incident response not documented or not tested.

controls.control_name: Monitoring Review and Change Management of Supplier Services

questions.question: How are supplier services monitored for security?
questions.guidance: Supplier monitoring review. Look for: SLA monitoring; security metric tracking; performance dashboards; automated alerts.
questions.what_good_looks_like: SLA monitoring in place and security metrics tracked and performance dashboards and automated alerts and regular review and documented
questions.red_flags: No SLA monitoring; Metrics not tracked; No dashboards; No alerts; Not reviewed; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier services not monitored for security performance.

questions.question: What is your supplier reassessment schedule?
questions.guidance: Reassessment schedule review. Look for: annual minimum; trigger-based for incidents and changes; certification renewal tracking; reassessment records.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Annual minimum reassessment and trigger-based reassessment and certification renewal tracked and reassessment records and recent evidence available
questions.red_flags: No schedule; Annual not met; Trigger-based missing; Renewal not tracked; No records; No evidence
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier security reassessment not conducted at required intervals.

questions.question: How are changes to supplier services managed?
questions.guidance: Supplier change management review. Look for: change notification requirements; security impact assessment; approval before implementation.
questions.auditor_focus: How are you notified of supplier changes?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Change notification requirements in contracts and security impact assessment and approval before implementation and tracking and documented
questions.red_flags: No notification requirements; No impact assessment; No approval; Not tracked; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier service changes not managed with security impact assessment.

questions.question: How are supplier security incidents handled?
questions.guidance: Supplier incident handling review. Look for: notification process; impact assessment; coordinated response; root cause analysis; follow-up.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me how a recent supplier incident was handled.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Notification process and impact assessment and coordinated response and root cause analysis and follow-up and recent example available
questions.red_flags: No notification process; No impact assessment; No coordination; No RCA; No follow-up; No examples
questions.nc_pattern: Supplier security incidents not handled with documented response process.

questions.question: How is security assessed at contract renewal?
questions.guidance: Renewal assessment review. Look for: security review requirements; updated requirements; lessons learned incorporation; right to terminate.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security review at renewal and updated requirements and lessons learned incorporated and right to terminate and documented and evidence available
questions.red_flags: No security review at renewal; Requirements not updated; Lessons not incorporated; No termination right
questions.nc_pattern: Security not reassessed at supplier contract renewal.

questions.question: Provide your cloud service evaluation and selection criteria.
questions.guidance: Cloud security policy review per topic-specific policy approach. Look for: acquisition process with selection criteria; use guidelines; management procedures; exit strategy with data retrieval and secure deletion; shared responsibility model documented per cloud service type including IaaS and PaaS and SaaS.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there a formal evaluation process?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Formal evaluation process and security requirements defined and compliance certifications required and data residency considered and exit strategy required and vendor assessment
questions.red_flags: No evaluation process; Security requirements undefined; Certifications not required; Residency ignored; No exit strategy
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud service evaluation does not include formal security criteria.

questions.question: Show me your shared responsibility matrix for each major cloud provider.
questions.guidance: Shared responsibility review. Look for: documented matrix per provider; clear delineation of provider vs customer responsibilities; gaps addressed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Matrix per cloud provider and provider vs customer responsibilities clear and gaps identified and addressed and current and reviewed regularly
questions.red_flags: No shared responsibility matrix; Responsibilities unclear; Gaps not identified; Outdated; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud shared responsibility model not documented or gaps not addressed.

questions.question: How is cloud security configuration managed?
questions.guidance: Cloud security configuration review. Look for: CSPM tools deployed; configuration standards; drift detection; compliance monitoring; remediation tracking.
questions.what_good_looks_like: CSPM deployed and configuration standards defined and drift detection and compliance monitoring and remediation tracking and alerts actioned
questions.red_flags: No CSPM; No standards; No drift detection; No monitoring; Alerts not actioned; Remediation not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud security configuration not managed or drift not detected.

questions.question: Provide your documented exit strategy for cloud services.
questions.guidance: Exit strategy review. Look for: data extraction procedures with defined timeframes; transition planning with continuity measures; service continuity; contractual provisions including data return SLAs; secure deletion requirements with certification; tested procedures with evidence.
questions.auditor_focus: Has the exit strategy been tested?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Exit strategy documented and data retrieval procedures with defined timeframes and secure deletion requirements with certification and transition planning with continuity measures and contractual requirements including data return SLAs and tested procedures with evidence
questions.red_flags: No exit strategy; Extraction procedures missing; No transition plan; Continuity not addressed; Provisions missing; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud service exit strategy not documented or not tested.

questions.question: How is data protected in cloud environments?
questions.guidance: Cloud data protection review. Look for: encryption at rest AES-256; encryption in transit TLS 1.2 or higher; key management customer-managed vs provider; data residency.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Encryption at rest AES-256 and encryption in transit TLS 1.2 or higher and key management documented and customer-managed where appropriate and data residency compliant
questions.red_flags: No encryption at rest; Weak encryption in transit; Key management unclear; Provider-managed only; Residency non-compliant
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud data not adequately protected with encryption or key management unclear.

questions.question: How are cloud provider certifications reviewed?
questions.guidance: Provider certification review. Look for: annual SOC 2 Type II review; ISO 27001 certificate validation; relevant control scope; exception assessment.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me the latest cloud provider SOC 2 review.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Annual SOC 2 review conducted and ISO 27001 validated and relevant control scope verified and exceptions assessed and documented and recent review available
questions.red_flags: No annual review; SOC 2 not reviewed; ISO 27001 not validated; Scope not verified; Exceptions not assessed
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud provider certifications not reviewed annually.

questions.question: How is multi-tenant isolation verified?
questions.guidance: Tenant isolation review. Look for: isolation architecture documentation; tenant boundary testing; penetration test scope including tenant isolation.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you verify tenant isolation?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Isolation architecture documented and tenant boundary testing and penetration test includes isolation and verification evidence and regular assessment
questions.red_flags: No architecture documentation; No boundary testing; Pen test excludes isolation; No verification; Not regularly assessed
questions.nc_pattern: Multi-tenant isolation not verified or not included in security testing.

questions.question: Provide your incident response plan.
questions.guidance: IRP comprehensiveness review. Look for: roles; responsibilities; severity classification; escalation matrix; communication procedures; containment strategies documented.
questions.auditor_focus: Is the plan comprehensive and current?
questions.what_good_looks_like: IRP documented with roles and responsibilities and severity classification and escalation matrix and communication procedures and containment strategies and current
questions.red_flags: No IRP; Roles unclear; No severity classification; No escalation matrix; Communication undefined; Containment missing
questions.nc_pattern: Incident response plan not documented or missing critical elements.

questions.question: Show me your incident classification scheme.
questions.guidance: Classification scheme review. Look for: severity levels Critical and High and Medium and Low; criteria for each level; response timeframes; escalation triggers.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Severity levels defined and criteria for each level and response timeframes and escalation triggers and consistently applied and staff trained
questions.red_flags: Severity undefined; Criteria missing; No timeframes; No triggers; Inconsistent application; Staff untrained
questions.nc_pattern: Incident classification scheme not defined or criteria unclear.

questions.question: How are incident response roles assigned?
questions.guidance: IRT assignment review. Look for: IRT membership; on-call procedures; decision authority; backup personnel; contact details current.
questions.auditor_focus: Who is on call right now?
questions.what_good_looks_like: IRT membership documented and on-call procedures and decision authority defined and backup personnel and contact details current and accessible
questions.red_flags: IRT membership unclear; No on-call procedures; Authority undefined; No backups; Contacts outdated
questions.nc_pattern: Incident response team roles not clearly assigned or on-call procedures missing.

questions.question: Provide evidence of incident response testing.
questions.guidance: IRP testing review. Look for: tabletop exercises; simulation drills; test frequency annual minimum; lessons learned; improvement actions.
questions.auditor_focus: When was the last IRP test?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Tabletop exercises conducted and simulation drills and annual minimum frequency and lessons learned documented and improvement actions tracked and recent test evidence
questions.red_flags: No tabletop exercises; No drills; Testing infrequent; Lessons not captured; Actions not tracked; No recent test
questions.nc_pattern: Incident response plan not tested or testing infrequent.

questions.question: How are regulatory notification requirements addressed?
questions.guidance: Regulatory notification review. Look for: notification procedures documented; timeline requirements; materiality criteria; notification template; escalation to board.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you meet regulatory notification requirements?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regulatory notification procedures and timeline requirements and materiality criteria and notification template and board escalation and tested
questions.red_flags: No notification procedures; Timeline requirements unclear; Materiality undefined; No template; No board escalation
questions.nc_pattern: Regulatory incident notification requirements not addressed in incident response plan.

questions.question: How is coordination managed with legal and PR and executives?
questions.guidance: Cross-functional coordination review. Look for: cross-functional IRT; communication protocols; decision authority; external communication approval.
questions.auditor_focus: Are non-technical teams included in IRP?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Cross-functional IRT and legal and PR and executives included and communication protocols and decision authority and external communication approval and tested
questions.red_flags: No cross-functional IRT; Legal not included; PR not included; Executives not included; Protocols missing
questions.nc_pattern: Incident response does not include coordination with legal and PR and executive teams.

controls.control_name: Assessment and Decision on Security Events

questions.question: How are security events triaged?
questions.guidance: Triage process review. Look for: triage process documented; criteria for incident declaration; escalation authority; documentation requirements.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there a clear triage process?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Triage process documented and incident declaration criteria and escalation authority and documentation requirements and consistently applied and staff trained
questions.red_flags: No triage process; Criteria unclear; Authority undefined; Documentation missing; Inconsistent; Staff untrained
questions.nc_pattern: Security event triage process not documented or inconsistently applied.

questions.question: What criteria determine incident severity?
questions.guidance: Severity criteria review. Look for: severity matrix with impact including data volume and system criticality; scope including users affected; regulatory implications.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Severity matrix documented and impact criteria and scope criteria and regulatory implications and objective and measurable and consistently applied
questions.red_flags: No severity matrix; Impact undefined; Scope ignored; Regulatory not considered; Subjective; Inconsistent
questions.nc_pattern: Incident severity criteria not objective or measurable.

questions.question: Is there 24/7 event assessment capability?
questions.guidance: 24/7 capability review. Look for: SOC coverage; on-call arrangements; automated alerting; escalation procedures outside business hours.
questions.what_good_looks_like: 24/7 capability through SOC or on-call and automated alerting and escalation procedures and outside business hours coverage and tested
questions.red_flags: No 24/7 capability; No on-call; No automated alerting; No after-hours escalation; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: 24/7 security event assessment capability not available.

questions.question: What are your event assessment SLAs?
questions.guidance: Assessment SLA review. Look for: initial assessment timeframe; escalation timelines; severity-specific response times documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Initial assessment SLA and escalation timelines and severity-specific response times and SLAs tracked and consistently met and reported
questions.red_flags: No SLAs defined; Timelines unclear; Severity-specific missing; Not tracked; SLAs not met; Not reported
questions.nc_pattern: Security event assessment SLAs not defined or not consistently met.

questions.question: How are assessment decisions documented?
questions.guidance: Assessment documentation review. Look for: event logs; triage notes; incident tickets; decision rationale; audit trail.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you trace a recent event through triage?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Event logs maintained and triage notes and incident tickets and decision rationale and audit trail and traceable from event to decision
questions.red_flags: No event logs; No triage notes; No tickets; Rationale undocumented; No audit trail; Not traceable
questions.nc_pattern: Security event assessment decisions not documented with audit trail.

questions.question: How is incident containment achieved?
questions.guidance: Containment capability review. Look for: containment procedures; isolation capabilities; network segmentation; account suspension; system shutdown authority.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Containment procedures documented and isolation capabilities and network segmentation and account suspension and system shutdown authority and rapid deployment
questions.red_flags: No containment procedures; No isolation capability; No segmentation; Cannot suspend accounts; No shutdown authority
questions.nc_pattern: Incident containment procedures not documented or capabilities inadequate.

questions.question: Provide your incident response playbooks.
questions.guidance: Playbook coverage review. Look for: playbooks for common scenarios including ransomware and data breach and account compromise and DDoS and insider threat.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Playbooks for key scenarios and ransomware and data breach and account compromise and DDoS and insider threat and current and tested
questions.red_flags: No playbooks; Missing scenarios; Playbooks outdated; Generic only; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Incident response playbooks not available for key incident scenarios.

questions.question: How is incident eradication performed?
questions.guidance: Eradication process review. Look for: root cause elimination procedures; malware removal; vulnerability remediation; system rebuild procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you ensure threats are completely removed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Root cause elimination procedures and malware removal and vulnerability remediation and system rebuild and verification of eradication and documented
questions.red_flags: No eradication procedures; Malware removal unclear; Vulnerabilities not remediated; No rebuild procedures; Not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Incident eradication procedures not documented or verification inadequate.

questions.question: What is the incident recovery process?
questions.guidance: Recovery process review. Look for: service restoration procedures; verification before return to normal; enhanced monitoring during recovery.
questions.auditor_focus: How is clean verified before return to normal?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Service restoration procedures and verification before return to normal and enhanced monitoring and documented recovery and clean verification
questions.red_flags: No restoration procedures; No verification; No enhanced monitoring; Recovery undocumented; Clean not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Incident recovery process does not verify clean state before return to normal.

questions.question: How are stakeholders notified during incidents?
questions.guidance: Stakeholder notification review. Look for: communication plan; notification templates; update frequency; internal vs external communication differentiated.
questions.auditor_focus: Who needs to be notified and when?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Communication plan and notification templates and update frequency and internal and external differentiated and stakeholders identified and tested
questions.red_flags: No communication plan; No templates; Frequency undefined; Not differentiated; Stakeholders unclear; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Incident stakeholder notification process not documented or tested.

questions.question: How are post-incident reviews conducted?
questions.guidance: PIR process review. Look for: PIR process documented; timing within 2 weeks; participants identified; blameless approach; documentation requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: PIR process documented and timing defined and participants and blameless approach and documentation requirements and consistently conducted
questions.red_flags: No PIR process; Timing unclear; Participants undefined; Blame culture; Documentation missing; Inconsistent
questions.nc_pattern: Post-incident reviews not conducted or not documented consistently.

questions.question: Show me how lessons learned are tracked to completion.
questions.guidance: Lessons learned tracking review. Look for: improvement actions; owners assigned; deadlines; verification of completion; integration with risk register.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Improvement actions documented and owners assigned and deadlines and completion verified and risk register integration and tracking to closure
questions.red_flags: Actions not documented; No owners; No deadlines; Completion not verified; Not in risk register; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Incident lessons learned not tracked to completion.

questions.question: How are lessons shared across the organisation?
questions.guidance: Lesson sharing review. Look for: incident briefings; awareness communications; training updates; policy and procedure changes.
questions.auditor_focus: Is learning shared beyond the IRT?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Incident briefings and awareness communications and training updates and policy changes and procedure changes and broad sharing beyond IRT
questions.red_flags: Lessons not shared; No briefings; Training not updated; Policies unchanged; Procedures unchanged; Limited to IRT
questions.nc_pattern: Incident lessons learned not shared across the organisation.

questions.question: How are incident trends analysed?
questions.guidance: Trend analysis review. Look for: trend reporting; root cause patterns; systemic improvement opportunities; metrics tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: Are you seeing the same incidents repeatedly?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Trend reporting and root cause patterns identified and systemic improvements and metrics tracking and repeat incidents reducing and action taken
questions.red_flags: No trend reporting; Patterns not identified; No systemic improvements; Metrics not tracked; Repeat incidents
questions.nc_pattern: Incident trends not analysed or repeat incidents not identified for systemic improvement.

questions.question: How do external incidents inform your security?
questions.guidance: External learning review. Look for: industry incident monitoring; threat intelligence integration; proactive control assessment based on external events.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you learn from others' incidents?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Industry incident monitoring and threat intelligence integration and proactive control assessment and documented response to external incidents
questions.red_flags: No external monitoring; Intelligence not integrated; No proactive assessment; External incidents ignored
questions.nc_pattern: External security incidents not monitored or used to improve controls.

questions.question: Provide your evidence collection procedures.
questions.guidance: Evidence procedure review. Look for: collection procedures; chain of custody; preservation methods; handling guidelines; storage requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Evidence collection procedures and chain of custody and preservation methods and handling guidelines and storage requirements and forensically sound
questions.red_flags: No collection procedures; Chain of custody missing; Preservation unclear; Handling undefined; Storage inadequate
questions.nc_pattern: Evidence collection procedures not forensically sound.

questions.question: How is evidence integrity maintained?
questions.guidance: Evidence integrity review. Look for: hashing SHA-256; write-blocking; imaging procedures; verification of copies; documentation.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you prove evidence hasn't been tampered with?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Hashing using SHA-256 and write-blocking and imaging procedures and copy verification and documentation and integrity demonstrable
questions.red_flags: No hashing; No write-blocking; Imaging unclear; Copies not verified; Documentation missing
questions.nc_pattern: Evidence integrity not maintained through hashing and write-protection.

questions.question: How is chain of custody documented?
questions.guidance: Chain of custody review. Look for: chain of custody forms; access logs; secure storage; handover documentation.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you demonstrate unbroken chain of custody?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Chain of custody forms and access logs and secure storage and handover documentation and unbroken chain demonstrable
questions.red_flags: No custody forms; No access logs; Storage insecure; Handover undocumented; Chain broken
questions.nc_pattern: Chain of custody not documented or demonstrable.

questions.question: Are staff trained on evidence handling?
questions.guidance: Evidence handling training review. Look for: forensic awareness training; do's and don'ts; when to escalate; preservation priorities.
questions.auditor_focus: Do responders know how to preserve evidence?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Forensic awareness training and do's and don'ts and escalation guidance and preservation priorities and staff competent
questions.red_flags: No forensic training; Do's and don'ts missing; Escalation unclear; Priorities undefined; Staff incompetent
questions.nc_pattern: Staff not trained on evidence handling and preservation.

questions.question: Do you have access to forensic expertise?
questions.guidance: Forensic capability review. Look for: internal forensic capability; external retainer agreements; escalation procedures; contact details current.
questions.auditor_focus: Who would conduct a forensic investigation?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Forensic capability defined and internal or external and retainer agreements if external and escalation procedures and contacts current and tested
questions.red_flags: No forensic capability; No retainer; Escalation unclear; Contacts outdated; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Forensic investigation capability not available or not tested.

questions.question: How are security requirements maintained during disruptions?
questions.guidance: Disruption security review. Look for: security considerations in BCP; minimum security requirements during crisis; risk acceptance authority defined.
questions.auditor_focus: What security can be compromised during disruption?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security in BCP and minimum requirements during crisis and risk acceptance authority and documented exceptions and recovery procedures include security
questions.red_flags: Security not in BCP; No minimum requirements; Authority undefined; Exceptions undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Security requirements not addressed in business continuity planning.

questions.question: How are security controls adapted during crisis situations?
questions.guidance: Crisis adaptation review. Look for: crisis mode procedures; temporary control measures; exception documentation; enhanced monitoring.
questions.auditor_focus: What security exceptions are pre-approved for crisis?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Crisis mode procedures and temporary controls and exception documentation and enhanced monitoring and pre-approved exceptions and recovery procedures
questions.red_flags: No crisis procedures; Temporary controls undefined; Exceptions undocumented; No enhanced monitoring
questions.nc_pattern: Security control adaptations during crisis not documented.

questions.question: How do security and business continuity teams coordinate?
questions.guidance: BC security coordination review. Look for: joint planning; integrated testing; communication procedures; decision authority defined.
questions.auditor_focus: Is security included in BC planning?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Joint planning and integrated testing and communication procedures and decision authority and security in BC exercises and regular coordination
questions.red_flags: No joint planning; Testing not integrated; Communication unclear; Authority undefined; Security excluded
questions.nc_pattern: Security and business continuity teams do not coordinate effectively.

questions.question: How is security restored after disruption?
questions.guidance: Security restoration review. Look for: security verification before return to normal; control effectiveness confirmation; monitoring period.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you verify security is restored?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security verification before return to normal and control effectiveness confirmed and monitoring period and documented and tested
questions.red_flags: No verification; Effectiveness not confirmed; No monitoring period; Undocumented; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Security not verified before return to normal operations after disruption.

questions.question: Are security exceptions during disruption documented?
questions.guidance: Disruption exception review. Look for: exception records; risk acceptance; post-event review; lessons learned integration.
questions.auditor_focus: Are exceptions tracked for post-event review?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Exception records maintained and risk acceptance documented and post-event review and lessons learned integration and tracked for review
questions.red_flags: No exception records; Risk not documented; No post-event review; Lessons not captured; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Security exceptions during disruption not documented or reviewed post-event.

questions.question: Provide your ICT continuity or DR plan.
questions.guidance: DR plan review. Look for: RTOs; RPOs per system; recovery procedures; dependencies documented; communication procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: Are RTOs and RPOs aligned with business requirements?
questions.what_good_looks_like: DR plan with RTOs and RPOs per system and recovery procedures and dependencies and communication procedures and aligned with business requirements
questions.red_flags: No DR plan; RTOs undefined; RPOs missing; Procedures unclear; Dependencies not documented; Misaligned with business
questions.nc_pattern: ICT continuity plan not documented or RTOs and RPOs not aligned with business.

questions.question: Show me RTO and RPO definitions for critical systems.
questions.guidance: RTO RPO definition review. Look for: documented targets per system; business impact analysis linkage; achievability verification.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you actually meet these targets?
questions.what_good_looks_like: RTOs and RPOs per critical system and BIA linkage and achievability verified through testing and documented and reviewed regularly
questions.red_flags: Targets undefined; No BIA linkage; Achievability not verified; Undocumented; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: RTO and RPO targets not defined or verified as achievable for critical systems.

questions.question: How often is DR and BC testing conducted?
questions.guidance: DR testing frequency review. Look for: test schedule annual minimum; test scope full vs partial; success criteria; test results documented.
questions.auditor_focus: When was the last full DR test?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Annual minimum testing and scope documented and success criteria and results documented and full test conducted and issues tracked
questions.red_flags: Testing infrequent; Scope inadequate; No success criteria; Results undocumented; No full test
questions.nc_pattern: DR and BC testing not conducted at required frequency.

questions.question: Provide results from the most recent DR test.
questions.guidance: DR test results review. Look for: test report; objectives achieved; issues identified; remediation actions; next test date.
questions.auditor_focus: Were RTOs and RPOs achieved in testing?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Test report available and objectives documented and issues identified and remediation actions and next test scheduled and RTOs RPOs achieved
questions.red_flags: No test report; Objectives unclear; Issues not captured; No remediation; Next test unscheduled; Targets not met
questions.nc_pattern: DR test results not documented or RTOs and RPOs not achieved.

questions.question: How are backups tested for restoration?
questions.guidance: Backup restoration testing review. Look for: restoration testing schedule; verification of backup integrity; time to restore measurement.
questions.auditor_focus: When was backup restoration last tested?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Restoration testing schedule and integrity verified and time to restore measured and recent test and issues tracked and recovery validated
questions.red_flags: No restoration testing; Integrity not verified; Time not measured; Not recently tested; Issues not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Backup restoration not tested or integrity not verified.

questions.question: Is there geographic redundancy for critical systems?
questions.guidance: Geographic redundancy review. Look for: multi-region deployment; failover capability; data replication; maximum data loss tolerance.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Geographic redundancy for critical systems and multi-region deployment and failover tested and data replication and data loss tolerance defined
questions.red_flags: No geographic redundancy; Single region; Failover not tested; No replication; Data loss undefined
questions.nc_pattern: Geographic redundancy not implemented for critical systems.

controls.control_name: Legal Statutory Regulatory and Contractual Requirements

questions.question: Provide your compliance obligations register.
questions.guidance: Compliance register review. Look for: applicable laws including Privacy Act; regulations; contractual requirements; assessment of applicability.
questions.auditor_focus: Is the register comprehensive and current?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance register with applicable laws and regulations and contracts and applicability assessed and comprehensive and current and reviewed regularly
questions.red_flags: Incomplete register; Laws missing; Regulations missing; Contracts not tracked; Applicability unclear; Outdated
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance obligations register incomplete or not current.

questions.question: How are compliance requirements tracked and updated?
questions.guidance: Compliance tracking review. Look for: regulatory monitoring process; legal updates tracking; compliance review schedule; impact assessment procedure.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regulatory monitoring process and legal updates tracked and compliance reviews scheduled and impact assessments and current and documented
questions.red_flags: No monitoring process; Updates not tracked; No review schedule; No impact assessment; Outdated
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance requirements not systematically tracked or updated.

questions.question: How are contractual security obligations identified?
questions.guidance: Contractual obligations review. Look for: contract review process; security obligations extraction; compliance verification; breach implications.
questions.auditor_focus: Are security obligations tracked per contract?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Contract review process and security obligations extracted and tracked per contract and compliance verified and breach implications understood
questions.red_flags: No contract review; Obligations not extracted; Not tracked; Compliance not verified; Breach implications unknown
questions.nc_pattern: Contractual security obligations not identified or tracked.

questions.question: How is compliance verified?
questions.guidance: Compliance verification review. Look for: compliance assessments; audit program; evidence collection; gap remediation tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know you're compliant?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance assessments conducted and audit program and evidence collected and gaps tracked and remediation verified and reported
questions.red_flags: No assessments; No audit program; Evidence missing; Gaps not tracked; Remediation not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance not verified through assessment or audit program.

questions.question: How do you respond to regulatory changes?
questions.guidance: Regulatory change response review. Look for: impact assessment procedure; implementation planning; deadline tracking; resource allocation.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me response to a recent regulatory change.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Impact assessment procedure and implementation planning and deadline tracking and resource allocation and recent example available and timely response
questions.red_flags: No impact assessment; No planning; Deadlines missed; Resources not allocated; No examples; Delayed response
questions.nc_pattern: Response to regulatory changes not systematic or timely.

questions.question: Provide your intellectual property protection procedures.
