questions.guidance: IP protection review. Look for: IP policy; copyright compliance; software licensing; trademark protection measures documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: IP policy documented and copyright compliance and software licensing and trademark protection and communicated and enforced
questions.red_flags: No IP policy; Copyright ignored; Licensing unclear; Trademark unprotected; Not communicated
questions.nc_pattern: Intellectual property protection procedures not documented.

questions.question: How is software licensing compliance managed?
questions.guidance: Licensing compliance review. Look for: license inventory; compliance monitoring; audit trail for acquisitions; periodic verification.
questions.what_good_looks_like: License inventory and compliance monitoring and acquisition audit trail and periodic verification and compliant and documented
questions.red_flags: No license inventory; Monitoring absent; No audit trail; No verification; Non-compliant
questions.nc_pattern: Software licensing compliance not managed or verified.

questions.question: How is open source software managed?
questions.guidance: Open source management review. Look for: open source policy; license compatibility review; approved component list; SBOM maintenance.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you know what open source you're using?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Open source policy and license compatibility review and approved list and SBOM maintained and vulnerabilities tracked and compliant
questions.red_flags: No open source policy; Compatibility not reviewed; No approved list; No SBOM; Vulnerabilities unknown
questions.nc_pattern: Open source software not managed with license compliance and vulnerability tracking.

questions.question: How are employees made aware of IP requirements?
questions.guidance: IP awareness review. Look for: IP clauses in contracts; awareness training; acceptable use policy coverage.
questions.what_good_looks_like: IP in contracts and awareness training and AUP covers IP and staff understand and regularly reinforced
questions.red_flags: No IP in contracts; No training; AUP ignores IP; Staff unaware; Not reinforced
questions.nc_pattern: Employees not aware of intellectual property requirements.

questions.question: How is third-party IP protected?
questions.guidance: Third-party IP review. Look for: license agreements; usage restrictions; confidentiality requirements; return or destruction procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you protect client IP?
questions.what_good_looks_like: License agreements and usage restrictions and confidentiality requirements and return or destruction procedures and documented and enforced
questions.red_flags: No license agreements; Restrictions unclear; Confidentiality missing; No return procedures
questions.nc_pattern: Third-party intellectual property not protected with appropriate controls.

questions.question: Provide your records management policy.
questions.guidance: Records policy review. Look for: record types; retention periods; protection requirements; disposal procedures; legal hold capability.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Records policy with types and retention periods and protection requirements and disposal procedures and legal hold and legally compliant
questions.red_flags: No records policy; Retention undefined; Protection unclear; Disposal missing; No legal hold
questions.nc_pattern: Records management policy not documented or retention periods not legally compliant.

questions.question: How are records protected from loss and destruction?
questions.guidance: Records protection review. Look for: backup procedures; redundancy; access controls; integrity verification; disaster recovery.
questions.auditor_focus: Can records be recovered after disaster?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Backup procedures and redundancy and access controls and integrity verification and disaster recovery and recovery tested
questions.red_flags: No backups; No redundancy; Access uncontrolled; Integrity not verified; No DR; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Records not adequately protected from loss and destruction.

questions.question: How is record integrity ensured?
questions.guidance: Record integrity review. Look for: audit trails; access logging; version control; tamper detection; digital signatures where required.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know records haven't been modified?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Audit trails and access logging and version control and tamper detection and digital signatures where required and integrity verifiable
questions.red_flags: No audit trails; No access logging; No version control; No tamper detection; Integrity not verifiable
questions.nc_pattern: Record integrity not ensured through appropriate controls.

questions.question: How are records disposed of securely?
questions.guidance: Records disposal review. Look for: disposal procedures; destruction verification; certificates of destruction; media sanitisation.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Disposal procedures and destruction verification and certificates of destruction and media sanitisation and documented and auditable
questions.red_flags: No disposal procedures; No verification; No certificates; Media not sanitised; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Records not disposed of securely with verifiable destruction.

questions.question: Can records be retrieved when required?
questions.guidance: Records retrieval review. Look for: retrieval capability; search functions; legal hold procedures; response to legal requests.
questions.auditor_focus: How quickly can you respond to legal requests?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Retrieval capability and search functions and legal hold procedures and response to legal requests and timely and documented
questions.red_flags: No retrieval capability; Search limited; No legal hold; Response delayed; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Records cannot be retrieved in timely manner when legally required.

questions.question: Provide your privacy policy and PII handling procedures.
questions.guidance: Privacy policy review. Look for: privacy policy; data handling procedures; Privacy Act compliance; consent management.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Privacy policy documented and publicly available and data handling procedures and Privacy Act compliance and consent management and current
questions.red_flags: No privacy policy; Not public; Handling unclear; Non-compliant; Consent not managed
questions.nc_pattern: Privacy policy not documented or not publicly available.

questions.question: How is PII processing documented?
questions.guidance: PII processing documentation review. Look for: data inventory; processing purposes; legal basis; data flows; retention periods.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you know what PII you process?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Data inventory and processing purposes and legal basis and data flows documented and retention periods and comprehensive and current
questions.red_flags: No data inventory; Purposes unclear; Legal basis missing; Flows undocumented; Retention undefined
questions.nc_pattern: PII processing not documented with purposes and legal basis.

questions.question: What technical measures protect PII?
questions.guidance: PII technical protection review. Look for: encryption; access controls; pseudonymisation; data minimisation; secure deletion.
questions.auditor_focus: Is PII encrypted at rest and in transit?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Encryption at rest and in transit and access controls and pseudonymisation where appropriate and data minimisation and secure deletion
questions.red_flags: No encryption; Access uncontrolled; No pseudonymisation; Data maximised; Deletion insecure
questions.nc_pattern: PII not protected with appropriate technical measures.

questions.question: How are data subject rights managed?
questions.guidance: Data subject rights review. Look for: access request procedures; correction and deletion processes; response timelines; request tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you respond to access requests within timeframe?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access request procedures and correction and deletion and response timelines and request tracking and timely response and documented
questions.red_flags: No access request procedures; Correction missing; Deletion unclear; Timelines exceeded; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Data subject rights not managed or response timelines not met.

questions.question: What is your privacy breach notification process?
questions.guidance: Privacy breach notification review. Look for: breach assessment criteria; notification procedures; regulatory reporting requirements; affected party notification.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you notify within required timeframes?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Breach assessment criteria and notification procedures and regulatory reporting and affected party notification and timelines met and tested
questions.red_flags: No breach assessment; Notification unclear; Reporting undefined; Affected parties not notified; Timelines missed
questions.nc_pattern: Privacy breach notification process not documented or timelines not achievable.

questions.question: Provide your independent security review program.
questions.guidance: Review program assessment. Look for: internal audit program; external assessments; penetration testing; scope and frequency documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Internal audit program and external assessments and penetration testing and scope defined and frequency defined and independence ensured
questions.red_flags: No review program; No external assessment; No penetration testing; Scope undefined; Frequency undefined
questions.nc_pattern: Independent security review program not documented or comprehensive.

questions.question: How is reviewer independence ensured?
questions.guidance: Reviewer independence review. Look for: no conflicts of interest; independence declarations; separation from operational responsibilities.
questions.auditor_focus: Are reviewers independent from areas reviewed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: No conflicts of interest and independence declarations and separation from operations and verified and documented
questions.red_flags: Conflicts of interest; No declarations; Not separated; Not verified; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Reviewer independence not ensured or documented.

questions.question: How are review findings tracked and remediated?
questions.guidance: Finding remediation review. Look for: finding register; remediation timelines; verification of closure; escalation procedures.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Finding register and remediation timelines and closure verification and escalation procedures and on-time closure and tracked
questions.red_flags: No finding register; Timelines undefined; Closure not verified; No escalation; Overdue findings
questions.nc_pattern: Security review findings not tracked or remediated within timeframes.

questions.question: Is there second line oversight of security controls?
questions.guidance: Line 2 oversight review. Look for: second line testing program; control effectiveness assessment; reporting to risk committees.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Second line testing program and control effectiveness assessment and risk committee reporting and documented and regular and independent
questions.red_flags: No Line 2 testing; Effectiveness not assessed; No committee reporting; Undocumented; Irregular
questions.nc_pattern: Second line oversight of security controls not implemented.

questions.question: Provide evidence of recent external security assessment.
questions.guidance: External assessment review. Look for: penetration test report; security audit report; findings and remediation status.
questions.auditor_focus: When was the last external assessment?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Recent penetration test and security audit and findings documented and remediation status and current and comprehensive scope
questions.red_flags: No external assessment; Pen test outdated; Audit missing; Findings not documented; Scope limited
questions.nc_pattern: External security assessment not conducted or findings not remediated.

controls.control_name: Compliance with Policies Rules and Standards

questions.question: How is compliance with security policies monitored?
questions.guidance: Compliance monitoring review. Look for: compliance monitoring program; automated checks; manual reviews; exception tracking.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance monitoring program and automated checks and manual reviews and exception tracking and continuous or frequent and documented
questions.red_flags: No monitoring program; No automated checks; Manual reviews irregular; Exceptions not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance with security policies not actively monitored.

questions.question: How often are compliance reviews conducted?
questions.guidance: Compliance review frequency assessment. Look for: review schedule; coverage of policy requirements; finding documentation; trend analysis.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me recent compliance review results.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review schedule and coverage of requirements and findings documented and trend analysis and recent results available and action taken
questions.red_flags: No review schedule; Coverage incomplete; Findings undocumented; No trend analysis; No recent results
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance reviews not conducted at required frequency.

questions.question: How are compliance exceptions managed?
questions.guidance: Compliance exception review. Look for: exception request process; approval authority; compensating controls; time limits; regular review.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Exception process and approval authority and compensating controls and time limits and regular review and current count known and tracked
questions.red_flags: No exception process; Authority unclear; No compensating controls; No time limits; Not reviewed; Count unknown
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance exceptions not managed with appropriate controls and time limits.

questions.question: How is compliance status reported to management?
questions.guidance: Compliance reporting review. Look for: compliance dashboards; management reports; trend analysis; risk-based prioritisation.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance dashboards and management reports and trend analysis and risk-based prioritisation and regular reporting and management visibility
questions.red_flags: No dashboards; No reports; No trend analysis; Not prioritised; Irregular reporting; Management unaware
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance status not reported to management effectively.

questions.question: How are compliance violations addressed?
questions.guidance: Violation response review. Look for: remediation process; disciplinary linkage; root cause analysis; recurrence prevention.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me how a violation was addressed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Remediation process and disciplinary linkage and root cause analysis and recurrence prevention and examples available and consistent
questions.red_flags: No remediation process; No disciplinary linkage; No RCA; Recurrence not prevented; No examples
questions.nc_pattern: Compliance violations not addressed with root cause analysis and recurrence prevention.

questions.question: Are operating procedures documented for critical processes?
questions.guidance: Procedure documentation review. Look for: procedure documentation; coverage of security operations; version control; review dates.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Procedures for critical processes and security operations covered and version control and review dates and comprehensive and current
questions.red_flags: Critical processes undocumented; Security operations missing; No version control; Review dates missing
questions.nc_pattern: Operating procedures not documented for critical security processes.

questions.question: How are procedures made accessible to relevant personnel?
questions.guidance: Procedure accessibility review. Look for: documentation repository; access controls; search capability; offline access for emergency.
questions.auditor_focus: Can staff find procedures when needed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documentation repository and appropriate access controls and search capability and offline access and staff can find and accessible
questions.red_flags: No repository; Access too restricted; No search; No offline access; Staff cannot find
questions.nc_pattern: Operating procedures not accessible to relevant personnel when needed.

questions.question: How often are procedures reviewed and updated?
questions.guidance: Procedure review cycle assessment. Look for: review schedule; update triggers; change management; owner accountability.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review schedule and update triggers and change management and owner accountability and recent review and changes tracked
questions.red_flags: No review schedule; Triggers undefined; No change management; No accountability; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Operating procedures not reviewed and updated at required intervals.

questions.question: Do procedures include security steps?
questions.guidance: Security integration review. Look for: security embedded in procedures not separate; verification checkpoints; security considerations.
questions.auditor_focus: Is security integral or bolted on?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security embedded in procedures and verification checkpoints and security considerations and not separate and comprehensive coverage
questions.red_flags: Security separate; No checkpoints; Considerations missing; Bolted on; Coverage incomplete
questions.nc_pattern: Security steps not integrated into operating procedures.

questions.question: How is staff competence on procedures verified?
questions.guidance: Procedure competence review. Look for: training records; competency verification; procedure acknowledgment; periodic assessment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training records and competency verification and acknowledgment and periodic assessment and staff competent and documented
questions.red_flags: No training records; Competency not verified; No acknowledgment; No assessment; Staff incompetent
questions.nc_pattern: Staff competence on operating procedures not verified.

questions.question: Provide your pre-employment screening policy.
questions.guidance: Screening requirements verification. Look for: check types including criminal and employment history and qualifications; timing requirements; role-based requirements; proportionality to risk level.
questions.auditor_focus: Are all candidates screened before starting?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive screening policy covering all check types and timing requirements and role-based proportionality and consistent application and documented procedures
questions.red_flags: No screening policy; Inconsistent application; Checks not completed before start; No role differentiation; Ad-hoc approach
questions.nc_pattern: Pre-employment screening policy not documented or not consistently applied.

questions.question: How is screening proportional to role sensitivity?
questions.guidance: Tiered screening review. Look for: risk-based approach proportional to information classification level; enhanced checks for privileged roles and admin access; access level differentiation; documented criteria for tiering.
questions.auditor_focus: What extra checks for sensitive roles?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Tiered screening based on access levels and enhanced checks for privileged roles and documented criteria for each tier and risk-based approach demonstrated and consistent application
questions.red_flags: No tiering; Same checks for all roles; Privileged roles not identified; No risk-based approach; Criteria undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Screening not proportional to role sensitivity or privileged access requirements.

questions.question: Are ongoing or periodic checks conducted?
questions.guidance: Periodic re-screening review. Look for: re-screening policy; trigger events defined; frequency for sensitive roles; continuous monitoring where applicable.
questions.auditor_focus: Is screening a one-time event or ongoing?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Periodic re-screening policy documented and trigger events defined and frequency appropriate to role sensitivity and records maintained and continuous monitoring where justified
questions.red_flags: One-time screening only; No re-screening policy; Trigger events not defined; No records of periodic checks
questions.nc_pattern: Ongoing screening not conducted for roles with continued access to sensitive information.

questions.question: How are contractors and third parties screened?
questions.guidance: Third party screening review. Look for: contract requirements for screening; equivalent standards applied; evidence collection; verification process.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Contract requirements specify screening and equivalent standards to employees and evidence collected from suppliers and verification conducted and records maintained
questions.red_flags: No contractor screening requirements; Lower standards than employees; No evidence collection; Verification not conducted
questions.nc_pattern: Contractors and third parties not subject to equivalent screening requirements.

questions.question: Is screening compliant with applicable laws?
questions.guidance: Legal compliance review. Look for: privacy considerations addressed; consent requirements met; record retention appropriate; discrimination avoidance documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Privacy considerations documented and consent obtained before checks and retention periods compliant and discrimination avoided and legal review conducted and procedures updated for changes
questions.red_flags: Privacy requirements ignored; No consent obtained; Excessive retention; Discriminatory practices; No legal review
questions.nc_pattern: Screening practices not demonstrably compliant with applicable privacy and employment laws.

questions.question: Do employment contracts include security responsibilities?
questions.guidance: Contract review for security content. Look for: security clauses in contracts; confidentiality obligations; acceptable use acknowledgment; post-employment obligations; consequences for breach.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me the security clauses in contracts.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security clauses in all contracts and confidentiality obligations defined and acceptable use acknowledgment required and post-employment obligations included and consequences documented
questions.red_flags: No security clauses; Confidentiality missing; No acknowledgment required; Post-employment not addressed; Consequences unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Employment contracts do not include information security responsibilities.

questions.question: How are security obligations communicated to new starters?
questions.guidance: Onboarding security communication review. Look for: induction materials covering security; policy acknowledgment process; security briefing provided; ongoing communication plan.
questions.auditor_focus: Is security emphasised from day one?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security in induction materials and policy acknowledgment recorded and security briefing provided and ongoing communication plan and new starter checklist includes security
questions.red_flags: Security not in induction; No acknowledgment process; No briefing; Ongoing communication absent; Checklist incomplete
questions.nc_pattern: Security obligations not communicated to new starters during onboarding.

questions.question: Do contracts address post-employment obligations?
questions.guidance: Post-employment terms review. Look for: confidentiality continuing after termination; return of assets requirements; ongoing restrictions; enforceability provisions.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Confidentiality continues after termination and asset return requirements and ongoing restrictions documented and enforceable provisions included and duration specified
questions.red_flags: Post-employment not addressed; No asset return clause; Restrictions unclear; Not enforceable; No duration
questions.nc_pattern: Post-employment security obligations not addressed in employment contracts.

questions.question: Are equivalent terms applied to contractors?
questions.guidance: Contractor terms review. Look for: contract clauses for non-employees; equivalent security obligations; compliance monitoring requirements; consequences for breach.
questions.auditor_focus: Do contractor contracts mirror employee terms?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Equivalent clauses in contractor contracts and security obligations equivalent to employees and compliance monitoring included and consequences documented and regular review
questions.red_flags: Lower standards for contractors; Security obligations missing; No monitoring; No consequences; Contracts not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Contractor contracts do not include equivalent security terms to employee contracts.

questions.question: How are changes to terms communicated?
questions.guidance: Terms update process review. Look for: update notification process; re-acknowledgment requirements; version tracking; evidence of communication.
questions.auditor_focus: How do employees know terms have changed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Update notification process documented and re-acknowledgment required for material changes and version tracking maintained and communication records kept and timely notification
questions.red_flags: No notification process; No re-acknowledgment; No version tracking; No communication records; Delayed notification
questions.nc_pattern: Changes to security terms not communicated to employees with acknowledgment.

controls.control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training

questions.question: Provide your security awareness program.
questions.guidance: Program comprehensiveness review. Look for: program documentation; content coverage including policies and threats and procedures; delivery methods; frequency; target audience definition.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive program documentation and content covering all key areas and multiple delivery methods and appropriate frequency and target audiences defined and current content
questions.red_flags: No program documentation; Limited content coverage; Single delivery method; Infrequent training; Audiences undefined
questions.nc_pattern: Security awareness program not documented or lacks comprehensive content coverage.

questions.question: What is your training completion rate?
questions.guidance: Completion metrics review. Look for: completion rate target minimum 95%; tracking mechanism; follow-up for non-completion; escalation process for persistent non-compliance.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Completion rate at or above 95% target and tracking mechanism in place and follow-up for non-completion and escalation process documented and trends tracked
questions.red_flags: Completion rate below 95%; No tracking mechanism; No follow-up; No escalation; Declining trend
questions.nc_pattern: Training completion rate below target with inadequate follow-up for non-completion.

questions.question: Is role-specific training provided?
questions.guidance: Specialised training review. Look for: developer security training; privileged user training; incident responder training; content details per role; completion tracking by role.
questions.auditor_focus: What extra training for high-risk roles?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Developer security training including OWASP and privileged user training and incident responder training and role-specific content documented and completion tracked by role
questions.red_flags: No role-specific training; Generic content for all; Developer training missing; Privileged users untrained; No tracking by role
questions.nc_pattern: Role-specific security training not provided for high-risk roles.

questions.question: How is training effectiveness measured?
questions.guidance: Effectiveness measurement review. Look for: assessment or testing; knowledge retention checks; phishing simulation results; behaviour change metrics.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know training is effective?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Assessment testing conducted and knowledge retention measured and phishing simulations run and behaviour metrics tracked and improvement demonstrated over time
questions.red_flags: No assessment; No retention checks; No simulations; No behaviour metrics; No improvement evidence
questions.nc_pattern: Training effectiveness not measured through assessment or behaviour change tracking.

questions.question: How is content updated for new threats?
questions.guidance: Content currency review. Look for: content review schedule; current threat incorporation; regulatory updates included; industry trends addressed; update process documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Content review schedule documented and current threats incorporated within reasonable timeframe and regulatory updates included and industry trends addressed and last update within 12 months
questions.red_flags: No review schedule; Content outdated over 12 months; Threats not incorporated; Regulatory gaps; No update process
questions.nc_pattern: Training content not updated for current threats or regulatory changes.

questions.question: Provide phishing simulation results.
questions.guidance: Simulation program review. Look for: simulation frequency minimum quarterly; click rates target under 5%; remedial training for failures; trend improvement over time.
questions.auditor_focus: What is your current phishing click rate?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Quarterly or more frequent simulations and click rate under 5% or improving trend and remedial training for failures and trend analysis documented and management reporting
questions.red_flags: No simulations; Infrequent simulations; Click rate above 10%; No remedial training; No trend tracking
questions.nc_pattern: Phishing simulation program absent or click rates above acceptable thresholds.

questions.question: Provide your disciplinary process for security violations.
questions.guidance: Disciplinary procedure review. Look for: procedure documentation; escalation levels defined; HR involvement; legal compliance; fairness provisions.
questions.auditor_focus: Is the process documented and fair?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Disciplinary procedure documented and escalation levels defined and HR involvement specified and legally compliant and fairness provisions included and consistent application
questions.red_flags: No documented procedure; Escalation unclear; No HR involvement; Legal compliance uncertain; Inconsistent application
questions.nc_pattern: Disciplinary process for security violations not documented or inconsistently applied.

questions.question: Is the process communicated to all personnel?
questions.guidance: Process communication review. Look for: policy communication evidence; acknowledgment records; regular reminders; new starter awareness; accessibility.
questions.auditor_focus: Do staff know the consequences of violations?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Process communicated to all personnel and acknowledgment records maintained and regular reminders provided and new starter awareness and easily accessible
questions.red_flags: Not communicated; No acknowledgment; No reminders; New starters unaware; Not accessible
questions.nc_pattern: Disciplinary process not communicated to personnel with acknowledgment.

questions.question: Can you provide examples of process application?
questions.guidance: Process application review. Look for: case examples anonymised; consistency of application; documentation completeness; appropriate outcomes.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Case examples available showing application and consistent application demonstrated and complete documentation and appropriate outcomes and lessons learned
questions.red_flags: No examples; Process not applied; Inconsistent application; Incomplete documentation; Inappropriate outcomes
questions.nc_pattern: Disciplinary process documented but evidence of application not available.

questions.question: Does the process apply to contractors?
questions.guidance: Contractor disciplinary review. Look for: contract clauses for violations; escalation to vendor management; equivalent consequences; enforcement capability.
questions.auditor_focus: Are contractors subject to similar process?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Contract clauses address violations and vendor management escalation defined and equivalent consequences and enforcement capability documented and examples available
questions.red_flags: No contract clauses; No vendor escalation; Lower consequences; No enforcement; No examples
questions.nc_pattern: Disciplinary process does not extend to contractor security violations.

questions.question: How are violations classified by severity?
questions.guidance: Severity classification review. Look for: severity criteria documented; proportionate responses defined; escalation triggers; repeat offense handling.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Severity criteria documented and proportionate responses for each level and escalation triggers defined and repeat offense handling and consistent application
questions.red_flags: No severity criteria; Disproportionate responses; No escalation triggers; Repeat offenses ignored; Inconsistent
questions.nc_pattern: Security violation severity classification not documented or consequences not proportionate.

controls.control_name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment

questions.question: What post-employment confidentiality obligations exist?
questions.guidance: Post-employment obligations review. Look for: NDA clauses; employment contract terms; duration of obligations specified; enforceability provisions.
questions.what_good_looks_like: NDA clauses in contracts and post-employment terms clear and duration specified and enforceable provisions and legal review conducted
questions.red_flags: No NDA clauses; Terms unclear; Duration not specified; Not enforceable; No legal review
questions.nc_pattern: Post-employment confidentiality obligations not documented or enforceable.

questions.question: How are departing employees reminded of obligations?
questions.guidance: Exit process review. Look for: exit interview content; written reminders provided; acknowledgment of ongoing obligations; return of materials confirmed.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there a structured exit process?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Structured exit process and security content in exit interview and written reminders provided and acknowledgment obtained and return of materials confirmed and checklist used
questions.red_flags: No exit process; No security content; No reminders; No acknowledgment; Return not confirmed
questions.nc_pattern: Departing employees not reminded of ongoing security obligations during exit process.

questions.question: How are role changes managed from a security perspective?
questions.guidance: Role change security review. Look for: access review at role change including screening review for elevated access per 6.1; removal of previous access; new role onboarding; timing requirements; documentation.
questions.auditor_focus: Is access reviewed at every role change?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access reviewed at every role change and previous access removed and new role onboarding includes security and timely execution and documented with approval
questions.red_flags: No role change process; Access not reviewed; Previous access retained; No security onboarding; Delayed execution
questions.nc_pattern: Access rights not reviewed and adjusted when personnel change roles.

questions.question: How is knowledge transfer managed securely?
questions.guidance: Knowledge transfer security review. Look for: handover procedures; documentation of responsibilities; access transition controls; supervision during handover.
questions.auditor_focus: Is sensitive knowledge protected during transition?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Handover procedures documented and responsibilities documented and access transition controlled and supervision for sensitive handovers and knowledge transfer recorded
questions.red_flags: No handover procedures; Responsibilities undocumented; Uncontrolled access transition; No supervision; No records
questions.nc_pattern: Knowledge transfer during role changes not managed securely.

questions.question: How are confidentiality obligations enforced?
questions.guidance: Enforcement capability review. Look for: monitoring capability; legal recourse documented; examples of enforcement anonymised; deterrent effect.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Monitoring capability exists and legal recourse documented and examples available and deterrent effect communicated and enforcement demonstrated
questions.red_flags: No monitoring; No legal recourse; No examples; No deterrent; Enforcement not demonstrated
questions.nc_pattern: Post-employment confidentiality obligations not enforceable or enforcement not demonstrated.

questions.question: Are NDAs required for employees and relevant third parties?
questions.guidance: NDA requirement review. Look for: NDA policy; standard templates; signing timing before access; coverage requirements defined.
questions.auditor_focus: Is NDA signing mandatory before access?
questions.what_good_looks_like: NDA policy documented and standard templates available and signing required before access and coverage requirements defined and compliance tracked
questions.red_flags: No NDA policy; No templates; Signing after access; Coverage unclear; No tracking
questions.nc_pattern: NDAs not required before access to confidential information is granted.

questions.question: Do NDAs reflect organisation protection needs?
questions.guidance: NDA content review. Look for: scope of confidential information defined; obligations clear; duration appropriate; remedies specified; mutual vs one-way appropriate.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Scope comprehensively defined and obligations clear and duration appropriate and remedies specified and mutual where appropriate and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: Scope too narrow; Obligations unclear; Duration inappropriate; No remedies; Always one-way
questions.nc_pattern: NDAs do not comprehensively reflect organisation information protection needs.

questions.question: Are NDAs reviewed and updated regularly?
questions.guidance: NDA review process verification. Look for: review schedule defined; legal review involvement; update triggers documented; version control maintained.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review schedule documented and legal review involved and update triggers defined and version control maintained and last review within 24 months
questions.red_flags: No review schedule; No legal involvement; No update triggers; No version control; Review overdue
questions.nc_pattern: NDAs not reviewed and updated at planned intervals.

questions.question: Is there a register of signed NDAs?
questions.guidance: NDA register review. Look for: register maintained; signed copies stored securely; accessibility for reference; expiry tracking; completeness.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you locate any person NDA?
questions.what_good_looks_like: NDA register maintained and signed copies stored securely and accessible for reference and expiry tracking and complete coverage and regular reconciliation
questions.red_flags: No register; Copies not stored; Not accessible; No expiry tracking; Incomplete coverage
questions.nc_pattern: NDA register not maintained or signed copies not accessible.

questions.question: Are mutual NDAs used appropriately?
questions.guidance: Mutual NDA review. Look for: two-way confidentiality for partnerships; equivalent obligations; balanced terms; appropriate use cases.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Mutual NDAs used for partnerships and equivalent obligations defined and balanced terms and appropriate use case determination and documented decisions
questions.red_flags: Always one-way; Obligations unbalanced; Inappropriate use; No documented decisions
questions.nc_pattern: Mutual NDAs not used where two-way confidentiality protection is required.

questions.question: Provide your remote working security policy.
questions.guidance: Remote work policy review. Look for: policy document covering security requirements; approved locations; prohibited activities; technical controls required.
questions.auditor_focus: Are remote work security requirements clear?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive remote work policy and security requirements documented and approved locations defined and prohibited activities specified and technical controls mandated
questions.red_flags: No remote policy; Requirements unclear; No approved locations; Prohibited activities undefined; Controls not mandated
questions.nc_pattern: Remote working security policy not documented or lacks clear requirements.

questions.question: What security controls apply to remote working?
questions.guidance: Technical controls review. Look for: VPN requirements; endpoint security; screen lock enforcement; secure Wi-Fi usage; MFA requirement.
questions.what_good_looks_like: VPN mandatory and endpoint security enforced and screen lock with appropriate timeout and secure Wi-Fi guidance and MFA required and controls verified
questions.red_flags: No VPN required; Endpoint security optional; No screen lock; Insecure Wi-Fi permitted; No MFA
questions.nc_pattern: Security controls for remote working not technically enforced.

questions.question: How is data protected when working remotely?
questions.guidance: Remote data protection review. Look for: encryption requirements; secure file access methods; local storage restrictions; printing controls.
questions.auditor_focus: Can sensitive data be saved locally?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Encryption required for remote data and secure file access only and local storage restricted or encrypted and printing controls in place and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: No encryption requirement; Insecure access permitted; Unrestricted local storage; No printing controls
questions.nc_pattern: Data protection requirements not defined or enforced for remote working.

questions.question: Are remote workers trained on security requirements?
questions.guidance: Remote worker training review. Look for: training content specific to remote work; policy acknowledgment; periodic reminders; compliance verification.
questions.auditor_focus: Have remote workers completed specific training?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Remote-specific training provided and policy acknowledgment recorded and periodic reminders sent and compliance verified and completion tracked
questions.red_flags: No remote training; No acknowledgment; No reminders; Compliance not verified; Tracking absent
questions.nc_pattern: Remote workers not trained on specific security requirements for remote work.

questions.question: How is home working environment security assessed?
questions.guidance: Home environment assessment review. Look for: self-assessment checklist; physical security considerations; network security guidance; verification process.
questions.auditor_focus: What assurance do you have about home setups?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Self-assessment checklist provided and physical security addressed and network security guidance and verification or attestation and regular reassessment
questions.red_flags: No assessment; Physical security ignored; No network guidance; No verification; One-time only
questions.nc_pattern: Home working environment security not assessed or verified.

questions.question: What is the process for reporting security events?
questions.guidance: Reporting process review. Look for: reporting channels including email and portal and phone; 24x7 availability; ease of reporting; acknowledgment to reporter.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple reporting channels available and 24x7 availability and easy to use and acknowledgment provided to reporter and process documented and accessible
questions.red_flags: Single channel only; Not 24x7; Difficult to use; No acknowledgment; Process unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Security event reporting process not accessible or easy to use for all personnel.

questions.question: How are personnel made aware of reporting procedures?
questions.guidance: Reporting awareness review. Look for: training content covering reporting; visible reporting information; regular reminders; new starter induction content.
questions.auditor_focus: Can all staff explain how to report?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training includes reporting procedures and visible information posted and regular reminders and induction covers reporting and staff awareness verified
questions.red_flags: Not in training; Information not visible; No reminders; Not in induction; Staff unaware
questions.nc_pattern: Personnel not aware of security event reporting procedures.

questions.question: Is there protection for reporters?
questions.guidance: Reporter protection review. Look for: whistleblower protection documented; anonymous reporting option; no retaliation policy; protection communicated.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Whistleblower protection policy and anonymous reporting option available and no retaliation policy documented and protection communicated and enforcement demonstrated
questions.red_flags: No protection policy; No anonymous option; Retaliation policy absent; Not communicated
questions.nc_pattern: Reporter protection from retaliation not documented or not communicated.

questions.question: What types of events should be reported?
questions.guidance: Reporting guidance review. Look for: reportable event examples; clear guidance on thresholds; when in doubt report message; escalation paths.
questions.auditor_focus: Do staff know what to report?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Clear examples of reportable events and guidance on thresholds and when in doubt report message and escalation paths documented and staff awareness verified
questions.red_flags: No examples; Unclear thresholds; No guidance; Escalation undefined; Staff confused
questions.nc_pattern: Guidance on reportable security events not clear or comprehensive.

questions.question: What is the expected reporting timeframe?
questions.guidance: Reporting timeliness review. Look for: timely reporting requirements; escalation for urgent events; acknowledgment timeframe; SLA for response.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Timely reporting requirements documented and urgent event escalation defined and acknowledgment timeframe specified and response SLA and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: No timing requirements; Urgent events not differentiated; No acknowledgment; No SLA; Compliance not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Security event reporting timeliness requirements not defined or not monitored.

questions.question: Are physical security perimeters defined?
questions.guidance: Perimeter definition review. Look for: secure areas identified; boundary documentation; security zones mapped; access requirements per zone defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Secure areas identified and documented and boundary documentation complete and security zones mapped and access requirements defined per zone and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No perimeter definition; Boundaries undocumented; Zones not mapped; Access requirements unclear; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Physical security perimeters not defined or documented for secure areas.

questions.question: How are perimeter boundaries documented?
questions.guidance: Boundary documentation review. Look for: floor plans; zone classifications; access point identification; boundary change management.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Floor plans available and zones classified and access points identified and change management for boundaries and regularly updated
questions.red_flags: No floor plans; Zones not classified; Access points unknown; No change management; Outdated
questions.nc_pattern: Physical perimeter boundaries not adequately documented or maintained.

questions.question: Are perimeters regularly assessed for vulnerabilities?
questions.guidance: Perimeter assessment review. Look for: periodic security assessments; penetration points identified; remediation tracked; external threat consideration.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Periodic assessments conducted and penetration points identified and remediation tracked and external threats considered and documented findings
questions.red_flags: No assessments; Penetration points unknown; Remediation not tracked; External threats ignored
questions.nc_pattern: Physical perimeter security not regularly assessed for vulnerabilities.

questions.question: How are emergency exits secured while maintaining safety?
questions.guidance: Emergency exit security review. Look for: alarmed exits; delayed egress where permitted; monitoring of exit use; balance of security and safety.
questions.auditor_focus: Are emergency exits both secure and compliant?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Alarmed exits and delayed egress where permitted and monitoring in place and safety compliance verified and documented procedures
questions.red_flags: Exits not alarmed; No monitoring; Safety compliance unclear; Security compromises safety
questions.nc_pattern: Emergency exits not secured appropriately or safety requirements not met.

questions.question: How is access to secure areas controlled?
questions.guidance: Access control review. Look for: access badges or tokens; biometrics where appropriate; access logs maintained; authorisation process documented; visitor management.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access badges or biometrics deployed and access logs maintained and authorisation process documented and visitor management in place and regular access review
questions.red_flags: No access control; Logs not maintained; No authorisation process; Visitors unmanaged; No access review
questions.nc_pattern: Physical entry controls not implemented or access logs not maintained.

questions.question: How are visitors managed?
questions.guidance: Visitor management review. Look for: visitor registration process; escort requirements; visitor badges issued; time limits enforced; sign-in and sign-out records.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Visitor registration process documented and escort requirements enforced and visitor badges issued and time limits applied and sign-in and sign-out records maintained
questions.red_flags: No visitor registration; No escort; No badges; No time limits; Records incomplete
questions.nc_pattern: Visitor management procedures not implemented or not consistently applied.

questions.question: Are offices rooms and facilities secured appropriately?
questions.guidance: Facility security review. Look for: access control for sensitive areas; clear desk enforcement; equipment protection; environmental controls; clean room requirements where applicable.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access control for sensitive areas and clear desk enforced and equipment protected and environmental controls in place and requirements documented per facility type
questions.red_flags: No access control; Clear desk not enforced; Equipment unprotected; No environmental controls; Requirements undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Offices rooms and facilities not secured according to sensitivity requirements.

questions.question: How are meeting rooms and shared spaces secured?
questions.guidance: Shared space security review. Look for: booking systems; automatic screen lock displays; clean desk after meetings; visitor supervision in meeting rooms.
questions.auditor_focus: Is sensitive information protected in shared spaces?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Booking systems and automatic screen locks and clean desk enforced and visitor supervision and whiteboards cleared and documented procedures
questions.red_flags: No booking control; Displays left on; Clean desk not enforced; Visitors unsupervised
questions.nc_pattern: Meeting rooms and shared spaces not secured for sensitive information protection.

questions.question: Are server rooms and data centres appropriately secured?
questions.guidance: Data centre security review. Look for: dedicated access controls; environmental monitoring; visitor logging; equipment protection; clean room standards where applicable.
questions.auditor_focus: What additional controls protect data centres?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Dedicated access controls and environmental monitoring and visitor logging and equipment protection and documented standards and regular review
questions.red_flags: Same access as offices; No environmental monitoring; Visitors not logged; Equipment unprotected
questions.nc_pattern: Server rooms and data centres not secured to appropriate standards.

questions.question: Is physical security monitoring implemented?
questions.guidance: Monitoring capability review. Look for: CCTV coverage; access monitoring; security personnel; alarm systems; monitoring hours defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: CCTV coverage of key areas and access monitoring active and security personnel or monitoring service and alarm systems operational and 24x7 or defined hours
questions.red_flags: No CCTV; Access not monitored; No security personnel; No alarms; Monitoring gaps
questions.nc_pattern: Physical security monitoring not implemented or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: Are monitoring systems continuously operational?
questions.guidance: Monitoring continuity review. Look for: 24x7 coverage where required; recording retention; system redundancy; maintenance schedule; failure alerting.
questions.what_good_looks_like: 24x7 coverage where required and recording retained appropriately and system redundancy and maintenance schedule followed and failure alerting configured
questions.red_flags: Gaps in coverage; Recording not retained; No redundancy; Maintenance overdue; Failures not detected
questions.nc_pattern: Physical monitoring systems not continuously operational or failures not detected.

questions.question: How is monitoring data retained and protected?
questions.guidance: Monitoring data protection review. Look for: retention period defined minimum 30 days; access controls on footage; integrity protection; secure storage.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Retention period defined and access controls on footage and integrity protection and secure storage and audit trail of access and policy documented
questions.red_flags: Retention undefined; Unrestricted access; No integrity protection; Insecure storage; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Physical monitoring data not retained or protected appropriately.

questions.question: Is there response capability for detected events?
questions.guidance: Response capability review. Look for: response procedures documented; security personnel availability; escalation process defined; response times targeted.
questions.auditor_focus: What happens when something is detected?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Response procedures documented and security personnel or service available and escalation process defined and response times targeted and tested periodically
questions.red_flags: No response procedures; Personnel unavailable; Escalation undefined; No response targets; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Physical security response capability not defined or not tested.

questions.question: For cloud-based systems how is physical security addressed?
questions.guidance: Cloud physical security review. Look for: cloud provider certifications including SOC 2 and ISO 27001; shared responsibility documentation; certificate review process.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me cloud provider physical security evidence.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Cloud provider certifications verified and shared responsibility documented and certificate review annual and physical security requirements in contracts and evidence on file
questions.red_flags: No provider certifications; Shared responsibility unclear; No certificate review; Not in contracts; No evidence
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud provider physical security not verified or shared responsibility undocumented.

controls.control_name: Protecting Against External and Environmental Threats

questions.question: Are environmental controls in place?
questions.guidance: Environmental protection review. Look for: fire detection and suppression; climate control HVAC; water damage prevention; monitoring of environmental conditions.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Fire detection and suppression and climate control and water damage prevention and environmental monitoring and maintenance schedule and testing records
questions.red_flags: No fire protection; No climate control; Water damage risk; No monitoring; Maintenance not current
questions.nc_pattern: Environmental controls not implemented or not maintained for information processing facilities.

questions.question: How are environmental threats assessed?
questions.guidance: Threat assessment review. Look for: environmental risk assessment; natural disaster consideration; external threat evaluation; mitigation measures documented.
questions.auditor_focus: What environmental risks have been assessed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Environmental risk assessment conducted and natural disasters considered and external threats evaluated and mitigation measures documented and regular review
questions.red_flags: No risk assessment; Natural disasters ignored; External threats not evaluated; No mitigation; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Environmental threats not assessed or mitigation measures not documented.

questions.question: Are secure area working rules defined?
questions.guidance: Secure area rules review. Look for: rules documented; supervision requirements; prohibited activities; recording device restrictions; access logging.
questions.auditor_focus: What rules apply in secure areas?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Secure area rules documented and supervision where required and prohibited activities defined and recording devices restricted and access logged
questions.red_flags: No rules documented; No supervision; Prohibited activities unclear; Recording allowed; Access not logged
questions.nc_pattern: Working rules for secure areas not defined or not enforced.

questions.question: How is work supervised in secure areas?
questions.guidance: Supervision review. Look for: supervision requirements documented; lone working policies; dual control for sensitive areas; monitoring arrangements.
questions.auditor_focus: Is supervision appropriate for risk level?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Supervision requirements documented and lone working addressed and dual control where needed and monitoring and compliance verified
questions.red_flags: No supervision requirements; Lone working uncontrolled; No dual control; No monitoring
questions.nc_pattern: Supervision in secure areas not appropriate for sensitivity level.

questions.question: How are recording devices controlled in secure areas?
questions.guidance: Recording device control review. Look for: mobile phone policy; camera restrictions; laptop camera covers; enforcement mechanisms; visitor device handling.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Mobile phone policy and camera restrictions and laptop camera covers where needed and enforcement and visitor devices addressed
questions.red_flags: No device policy; Cameras unrestricted; No enforcement; Visitors bring devices freely
questions.nc_pattern: Recording device restrictions not implemented or enforced in secure areas.

questions.question: Is there a clean desk and clear screen policy?
questions.guidance: Clean desk policy review. Look for: policy documentation; compliance checks performed; awareness training; enforcement mechanisms.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Clean desk policy documented and compliance checks performed and awareness training provided and enforcement mechanisms and regular audits
questions.red_flags: No policy; No compliance checks; No training; No enforcement; No audits
questions.nc_pattern: Clear desk and clear screen policy not documented or compliance not verified.

questions.question: How is clear desk compliance verified?
questions.guidance: Compliance verification review. Look for: periodic checks conducted; findings documented; remediation tracked; awareness reinforcement.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Periodic checks conducted and findings documented and remediation tracked and awareness reinforced and trends reported
questions.red_flags: No checks; Findings not documented; No remediation; No reinforcement
questions.nc_pattern: Clear desk compliance not actively monitored or enforced.

questions.question: Are secure storage facilities provided?
questions.guidance: Storage provision review. Look for: lockable drawers or cabinets; secure disposal bins; adequate provision for staff; key management.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Lockable storage provided and secure disposal bins and adequate for all staff and key management and regularly maintained
questions.red_flags: No lockable storage; No disposal bins; Inadequate provision; Key management poor
questions.nc_pattern: Secure storage facilities not provided to enable clear desk compliance.

questions.question: Is equipment sited to reduce environmental risks?
questions.guidance: Equipment siting review. Look for: server room location appropriate; cable routing protected; environmental controls in equipment areas; physical access restricted.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Server room appropriately located and cable routing protected and environmental controls adequate and physical access restricted and documented
questions.red_flags: Poor location; Cables unprotected; Environmental controls inadequate; Access unrestricted; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Equipment not sited to minimise environmental risks or unauthorised access.

questions.question: Is equipment protected from environmental risks?
questions.guidance: Environmental protection review. Look for: raised floors; waterproof covers where needed; climate control; dust protection; vibration isolation.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Raised floors where appropriate and waterproof protection and climate controlled and dust protected and vibration isolated where needed
questions.red_flags: No raised floors; Water risk; No climate control; Dust exposure; Vibration risk
questions.nc_pattern: Equipment not adequately protected from environmental hazards.

questions.question: Is equipment positioned to prevent unauthorised viewing?
questions.guidance: Screen positioning review. Look for: screens positioned away from windows; privacy screens where needed; positioning guidance; compliance checks.
questions.auditor_focus: Can screens be viewed by unauthorised persons?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Screens positioned appropriately and privacy screens and positioning guidance and compliance verified and remediation where needed
questions.red_flags: Screens visible externally; No privacy screens; No guidance; Compliance not checked
questions.nc_pattern: Equipment not positioned to prevent unauthorised viewing of sensitive information.

questions.question: How are assets protected when off-premises?
questions.guidance: Off-premises security review. Look for: authorisation for removal; encryption of portable devices; physical security guidance; tracking of removed assets.
questions.auditor_focus: Are off-site assets tracked and protected?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Authorisation required for removal and encryption of portable devices and physical security guidance provided and assets tracked and regular reconciliation
questions.red_flags: No authorisation; Unencrypted devices; No guidance; Assets not tracked; No reconciliation
questions.nc_pattern: Off-premises asset security not addressed or removed assets not tracked.

questions.question: How are assets tracked when removed from premises?
questions.guidance: Asset tracking review. Look for: removal authorisation process; asset register updates; return tracking; reconciliation procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you account for all off-site assets?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Removal authorisation and register updated and return tracked and reconciliation and complete accountability
questions.red_flags: No authorisation; Register not updated; Return not tracked; No reconciliation
questions.nc_pattern: Off-premises assets not tracked or reconciled with inventory.

questions.question: What physical security guidance is provided for off-site assets?
questions.guidance: Off-site guidance review. Look for: security guidance documented; storage requirements; transport security; loss reporting procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: Do staff know how to protect assets off-site?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security guidance documented and storage requirements and transport security and loss reporting and acknowledgment obtained
questions.red_flags: No guidance; Requirements unclear; Transport insecure; Reporting unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Physical security guidance not provided for off-premises asset protection.

questions.question: How is storage media managed?
questions.guidance: Storage media management review. Look for: media register maintained; handling procedures; secure storage; encryption where appropriate; tracking of media.
questions.auditor_focus: Is storage media tracked and secured?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Media register maintained and handling procedures documented and secure storage and encryption applied and tracking in place and regular audit
questions.red_flags: No register; No procedures; Insecure storage; No encryption; Not tracked; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Storage media not managed securely or not tracked in register.

questions.question: How is media disposed of securely?
questions.guidance: Media disposal review. Look for: secure disposal methods defined; certificates of destruction; third party disposal verification; disposal records maintained.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Secure disposal methods including shredding or degaussing and certificates of destruction and third party verification and disposal records maintained and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No secure disposal; No certificates; Third party unverified; Records incomplete; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Storage media disposal not secure or destruction not verified and documented.

questions.question: Are supporting utilities protected?
questions.guidance: Utilities protection review. Look for: UPS systems deployed; generator backup available; redundant cooling; utility monitoring; maintenance records.
questions.what_good_looks_like: UPS systems deployed and generator backup where required and redundant cooling and utility monitoring and maintenance current and testing records
questions.red_flags: No UPS; No generator; No cooling redundancy; No monitoring; Maintenance not current
questions.nc_pattern: Supporting utilities not protected or backup power not adequate for requirements.

questions.question: How are utilities monitored for failures?
questions.guidance: Utility monitoring review. Look for: monitoring systems deployed; alerting configured; escalation procedures; response capability.
questions.auditor_focus: How quickly are utility failures detected?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Monitoring systems and alerting configured and escalation procedures and response capability and tested regularly
questions.red_flags: No monitoring; No alerting; Escalation unclear; Response untested
questions.nc_pattern: Utility monitoring not implemented or failures not detected promptly.

questions.question: Are utilities tested regularly?
questions.guidance: Utility testing review. Look for: UPS testing schedule; generator testing; load testing conducted; test records maintained.
questions.what_good_looks_like: UPS testing scheduled and generator tested and load testing and records maintained and issues addressed
questions.red_flags: No testing schedule; Generator not tested; No load testing; Records incomplete
questions.nc_pattern: Supporting utilities not tested regularly to verify operational capability.

questions.question: How is cabling security maintained?
questions.guidance: Cabling security review. Look for: cable labelling; power and data segregation; physical protection of cables; access restrictions to cabling areas.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Cable labelling in place and power and data segregated and physical protection adequate and access to cabling restricted and documented
questions.red_flags: No labelling; No segregation; Cables unprotected; Access unrestricted; Undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Cabling security not adequate to prevent tampering or interception.

questions.question: Are network cables protected from interception?
questions.guidance: Cable interception protection review. Look for: cable runs in protected areas; conduit or trunking used; no exposed cabling in public areas; regular inspection.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Protected cable runs and conduit used and no public exposure and regular inspection and documented routes
questions.red_flags: Cables exposed; No conduit; Public area runs; No inspection
questions.nc_pattern: Network cabling not protected from potential interception or tampering.

questions.question: Is cabling documented and labelled?
questions.guidance: Cable documentation review. Look for: cable labelling scheme; documentation maintained; patch panel records; change tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: Can cables be traced and identified?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Labelling scheme and documentation maintained and patch records and change tracking and regular updates
questions.red_flags: No labelling; Documentation missing; Patch records incomplete; Changes not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Cabling not adequately documented or labelled for maintenance and security.

questions.question: Is equipment maintained according to specifications?
questions.guidance: Equipment maintenance review. Look for: maintenance schedules documented; authorised service personnel; maintenance records current; warranty tracking.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Maintenance schedules documented and authorised personnel only and records current and warranty tracked and manufacturer specifications followed
questions.red_flags: No schedules; Unauthorised personnel; Records not current; Warranty not tracked; Specifications not followed
questions.nc_pattern: Equipment not maintained according to manufacturer specifications or schedules.

questions.question: How is maintenance access controlled?
questions.guidance: Maintenance access review. Look for: maintenance personnel verification; escorting requirements; access logging; supervision for sensitive equipment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Personnel verification and escorting where required and access logged and supervision for sensitive equipment and documented
questions.red_flags: No verification; No escorting; Access not logged; No supervision
questions.nc_pattern: Maintenance personnel access not controlled or supervised appropriately.

questions.question: Is maintenance performed by authorised personnel only?
questions.guidance: Authorised personnel review. Look for: approved maintainers list; qualification verification; contract requirements; security clearance where required.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Approved maintainers list and qualifications verified and contract requirements and clearance where needed and regular review
questions.red_flags: No approved list; Qualifications not checked; No contract requirements; Clearance not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Maintenance not restricted to authorised and appropriately vetted personnel.

controls.control_name: Secure Disposal or Re-Use of Equipment

questions.question: How are equipment moves and disposals managed?
questions.guidance: Equipment disposal review. Look for: authorisation process for disposal; data sanitisation procedures; secure disposal methods; certificates of destruction.
questions.auditor_focus: How is data wiped before disposal?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Authorisation required for disposal and data sanitisation using approved standards and secure disposal methods and certificates obtained and records maintained
questions.red_flags: No authorisation; No sanitisation; Insecure disposal; No certificates; Records incomplete
questions.nc_pattern: Equipment disposal not managed securely or data sanitisation not verified.

questions.question: Is unattended equipment protected?
questions.guidance: Unattended equipment review. Look for: screen lock policies with appropriate timeout; physical locks where needed; automatic logoff; monitoring for violations.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Screen lock policy with timeout maximum 5 minutes and physical locks where appropriate and automatic logoff configured and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: No screen lock; Timeout too long; No physical locks; No auto-logoff; Compliance not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Unattended equipment not protected by screen lock or automatic logoff.

questions.question: Provide your endpoint security policy.
questions.guidance: Endpoint policy review. Look for: policy covering corporate devices and BYOD and mobile devices; MDM requirements; security baselines; acceptable use.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive endpoint policy covering all device types and MDM requirements specified and security baselines defined and acceptable use included and current
questions.red_flags: No endpoint policy; Device types missing; No MDM requirements; Baselines undefined; Outdated policy
questions.nc_pattern: Endpoint security policy not documented or does not cover all device types.

questions.question: Are endpoints encrypted?
questions.guidance: Encryption deployment review. Look for: full disk encryption; technology used such as BitLocker or FileVault; key management; compliance rate target 100%.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Full disk encryption deployed and technology documented and key management in place and compliance rate at or near 100% and monitoring active
questions.red_flags: No encryption; Partial deployment; No key management; Low compliance rate; No monitoring
questions.nc_pattern: Endpoint devices not encrypted or encryption compliance rate below target.

questions.question: What endpoint protection is deployed?
questions.guidance: EDR deployment review. Look for: AV or EDR solution deployed; central management; signature updates automated; behavioural detection enabled.
questions.what_good_looks_like: EDR or AV solution deployed and centrally managed and signatures updated automatically and behavioural detection enabled and coverage complete
questions.red_flags: No endpoint protection; Not centrally managed; Manual updates; No behavioural detection; Coverage gaps
questions.nc_pattern: Endpoint protection not deployed or not centrally managed with current signatures.

questions.question: How are lost or stolen devices handled?
questions.guidance: Lost device procedures review. Look for: remote wipe capability; reporting process; incident response procedures; device tracking where appropriate.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you remotely wipe a device right now?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Remote wipe capability and documented reporting process and incident response for lost devices and tracking capability where appropriate and tested regularly
questions.red_flags: No remote wipe; No reporting process; No incident response; No tracking; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Lost or stolen device procedures not defined or remote wipe capability not available.

questions.question: Are screen locks enforced?
questions.guidance: Screen lock enforcement review. Look for: timeout settings maximum 5 minutes recommended; GPO or MDM enforcement; compliance monitoring; exception handling.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Screen lock timeout configured maximum 5 minutes and enforced via GPO or MDM and compliance monitored and exceptions documented and controlled
questions.red_flags: No screen lock; Timeout too long; Not enforced; Compliance not monitored; Uncontrolled exceptions
questions.nc_pattern: Screen lock timeout not enforced or set above acceptable threshold.

questions.question: How is USB and removable media controlled?
questions.guidance: USB control review. Look for: USB blocking or allow-listing; DLP controls; encryption requirements for approved media; policy enforcement.
questions.what_good_looks_like: USB blocking or allow-listing implemented and DLP controls in place and encryption required for approved media and policy enforced and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: No USB control; Open USB access; No DLP; No encryption requirement; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: USB and removable media access not controlled or policy not enforced.

questions.question: Provide your privileged access inventory.
questions.guidance: Privileged account inventory review. Look for: complete list of privileged accounts; role definitions; justification for each; owner assignments documented.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you know all privileged accounts?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Complete privileged account inventory and role definitions documented and justification for each account and owners assigned and regular reconciliation
questions.red_flags: Incomplete inventory; Roles undefined; No justification; No owners; Not reconciled
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged access inventory incomplete or not maintained.

questions.question: How is privileged access provisioned?
questions.guidance: Provisioning process review. Look for: approval workflow documented; business justification required; least privilege verification; time limits applied where appropriate.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Approval workflow documented and business justification required and least privilege verified and time limits where appropriate and just-in-time where feasible
questions.red_flags: No approval workflow; No justification required; Excessive privileges; Permanent access; No JIT
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged access provisioning lacks approval workflow or least privilege verification.

questions.question: How often is privileged access reviewed?
questions.guidance: Access review process verification. Look for: review frequency minimum quarterly; recertification process; review evidence maintained; actions taken on findings.
questions.auditor_focus: Show me recent privileged access review.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Quarterly or more frequent reviews and recertification process documented and review evidence maintained and actions taken on findings and trend tracking
questions.red_flags: Reviews less than quarterly; No recertification; No evidence; Actions not taken; No trends
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged access not reviewed at required frequency or review evidence not maintained.

questions.question: Is MFA mandatory for privileged accounts?
questions.guidance: MFA enforcement review. Look for: MFA requirement for all privileged access; authentication methods approved; enforcement mechanism; exception handling documented.
