questions.what_good_looks_like: MFA mandatory for all privileged access and authentication methods approved and enforcement mechanism and exceptions documented and controlled
questions.red_flags: No MFA requirement; Partial enforcement; Unapproved methods; No enforcement mechanism; Uncontrolled exceptions
questions.nc_pattern: MFA not mandatory for privileged accounts or enforcement not complete.

questions.question: How is privileged activity monitored?
questions.guidance: Activity monitoring review. Look for: session recording where appropriate; command logging; alert triggers defined; log retention; review process.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Session recording for sensitive access and command logging enabled and alert triggers configured and retention adequate and regular review process
questions.red_flags: No session recording; No command logging; No alerts; Inadequate retention; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged activity not monitored or logged with adequate detail and retention.

questions.question: Is a PAM solution deployed?
questions.guidance: PAM deployment review. Look for: PAM tool in use; features enabled including vaulting and rotation and session recording; coverage of privileged accounts.
questions.what_good_looks_like: PAM solution deployed and vaulting enabled and credential rotation and session recording and coverage complete and integration with workflows
questions.red_flags: No PAM solution; Limited features; No rotation; No session recording; Incomplete coverage
questions.nc_pattern: PAM solution not deployed or key features not enabled.

questions.question: How is access restricted based on classification?
questions.guidance: Classification-based access review. Look for: access controls aligned with classification levels; technical enforcement; verification procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: Is access technically enforced by classification?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access controls aligned with classification and technical enforcement mechanisms and verification procedures and consistent application and audit capability
questions.red_flags: No classification alignment; Not technically enforced; No verification; Inconsistent; Not auditable
questions.nc_pattern: Access restrictions not aligned with information classification levels.

questions.question: How is need-to-know enforced?
questions.guidance: Need-to-know verification review. Look for: access request process; owner approval required; periodic review; access removal when no longer needed.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you verify ongoing need?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access request process documented and owner approval required and periodic review conducted and access removed when not needed and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No request process; No owner approval; No periodic review; Access not removed; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Need-to-know principle not enforced through access request and review process.

questions.question: Are there controls on data extraction?
questions.guidance: Data extraction controls review. Look for: DLP controls deployed; print restrictions where appropriate; download monitoring; copy and paste limitations where needed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: DLP controls deployed and print restrictions where appropriate and download monitoring and copy controls where needed and alerts configured
questions.red_flags: No DLP; No print restrictions; No download monitoring; No copy controls; No alerts
questions.nc_pattern: Controls on data extraction not implemented or not effective.

questions.question: How is database access controlled?
questions.guidance: Database access control review. Look for: database access controls; query logging; direct access restrictions; service account management.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Database access controls in place and query logging enabled and direct access restricted and service accounts managed and regular review
questions.red_flags: No database controls; No query logging; Unrestricted direct access; Service accounts unmanaged; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Database access not controlled or direct access not appropriately restricted.

questions.question: Are access restrictions auditable?
questions.guidance: Audit capability review. Look for: access logs maintained; permission records; change audit trail; reporting capability.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you audit who accessed what data?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access logs maintained and permission records complete and change audit trail and reporting capability and retention adequate
questions.red_flags: No access logs; Incomplete records; No audit trail; No reporting; Inadequate retention
questions.nc_pattern: Access restrictions not auditable due to insufficient logging or records.

questions.question: How is source code repository access controlled?
questions.guidance: Repository access review. Look for: repository access management; role-based access; access logging; authentication requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Repository access managed and role-based access implemented and access logging enabled and strong authentication and regular review
questions.red_flags: No access management; No RBAC; No logging; Weak authentication; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Source code repository access not controlled or not logged.

questions.question: Is production code access separately controlled?
questions.guidance: Production code access review. Look for: separation from development access; restricted access; approval process; audit trail.
questions.auditor_focus: Can developers access production code directly?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Production code access separate from development and access restricted and approval required and audit trail maintained and regular review
questions.red_flags: No separation; Unrestricted access; No approval; No audit trail; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Production code access not separately controlled from development access.

questions.question: Are code changes tracked and attributed?
questions.guidance: Code change tracking review. Look for: version control; commit attribution; code review records; branch protection rules.
questions.auditor_focus: Can changes be traced to individuals?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Version control in place and commit attribution required and code review records and branch protection enabled and traceability complete
questions.red_flags: No version control; Anonymous commits; No code review; No branch protection; No traceability
questions.nc_pattern: Code changes not tracked or not attributable to individual developers.

questions.question: How is access to build and deployment tools controlled?
questions.guidance: CI/CD access review. Look for: access restrictions on CI/CD; deployment approvals; secrets management; segregation of duties.
questions.what_good_looks_like: CI/CD access restricted and deployment approvals required and secrets management in place and segregation enforced and audit trail
questions.red_flags: Unrestricted CI/CD access; No deployment approval; Secrets exposed; No segregation; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Build and deployment tool access not controlled or segregation not enforced.

questions.question: How are software dependencies managed?
questions.guidance: Dependency management review. Look for: approved library sources; vulnerability scanning; SBOM generation; license compliance tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you scan dependencies for vulnerabilities?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Approved library sources defined and vulnerability scanning automated and SBOM generated and license compliance tracked and remediation process
questions.red_flags: No approved sources; No vulnerability scanning; No SBOM; No license tracking; No remediation
questions.nc_pattern: Software dependencies not managed or not scanned for vulnerabilities.

questions.question: What authentication technologies are implemented?
questions.guidance: Authentication technology review. Look for: authentication methods used; password complexity requirements; MFA types deployed; biometrics if applicable.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Authentication methods documented and password complexity enforced and MFA deployed and appropriate methods for risk and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: Methods undocumented; Weak passwords allowed; No MFA; Inappropriate methods; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Authentication technologies not documented or not appropriate for risk level.

questions.question: Where is MFA implemented?
questions.guidance: MFA coverage review. Look for: coverage of remote access and privileged accounts and cloud services and email and internal applications; enforcement.
questions.what_good_looks_like: MFA coverage comprehensive including remote and privileged and cloud and email and critical apps and enforcement verified and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: Limited MFA coverage; Remote access excluded; Privileged accounts excluded; Cloud gaps; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: MFA not implemented comprehensively across required access points.

questions.question: Are default and weak passwords prohibited?
questions.guidance: Password strength enforcement review. Look for: password policy enforcement; default credential detection; password blacklists; complexity requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Password policy enforced technically and default detection capability and password blacklists implemented and complexity requirements and regular testing
questions.red_flags: Weak passwords allowed; Defaults not detected; No blacklists; No complexity; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Default or weak passwords not prohibited or detection not in place.

questions.question: How are authentication failures handled?
questions.guidance: Authentication failure handling review. Look for: account lockout policy; failed attempt logging; alerting on suspicious activity; unlock process.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Account lockout policy configured and failed attempts logged and alerts for suspicious patterns and documented unlock process and monitoring
questions.red_flags: No lockout; Failures not logged; No alerting; No unlock process; No monitoring
questions.nc_pattern: Authentication failures not handled securely or not logged for analysis.

questions.question: Is there protection against credential attacks?
questions.guidance: Credential attack protection review. Look for: rate limiting; CAPTCHA where appropriate; account lockout; brute force detection; credential stuffing protection.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Rate limiting implemented and CAPTCHA where appropriate and account lockout and brute force detection and credential stuffing protection and monitoring
questions.red_flags: No rate limiting; No CAPTCHA; No lockout; No detection; No stuffing protection
questions.nc_pattern: Protection against credential attacks not implemented or not comprehensive.

questions.question: How is system capacity monitored?
questions.guidance: Capacity monitoring review. Look for: monitoring tools deployed; metrics tracked; dashboards available; alerting thresholds configured.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Monitoring tools deployed and key metrics tracked and dashboards available and alerting thresholds configured and regular review
questions.red_flags: No monitoring tools; Metrics not tracked; No dashboards; No alerting; No review
questions.nc_pattern: System capacity not monitored or key metrics not tracked.

questions.question: Is there capacity planning?
questions.guidance: Capacity planning review. Look for: forecasting methodology; growth projections; resource planning; budget alignment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Forecasting methodology documented and growth projections made and resource planning aligned and budget provision and regular updates
questions.red_flags: No forecasting; No projections; No resource planning; No budget alignment; Not updated
questions.nc_pattern: Capacity planning not conducted or not aligned with business growth.

questions.question: What alerts exist for capacity thresholds?
questions.guidance: Alerting configuration review. Look for: alert configuration; threshold levels appropriate; escalation procedures; response actions defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Alerts configured for key metrics and threshold levels appropriate and escalation procedures and response actions defined and tested
questions.red_flags: No alerts; Inappropriate thresholds; No escalation; Response undefined; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Capacity threshold alerts not configured or thresholds not appropriate.

questions.question: How is capacity scaled when needed?
questions.guidance: Scaling capability review. Look for: scaling procedures; auto-scaling capability; manual intervention process; emergency scaling procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you scale quickly if needed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Scaling procedures documented and auto-scaling where appropriate and manual process defined and emergency procedures and tested
questions.red_flags: No scaling procedures; No auto-scaling; Manual process unclear; No emergency procedure; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Capacity scaling procedures not defined or not tested.

questions.question: Is redundancy implemented for critical systems?
questions.guidance: Redundancy review. Look for: high availability architecture; failover capability; redundant components; SLA alignment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: HA architecture for critical systems and failover capability and redundant components and SLA aligned and tested regularly
questions.red_flags: No HA; No failover; No redundancy; SLA misaligned; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Redundancy not implemented for critical systems or availability requirements not met.

questions.question: Is anti-malware deployed across all endpoints?
questions.guidance: Anti-malware coverage review. Look for: coverage rate target 100%; solution deployed; central management; compliance monitoring.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Anti-malware deployed with 100% coverage target and solution documented and centrally managed and compliance monitored and gaps addressed
questions.red_flags: Coverage below target; Solution outdated; Not centrally managed; No compliance monitoring; Gaps ignored
questions.nc_pattern: Anti-malware not deployed to all endpoints or coverage below target.

questions.question: Are signatures and definitions updated automatically?
questions.guidance: Update process review. Look for: automatic update frequency; compliance monitoring; offline device handling; update verification.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Automatic updates configured and update frequency adequate and compliance monitored and offline devices addressed and verification in place
questions.red_flags: Manual updates; Infrequent updates; Compliance not monitored; Offline devices ignored; No verification
questions.nc_pattern: Malware signatures and definitions not updated automatically or not current.

questions.question: Is malware scanning performed on email and web traffic?
questions.guidance: Gateway protection review. Look for: email gateway scanning; web proxy scanning; sandboxing capability; detonation for suspicious content.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Email gateway scanning and web proxy scanning and sandboxing capability and detonation for suspicious and coverage complete
questions.red_flags: No email scanning; No web scanning; No sandboxing; No detonation; Coverage gaps
questions.nc_pattern: Email and web traffic not scanned for malware at gateway level.

questions.question: How are malware detections handled?
questions.guidance: Detection response review. Look for: alert triage process; investigation procedures; containment actions; remediation; reporting.
questions.auditor_focus: Walk me through a recent detection.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Alert triage process documented and investigation procedures and containment actions defined and remediation tracked and reporting to management
questions.red_flags: No triage process; No investigation procedures; No containment; Remediation not tracked; No reporting
questions.nc_pattern: Malware detection response process not defined or not followed.

questions.question: Is user awareness training provided for malware?
questions.guidance: Malware awareness review. Look for: training content on malware; phishing simulations; suspicious file handling; reporting procedures.
questions.auditor_focus: What malware topics are covered in training?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training content includes malware awareness and phishing simulations conducted and suspicious file handling covered and reporting procedures included and refreshed regularly
questions.red_flags: No malware training; No phishing simulations; File handling not covered; Reporting unclear; Not refreshed
questions.nc_pattern: User awareness training does not adequately cover malware threats and response.

questions.question: Describe your patch management process.
questions.guidance: Patch management review. Look for: patch identification process; testing requirements; deployment procedures; emergency procedures; rollback capability.
questions.auditor_focus: How are patches identified and deployed?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Patch identification process documented and testing before deployment and deployment procedures and emergency patching and rollback capability
questions.red_flags: No identification process; No testing; Procedures undefined; No emergency process; No rollback
questions.nc_pattern: Patch management process not documented or key steps missing.

questions.question: What are your patching SLAs?
questions.guidance: Patching SLA review. Look for: critical patches 7 to 14 days; high patches 30 days; medium patches 60 days; compliance metrics; exception handling.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Patching SLAs documented with critical 7 to 14 days and high 30 days and medium 60 days and compliance metrics tracked and exceptions documented
questions.red_flags: No SLAs; Timeframes too long; Compliance not tracked; Metrics not reported; Exceptions uncontrolled
questions.nc_pattern: Patching SLAs not defined or compliance not tracked against timeframes.

questions.question: How often is penetration testing conducted?
questions.guidance: Penetration testing schedule review. Look for: annual minimum frequency; scope defined; qualified testers; methodology documented.
questions.auditor_focus: When was the last pen test?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Annual or more frequent testing and scope covers critical systems and qualified testers engaged and methodology documented and management approved
questions.red_flags: Less than annual; Scope limited; Unqualified testers; No methodology; Not approved
questions.nc_pattern: Penetration testing not conducted annually or scope insufficient.

questions.question: How are penetration test findings remediated?
questions.guidance: Finding remediation review. Look for: finding tracking; remediation timelines; verification testing; retest results.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Findings tracked in register and remediation timelines defined and verification testing conducted and retest confirms closure and management reporting
questions.red_flags: Findings not tracked; No timelines; No verification; No retest; No reporting
questions.nc_pattern: Penetration test findings not tracked or remediation not verified.

questions.question: Is vulnerability scanning conducted regularly?
questions.guidance: Vulnerability scanning review. Look for: scan frequency; coverage; finding prioritisation; remediation tracking; trend reporting.
questions.auditor_focus: What is your vulnerability scan frequency?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regular scanning minimum monthly and comprehensive coverage and risk-based prioritisation and remediation tracked and trends reported
questions.red_flags: Infrequent scanning; Limited coverage; No prioritisation; Remediation not tracked; No trends
questions.nc_pattern: Vulnerability scanning not conducted regularly or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: Describe your vulnerability management program.
questions.guidance: VM program review. Look for: documented program; scanning tools; frequency defined; finding management; remediation workflow.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Documented VM program and scanning tools deployed and frequency defined and finding management process and remediation workflow and ownership assigned
questions.red_flags: No documented program; Ad-hoc scanning; Frequency undefined; No finding management; No workflow
questions.nc_pattern: Vulnerability management not established as formal documented program.

questions.question: How are vulnerabilities prioritised?
questions.guidance: Prioritisation methodology review. Look for: risk-based approach; CVSS scoring used; business impact consideration; exploitability assessment; asset criticality factored.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Risk-based prioritisation and CVSS scoring applied and business impact considered and exploitability assessed and asset criticality factored and documented rationale
questions.red_flags: No prioritisation; CVSS not used; Business impact ignored; Exploitability not assessed; No documentation
questions.nc_pattern: Vulnerability prioritisation not risk-based or methodology not documented.

questions.question: What are your remediation SLAs?
questions.guidance: SLA documentation review. Look for: timeframes by severity; compliance tracking; exception process; escalation procedures.
questions.what_good_looks_like: SLAs by severity documented and compliance tracked and exception process defined and escalation procedures and reporting to management
questions.red_flags: No SLAs; Compliance not tracked; No exception process; No escalation; No reporting
questions.nc_pattern: Vulnerability remediation SLAs not documented or compliance not tracked.

questions.question: How is software installation restricted?
questions.guidance: Installation restriction review. Look for: admin rights restricted; software approval process; whitelist management; unauthorised software detection.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Admin rights restricted and software approval process and whitelist or application control and unauthorised detection and enforcement verified
questions.red_flags: Unrestricted admin; No approval process; No whitelist; No detection; Not enforced
questions.nc_pattern: Software installation not restricted or unauthorised software not detected.

questions.question: How is patch compliance monitored?
questions.guidance: Compliance monitoring review. Look for: compliance dashboards; non-compliant device handling; reporting frequency; trend tracking.
questions.auditor_focus: What is current patch compliance rate?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance dashboards available and non-compliant devices addressed and regular reporting and trend tracking and management visibility
questions.red_flags: No dashboards; Non-compliant devices ignored; No reporting; No trends; No visibility
questions.nc_pattern: Patch compliance not monitored or non-compliant devices not addressed.

questions.question: Are security baselines documented?
questions.guidance: Baseline documentation review. Look for: hardening standards documented; CIS benchmarks or equivalent; custom standards justified; coverage of system types.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Hardening standards documented and based on CIS or equivalent and custom standards justified and coverage of all system types and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No baselines; Not based on standards; Unjustified custom; Limited coverage; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Security configuration baselines not documented or not based on recognised standards.

questions.question: How is configuration compliance monitored?
questions.guidance: Compliance monitoring review. Look for: configuration scanning; drift detection capability; compliance reporting; alerting on deviations.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Configuration scanning implemented and drift detection and compliance reporting and alerting on deviations and remediation tracked
questions.red_flags: No scanning; No drift detection; No reporting; No alerting; No remediation
questions.nc_pattern: Configuration compliance not monitored or drift not detected.

questions.question: How are configuration changes controlled?
questions.guidance: Change control review. Look for: change management process; approval requirements; testing before deployment; rollback capability.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Change management for config changes and approval required and testing conducted and rollback capability and audit trail maintained
questions.red_flags: No change management; No approval; No testing; No rollback; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Configuration changes not subject to change management process.

questions.question: Are default configurations removed?
questions.guidance: Default removal review. Look for: default credentials changed; unnecessary services removed; unnecessary ports closed; verification conducted.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Default credentials changed and unnecessary services removed and ports closed and verification conducted and documented and regularly checked
questions.red_flags: Defaults unchanged; Services not removed; Ports open; No verification; Not documented
questions.nc_pattern: Default configurations not removed or verification not conducted.

questions.question: Is Infrastructure as Code used?
questions.guidance: IaC implementation review. Look for: IaC implementation; version control of infrastructure; security scanning tools such as Checkov or tfsec; automated deployment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: IaC implemented and version controlled and security scanning integrated and automated deployment and audit trail maintained
questions.red_flags: No IaC; Not version controlled; No security scanning; Manual deployment; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Infrastructure as Code not implemented or not scanned for security issues.

questions.question: Provide your data deletion policy.
questions.guidance: Deletion policy review. Look for: retention periods defined; deletion triggers documented; deletion methods specified; verification procedures.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Data deletion policy documented and retention periods defined and deletion triggers and deletion methods specified and verification procedures
questions.red_flags: No deletion policy; Retention undefined; Triggers unclear; Methods not specified; No verification
questions.nc_pattern: Data deletion policy not documented or retention periods not defined.

questions.question: How is deletion verified as complete?
questions.guidance: Deletion verification review. Look for: verification procedures; backup consideration; audit trails; certificates where appropriate.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you confirm data is deleted?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Verification procedures documented and backup deletion addressed and audit trails maintained and certificates for sensitive data and regular audits
questions.red_flags: No verification; Backups ignored; No audit trails; No certificates; No audits
questions.nc_pattern: Data deletion verification procedures not defined or not followed.

questions.question: What secure deletion methods are used?
questions.guidance: Deletion methods review. Look for: data sanitisation standards such as NIST SP 800-88; crypto-shredding capability; physical destruction where required.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Sanitisation standards documented and aligned with NIST SP 800-88 or equivalent and crypto-shredding and physical destruction options and method selection criteria
questions.red_flags: No standards; Not aligned with NIST; No crypto-shred; No physical option; No criteria
questions.nc_pattern: Secure deletion methods not documented or not aligned with recognised standards.

questions.question: How is deletion from backups managed?
questions.guidance: Backup deletion review. Look for: backup retention alignment; deletion from archives; verification of backup deletion; timing considerations.
questions.auditor_focus: Is data deleted from backups too?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Backup retention aligned with deletion policy and deletion from archives addressed and verification conducted and timing documented and challenges acknowledged
questions.red_flags: Backups misaligned; Archives ignored; No verification; Timing unclear; Challenges not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Data deletion from backups not addressed or verification not conducted.

questions.question: How are data subject deletion requests handled?
questions.guidance: DSR deletion review. Look for: request handling process; scope of deletion; confirmation to requestor; documentation of completion.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you demonstrate deletion for a request?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Request handling process documented and scope defined and confirmation provided and completion documented and timely response and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No process; Scope unclear; No confirmation; Not documented; Delayed response; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Data subject deletion requests not handled according to documented process.

questions.question: Where is data masking applied?
questions.guidance: Masking coverage review. Look for: masking use cases documented; covered data types; implementation approach; effectiveness verification.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Masking use cases documented and data types identified and implementation approach defined and effectiveness verified and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No use cases documented; Data types unclear; Approach undefined; Not verified; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Data masking use cases not documented or coverage not verified.

questions.question: Is production data masked in non-production environments?
questions.guidance: Non-production masking review. Look for: test data management policy; development data protection; masking verification; synthetic data use where appropriate.
questions.auditor_focus: Does test data contain real PII?
questions.what_good_looks_like: No production PII in non-production and masking applied and verification conducted and synthetic data where appropriate and policy documented
questions.red_flags: Real PII in test; No masking; No verification; No synthetic data option; No policy
questions.nc_pattern: Production data not masked in non-production environments.

questions.question: Are masking rules documented?
questions.guidance: Masking rules review. Look for: masking specifications; consistent application; reversibility controls where needed; rule maintenance.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Masking specifications documented and consistent application and reversibility controlled and rules maintained and audit trail of changes
questions.red_flags: No specifications; Inconsistent application; Reversibility uncontrolled; Rules not maintained; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Data masking rules not documented or inconsistently applied.

questions.question: Is masked data validated for usefulness?
questions.guidance: Masked data validation review. Look for: functional testing of masked data; format preservation where needed; referential integrity maintained.
questions.auditor_focus: Does masked data work for testing?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Functional testing conducted and format preserved where needed and referential integrity and usefulness verified and feedback incorporated
questions.red_flags: No functional testing; Format broken; Integrity lost; Usefulness not verified; No feedback
questions.nc_pattern: Masked data not validated for functional usefulness in testing.

questions.question: How is masking compliance verified?
questions.guidance: Masking compliance review. Look for: verification of masking application; audit of non-production data; compliance checks; regular review.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know masking is applied?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Verification procedures for masking and non-production audits and compliance checks conducted and regular review and remediation tracked
questions.red_flags: No verification; No audits; No compliance checks; No review; Remediation not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Data masking compliance not verified or non-production environments not audited.

questions.question: Are DLP controls implemented?
questions.guidance: DLP deployment review. Look for: DLP tools deployed; coverage of endpoint and network and cloud; policies configured; central management.
questions.what_good_looks_like: DLP solution deployed and coverage of endpoint and network and cloud and policies configured and centrally managed and monitored
questions.red_flags: No DLP solution; Limited coverage; Policies not configured; Not centrally managed; Not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: DLP controls not implemented or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: What data types are monitored?
questions.guidance: Data monitoring scope review. Look for: sensitive data patterns defined; classification integration; custom rules for organisation data; detection coverage.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Sensitive data patterns defined and integrated with classification and custom rules for specific data and detection coverage verified and regularly updated
questions.red_flags: Patterns not defined; No classification integration; No custom rules; Coverage not verified; Not updated
questions.nc_pattern: DLP data type monitoring not comprehensive or not integrated with classification.

questions.question: How are DLP alerts handled?
questions.guidance: Alert handling review. Look for: alert triage process; investigation procedures; false positive handling; escalation paths.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Alert triage process documented and investigation procedures and false positive handling and escalation defined and tracked to closure
questions.red_flags: No triage process; No investigation; False positives ignored; No escalation; Not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: DLP alerts not handled according to documented triage and investigation process.

questions.question: Is DLP in prevention or detection mode?
questions.guidance: DLP mode review. Look for: blocking capability; user notification; exception process; business impact assessment.
questions.auditor_focus: Does DLP block or just detect?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Mode appropriate to data sensitivity and user notification and exception process and business impact assessed and justified decision
questions.red_flags: Mode inappropriate; No notification; No exceptions; Impact not assessed; Decision not justified
questions.nc_pattern: DLP mode not appropriate to data sensitivity or exception process not defined.

questions.question: Are all exfiltration channels covered?
questions.guidance: Channel coverage review. Look for: email coverage; web coverage; USB coverage; cloud storage coverage; printing and screenshots where appropriate.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Email and web and USB and cloud storage and printing covered and screenshots where appropriate and coverage verified and gaps addressed
questions.red_flags: Email missing; Web missing; USB missing; Cloud missing; Printing missing; Gaps not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: DLP does not cover all potential data exfiltration channels.

questions.question: Provide your backup policy.
questions.guidance: Backup policy review. Look for: scope of backups; frequency defined; retention periods; testing requirements; offsite storage requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive backup policy and scope defined and frequency appropriate and retention periods and testing requirements and offsite storage
questions.red_flags: No backup policy; Scope unclear; Frequency inadequate; Retention undefined; No testing requirement
questions.nc_pattern: Backup policy not documented or not comprehensive.

questions.question: Are backups performed as scheduled?
questions.guidance: Backup execution review. Look for: backup monitoring; completion rates; failure handling; alerting on failures.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Backup monitoring active and high completion rates and failure handling documented and alerting configured and success rate reported
questions.red_flags: No monitoring; Low completion rate; Failures not handled; No alerting; Success not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Backups not performed as scheduled or failures not detected and addressed.

questions.question: How often are backups tested?
questions.guidance: Backup testing review. Look for: restoration testing schedule minimum quarterly; test results documented; time to restore measured; verification of integrity.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Quarterly or more frequent testing and results documented and time to restore measured and integrity verified and issues addressed
questions.red_flags: Infrequent testing; Results not documented; Time not measured; Integrity not verified; Issues not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Backup restoration not tested at required frequency or results not documented.

questions.question: How are backups protected?
questions.guidance: Backup protection review. Look for: encryption of backups; access controls; offsite or air-gapped storage; immutability where appropriate.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Backups encrypted and access controlled and offsite or air-gapped and immutability where appropriate and protection verified
questions.red_flags: Backups not encrypted; Access uncontrolled; Not offsite; No immutability; Protection not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Backups not adequately protected through encryption and access controls.

questions.question: Is there geographically separate backup storage?
questions.guidance: Geographic separation review. Look for: offsite location; distance from primary appropriate; transfer security; recovery capability from offsite.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Offsite location documented and appropriate distance and secure transfer and recovery capability tested and location security verified
questions.red_flags: No offsite; Insufficient distance; Transfer insecure; Recovery not tested; Location insecure
questions.nc_pattern: Geographically separate backup storage not implemented or recovery not tested.

questions.question: Is redundancy implemented for critical systems?
questions.guidance: Redundancy implementation review. Look for: high availability architecture; redundant components; failover capability; availability targets defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: HA architecture documented and redundant components and failover capability and availability targets defined and alignment verified
questions.red_flags: No HA; No redundancy; No failover; Targets undefined; Alignment not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Redundancy not implemented for critical information processing systems.

questions.question: Are single points of failure identified?
questions.guidance: SPOF analysis review. Look for: SPOF analysis conducted; mitigation measures; residual risk acceptance; monitoring of SPOFs.
questions.what_good_looks_like: SPOF analysis documented and mitigation measures and residual risk accepted and monitoring in place and regular review
questions.red_flags: No SPOF analysis; No mitigation; Risk not accepted; No monitoring; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Single points of failure not identified or mitigation measures not implemented.

questions.question: How often is failover tested?
questions.guidance: Failover testing review. Look for: testing schedule; test results; time to failover measured; recovery verification; issues addressed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Regular testing schedule and results documented and time to failover measured and recovery verified and issues addressed and lessons learned
questions.red_flags: No testing schedule; Results not documented; Time not measured; Recovery not verified; Issues not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Failover not tested at required frequency or test results not documented.

questions.question: Is there geographic redundancy?
questions.guidance: Geographic redundancy review. Look for: multi-region deployment; DR site capability; data replication; failover procedures documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multi-region or DR site and data replication and failover procedures documented and regularly tested and RTO and RPO defined
questions.red_flags: No geographic redundancy; No DR site; No replication; Procedures not documented; RTO and RPO undefined
questions.nc_pattern: Geographic redundancy not implemented or DR capability not documented.

questions.question: Are redundancy requirements aligned with business needs?
questions.guidance: Business alignment review. Look for: availability requirements documented; SLA commitments; architecture alignment; gap analysis conducted.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you meet business availability needs?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Availability requirements documented and SLA commitments clear and architecture aligned and gap analysis and remediation tracked
questions.red_flags: Requirements not documented; SLA unclear; Architecture misaligned; No gap analysis; Gaps not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Redundancy architecture not aligned with documented business availability requirements.

questions.question: What security events are logged?
questions.guidance: Log coverage review. Look for: authentication events; authorisation events; configuration changes; data access; administrative activity.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Authentication and authorisation and configuration and data access and admin activity logged and coverage documented and gaps identified
questions.red_flags: Authentication not logged; Authorisation gaps; Config changes missing; Data access not logged; Admin gaps
questions.nc_pattern: Security event logging coverage insufficient for critical event types.

questions.question: Do logs contain required information?
questions.guidance: Log content review. Look for: user ID; timestamp; event type; source IP; success or failure; affected resource.
questions.auditor_focus: Can you identify who did what when?
questions.what_good_looks_like: User ID and timestamp and event type and source IP and success or failure and resource and consistent format
questions.red_flags: User ID missing; No timestamp; Event type unclear; No source IP; No outcome; Resource not identified
questions.nc_pattern: Logs do not contain required fields to identify who did what when.

questions.question: Are logs centrally aggregated?
questions.guidance: Log aggregation review. Look for: SIEM or log platform; collection from all sources; storage architecture; search capability.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there a central log repository?
questions.what_good_looks_like: SIEM or log platform deployed and collection from all sources and adequate storage and search capability and retention appropriate
questions.red_flags: No SIEM; Collection gaps; Inadequate storage; No search; Retention insufficient
questions.nc_pattern: Logs not centrally aggregated or collection coverage insufficient.

questions.question: How are logs protected from tampering?
questions.guidance: Log integrity review. Look for: integrity protection mechanisms; access controls on logs; immutable storage where appropriate; tampering detection.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Integrity protection and access controls and immutable storage where appropriate and tampering detection and audit of log access
questions.red_flags: No integrity protection; Unrestricted access; Mutable storage; No tampering detection; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Logs not protected from tampering or integrity not verifiable.

questions.question: What is log retention period?
questions.guidance: Log retention review. Look for: minimum 12 months recommended; storage management; regulatory alignment; policy documentation.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Minimum 12 months retention and storage managed and regulatory aligned and policy documented and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: Less than 12 months; Storage issues; Regulatory misalignment; Policy undocumented; Compliance not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Log retention period below recommended 12 months or not aligned with requirements.

questions.question: Are clocks synchronised for accurate timestamps?
questions.guidance: Clock synchronisation review. Look for: NTP configuration; synchronisation verification; time zone consistency; drift monitoring.
questions.what_good_looks_like: NTP configured and synchronisation verified and time zones consistent and drift monitored and documented standards
questions.red_flags: No NTP; Sync not verified; Time zones inconsistent; Drift not monitored; Standards unclear
questions.nc_pattern: Clock synchronisation not configured or timestamps not reliable.

questions.question: Is continuous monitoring implemented?
questions.guidance: Monitoring capability review. Look for: monitoring tools deployed; coverage of systems; 24x7 capability where required; SOC operations if applicable.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Monitoring tools deployed and comprehensive coverage and 24x7 where required and SOC or equivalent and documented procedures
questions.red_flags: No monitoring tools; Limited coverage; Not 24x7; No SOC; Procedures undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Continuous monitoring not implemented or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: What alerting rules are configured?
questions.guidance: Alerting configuration review. Look for: alert rules documented; thresholds appropriate; severity levels defined; tuning process.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Alert rules documented and thresholds appropriate and severity levels and tuning process and regular review and effectiveness measured
questions.red_flags: Rules not documented; Thresholds inappropriate; Severity undefined; No tuning; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Monitoring alerting rules not documented or thresholds not appropriate.

questions.question: How are alerts investigated?
questions.guidance: Alert investigation review. Look for: triage process; investigation procedures; SLAs for response; escalation paths.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Triage process documented and investigation procedures and response SLAs and escalation defined and metrics tracked
questions.red_flags: No triage; No procedures; No SLAs; Escalation undefined; Metrics not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Alert investigation process not documented or SLAs not defined.

questions.question: Is anomaly detection capability in place?
questions.guidance: Anomaly detection review. Look for: baseline establishment; anomaly detection tools; ML or behavioural analysis; tuning for environment.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Baselines established and anomaly detection capability and ML or behavioural analysis and tuned for environment and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No baselines; No anomaly detection; No ML or behavioural; Not tuned; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Anomaly detection capability not implemented or not tuned for environment.

questions.question: How is monitoring effectiveness reviewed?
questions.guidance: Effectiveness review process. Look for: detection metrics; false positive rates; coverage gaps; improvement actions.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know monitoring works?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Detection metrics tracked and false positive rates and coverage gaps identified and improvement actions and regular review and management reporting
questions.red_flags: No metrics; False positives not tracked; Gaps not identified; No improvements; No review
questions.nc_pattern: Monitoring effectiveness not measured or improvement actions not tracked.

questions.question: Are systems synchronised to approved time sources?
questions.guidance: Time source review. Look for: NTP configuration; approved sources such as government time servers; verification of synchronisation.
questions.what_good_looks_like: NTP configured and approved sources used and synchronisation verified and documented and regular checks
questions.red_flags: No NTP; Unapproved sources; Sync not verified; Not documented; No checks
questions.nc_pattern: Systems not synchronised to approved authoritative time sources.

questions.question: Is synchronisation monitored?
questions.guidance: Sync monitoring review. Look for: drift detection capability; alerting on failures; verification checks; maintenance procedures.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Drift detection and alerting on failures and verification checks and maintenance procedures and monitoring active
questions.red_flags: No drift detection; No alerting; No verification; No maintenance; Monitoring inactive
questions.nc_pattern: Clock synchronisation not monitored or drift not detected.

questions.question: Are time zones consistent?
questions.guidance: Time zone consistency review. Look for: standard configuration documented; UTC storage recommended; display consistency; documentation.
questions.auditor_focus: Is there a time zone standard?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Time zone standard documented and UTC for storage recommended and consistent display and documentation and compliance verified
questions.red_flags: No standard; UTC not used; Inconsistent display; Not documented; Compliance not verified
questions.nc_pattern: Time zone configuration not standardised or consistency not verified.

questions.question: Is configuration documented?
questions.guidance: Configuration documentation review. Look for: time source identification; configuration records; maintenance procedures; change tracking.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Time sources documented and configuration records and maintenance procedures and change tracking and regular review
questions.red_flags: Sources not documented; No config records; No maintenance procedures; No change tracking; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Clock synchronisation configuration not documented or maintained.

questions.question: Are privileged utilities identified?
questions.guidance: Utility identification review. Look for: inventory of utilities; capability assessment; authorised users documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Utility inventory maintained and capabilities assessed and authorised users documented and regular review and risk assessment
questions.red_flags: No inventory; Capabilities unknown; Users not documented; Not reviewed; No risk assessment
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged utility programs not identified or inventoried.

questions.question: Is utility access restricted and logged?
questions.guidance: Access control review. Look for: access restrictions in place; usage logging; monitoring for misuse.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access restricted to authorised users and usage logged and monitoring for misuse and alerts configured and regular review
questions.red_flags: Access unrestricted; Not logged; No monitoring; No alerts; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged utility access not restricted or usage not logged.

questions.question: Are unnecessary utilities removed?
questions.guidance: Utility hardening review. Look for: utility assessment conducted; removal of unneeded tools; hardening applied; verification.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Utility assessment conducted and unneeded removed and hardening applied and verification and regular review
questions.red_flags: No assessment; Unneeded retained; No hardening; No verification; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Unnecessary privileged utilities not removed from systems.

questions.question: Is approval required for utility usage?
questions.guidance: Approval process review. Look for: approval process documented; justification required; time-limited access where appropriate.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Approval process documented and justification required and time-limited where appropriate and audit trail and regular review
questions.red_flags: No approval process; No justification; Permanent access; No audit trail; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged utility usage not subject to approval process.

questions.question: Are utility capabilities regularly audited?
questions.guidance: Utility audit review. Look for: periodic review of utilities; risk evaluation; compensating controls documented; management oversight.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Periodic review conducted and risk evaluated and compensating controls and management oversight and findings addressed
questions.red_flags: No periodic review; Risk not evaluated; No compensating controls; No oversight; Findings not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Privileged utility capabilities not regularly audited or reviewed.

controls.control_name: Installation of Software on Operational Systems

questions.question: Is software installation controlled?
questions.guidance: Installation control review. Look for: installation restrictions in place; approval process documented; authorised installers identified.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Installation restrictions enforced and approval process and authorised installers identified and compliance monitored and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No restrictions; No approval process; Installers not identified; Not monitored; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Software installation not controlled or approval process not defined.

questions.question: Are installation rights restricted?
questions.guidance: Rights restriction review. Look for: admin rights removed from users; whitelisting or application control; enforcement verified.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Admin rights removed and whitelisting or application control and enforcement verified and compliance monitored and exceptions controlled
questions.red_flags: Admin rights not removed; No whitelisting; Not enforced; Not monitored; Exceptions uncontrolled
questions.nc_pattern: Software installation rights not restricted or enforcement not verified.

questions.question: Is software from trusted sources only?
questions.guidance: Trusted source review. Look for: approved sources defined; integrity verification; vendor validation process.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Approved sources defined and integrity verification and vendor validation and documented process and compliance monitored
questions.red_flags: Sources undefined; No integrity check; No vendor validation; Process undocumented; Not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Software installation not restricted to trusted and verified sources.

questions.question: Is software tracked in inventory?
questions.guidance: Software inventory review. Look for: software inventory maintained; license management; discovery tools deployed.
questions.auditor_focus: Do you know all installed software?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Software inventory maintained and license management and discovery tools and regular reconciliation and completeness verified
questions.red_flags: No inventory; No license management; No discovery; Not reconciled; Completeness unknown
questions.nc_pattern: Installed software not tracked in inventory or discovery not implemented.

questions.question: How is unauthorised software detected?
questions.guidance: Detection capability review. Look for: monitoring for unauthorised software; alerting; response process documented.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Monitoring for unauthorised and alerting configured and response process and compliance tracking and trend analysis
questions.red_flags: No monitoring; No alerting; No response process; Not tracked; No analysis
questions.nc_pattern: Unauthorised software installation not detected or response not defined.

questions.question: Are networks segmented?
questions.guidance: Network segmentation review. Look for: segmentation implemented; VLANs or equivalent; micro-segmentation where appropriate; zero trust architecture progress.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Network segmented and VLANs or equivalent and micro-segmentation where appropriate and zero trust progress and documented architecture
questions.red_flags: No segmentation; No VLANs; No micro-segmentation; No zero trust; Architecture undocumented
questions.nc_pattern: Network not segmented or segmentation not documented.

questions.question: Are network devices securely configured?
questions.guidance: Device configuration review. Look for: hardening standards applied; default credentials changed; firmware updates current.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Hardening standards applied and defaults changed and firmware current and configuration documented and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No hardening; Defaults unchanged; Firmware outdated; Not documented; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Network devices not securely configured or hardening not verified.

questions.question: Is traffic filtered?
questions.guidance: Traffic filtering review. Look for: firewall rules documented; ACLs configured; deny-by-default approach; rule review schedule.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Firewall rules documented and ACLs configured and deny-by-default and rule review schedule and audit trail of changes
questions.red_flags: Rules undocumented; ACLs missing; Default allow; No review schedule; No audit trail
questions.nc_pattern: Network traffic filtering not implemented with default deny or rules not reviewed.

questions.question: Are network services secured?
questions.guidance: Service security review. Look for: unnecessary services disabled; secure protocols enforced; service hardening applied.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Unnecessary services disabled and secure protocols and service hardening and verification conducted and documented
questions.red_flags: Services not disabled; Insecure protocols; No hardening; Not verified; Not documented
questions.nc_pattern: Unnecessary network services not disabled or secure protocols not enforced.

questions.question: Is network monitoring implemented?
questions.guidance: Network monitoring review. Look for: traffic monitoring capability; flow logging; IDS or IPS deployment; anomaly detection.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Traffic monitoring and flow logging and IDS or IPS and anomaly detection and documented procedures and regular review
questions.red_flags: No traffic monitoring; No flow logging; No IDS or IPS; No anomaly detection; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Network monitoring not implemented or insufficient capability.

questions.question: Are wireless networks secured?
questions.guidance: Wireless security review. Look for: WPA3 or WPA2 Enterprise; guest network segregation; rogue AP detection capability.
questions.what_good_looks_like: WPA3 or WPA2 Enterprise and guest segregated and rogue AP detection and documented configuration and regular review
questions.red_flags: Weak encryption; Guest not segregated; No rogue detection; Not documented; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Wireless networks not secured with appropriate encryption or guest network not segregated.

questions.question: How is network segmentation implemented?
questions.guidance: Network segmentation review. Look for: segmentation strategy documented; VLANs implemented; micro-segmentation where appropriate; zero trust architecture progress; segmentation aligned with data classification.
questions.auditor_focus: Is segmentation appropriate for risk level?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Segmentation strategy documented and VLANs implemented and micro-segmentation for sensitive systems and zero trust progress and aligned with classification and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No segmentation strategy; VLANs not used; Flat network; No micro-segmentation; Not aligned with classification
questions.nc_pattern: Network segmentation not implemented or not aligned with data classification requirements.

questions.question: Are critical systems on separate network segments?
questions.guidance: Critical system isolation review. Look for: production systems isolated; development separated from production; DMZ implemented; database tier segregated; management networks separated.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Production isolated and dev separated and DMZ implemented and database tier segregated and management networks separate and documented architecture
questions.red_flags: Critical systems not isolated; Dev and prod mixed; No DMZ; Database not segregated; Management exposed
questions.nc_pattern: Critical systems not isolated on separate network segments.

questions.question: How is inter-segment traffic controlled?
questions.guidance: Traffic control review. Look for: firewall rules between segments; access control lists; default deny between segments; rule documentation; regular review.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Firewall rules between segments and ACLs configured and default deny and rules documented and regular review and change managed
questions.red_flags: No inter-segment controls; Default allow; Rules undocumented; No review; Not change managed
questions.nc_pattern: Inter-segment traffic not controlled or default deny not implemented.

questions.question: Is guest and corporate traffic segregated?
questions.guidance: Guest network review. Look for: guest network isolated; no access to corporate resources; separate SSID; bandwidth controls; terms of use.
questions.auditor_focus: Can guest devices access corporate resources?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Guest network isolated and no corporate access and separate SSID and bandwidth controls and terms of use and regularly tested
questions.red_flags: Guest not isolated; Corporate access possible; Shared SSID; No controls; No terms; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Guest network not adequately segregated from corporate network.

questions.question: How is cloud network segmentation managed?
questions.guidance: Cloud segmentation review. Look for: VPC configuration; security groups; network ACLs; private subnets for sensitive workloads; peering controls.
questions.what_good_looks_like: VPCs configured and security groups and network ACLs and private subnets and peering controlled and documented and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No VPC segmentation; Security groups misconfigured; Public subnets for sensitive; Peering uncontrolled
questions.nc_pattern: Cloud network segmentation not implemented or misconfigured.

questions.question: Is web filtering implemented?
questions.guidance: Web filter deployment review. Look for: filter deployed; coverage of all users; bypass capability controlled.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Web filter deployed and coverage complete and bypass controlled and documented and monitored
questions.red_flags: No web filter; Limited coverage; Bypass available; Not documented; Not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Web filtering not implemented or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: What categories are blocked?
questions.guidance: Category blocking review. Look for: blocked categories documented; policy alignment; user notification; regular review.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Blocked categories documented and policy aligned and user notification and regular review and appropriate to risk
questions.red_flags: Categories undocumented; Policy misaligned; No notification; Not reviewed; Inappropriate
questions.nc_pattern: Web filtering categories not documented or not aligned with security policy.

questions.question: How are exceptions handled?
questions.guidance: Exception process review. Look for: exception request process; approval requirements; time limits; monitoring of exceptions.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Exception process documented and approval required and time limits and monitoring and regular review and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No process; No approval; No limits; No monitoring; Not reviewed; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Web filtering exceptions not managed through documented approval process.

questions.question: Is web activity logged?
questions.guidance: Web logging review. Look for: access logging enabled; retention appropriate; privacy compliance; analysis capability.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Access logging enabled and retention appropriate and privacy compliant and analysis capability and regular review
questions.red_flags: Not logged; Retention inadequate; Privacy non-compliant; No analysis; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Web activity not logged or retention insufficient for security purposes.

questions.question: Is HTTPS traffic inspected?
questions.guidance: SSL inspection review. Look for: SSL inspection capability; certificate deployment; privacy considerations addressed.
questions.what_good_looks_like: SSL inspection where appropriate and certificate management and privacy addressed and documented decision and exceptions controlled
questions.red_flags: No SSL inspection; Certificate issues; Privacy not addressed; Not documented; Exceptions uncontrolled
questions.nc_pattern: HTTPS inspection not implemented or privacy implications not addressed.

questions.question: Are network services from secure providers?
questions.guidance: Provider security review. Look for: provider security assessment; contract security requirements; monitoring of provider security.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Provider security assessed and contract requirements and monitoring in place and regular review and issues addressed
questions.red_flags: Providers not assessed; No contract requirements; No monitoring; Not reviewed; Issues not addressed
questions.nc_pattern: Network service providers not assessed for security or contract requirements missing.

questions.question: Are secure protocols enforced?
questions.guidance: Protocol enforcement review. Look for: secure protocols mandated; insecure protocols disabled; verification conducted.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Secure protocols mandated and insecure disabled and verification conducted and documented and monitored
questions.red_flags: Insecure protocols allowed; Not disabled; No verification; Not documented; Not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Secure network protocols not enforced or insecure protocols not disabled.

questions.question: How are network service agreements managed?
questions.guidance: Service agreement review. Look for: SLAs documented; security requirements in contracts; service level monitoring; incident response requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: SLAs documented and security requirements in contracts and service monitoring and incident response and regular review of agreements
questions.red_flags: No SLAs; Security not contractual; No monitoring; Incident response unclear; Agreements not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Network service agreements do not include adequate security requirements.

questions.question: How is network service provider security monitored?
questions.guidance: Provider monitoring review. Look for: provider security assessments; certificate reviews; security incident notification; performance monitoring.
questions.auditor_focus: How do you know providers remain secure?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Provider assessments conducted and certificates reviewed annually and incident notification and performance monitored and documented reviews
questions.red_flags: No assessments; Certificates not reviewed; No incident notification; Performance not monitored
questions.nc_pattern: Network service provider security not monitored on ongoing basis.

questions.question: Are network services resilient and redundant?
questions.guidance: Network resilience review. Look for: redundant connections; diverse routing; failover capability; SLA for availability; tested regularly.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Redundant connections and diverse routing and failover capability and availability SLA and tested regularly and documented
questions.red_flags: Single provider; No diversity; No failover; Availability unclear; Not tested
questions.nc_pattern: Network services lack resilience or redundancy for availability requirements.

questions.question: Provide your cryptography policy.
questions.guidance: Crypto policy review. Look for: approved algorithms documented; key management requirements; use cases defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Cryptography policy documented and approved algorithms and key management requirements and use cases and regular review
questions.red_flags: No crypto policy; Algorithms undocumented; Key management unclear; Use cases undefined; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Cryptography policy not documented or approved algorithms not specified.

questions.question: What algorithms are approved?
questions.guidance: Algorithm approval review. Look for: symmetric AES-256-GCM; asymmetric RSA-2048 plus or ECDSA; hashing SHA-256 plus; documented standards.
questions.what_good_looks_like: AES-256-GCM for symmetric and RSA-2048 or ECDSA for asymmetric and SHA-256 minimum for hashing and standards documented and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: Weak symmetric; Weak asymmetric; Weak hashing; Standards undocumented; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Approved cryptographic algorithms not current or not documented.

questions.question: Is data encrypted at rest and in transit?
questions.guidance: Encryption coverage review. Look for: encryption at rest; TLS version 1.2 minimum 1.3 preferred for transit; database encryption; comprehensive coverage.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Encryption at rest and TLS 1.2 or 1.3 for transit and database encryption and coverage verified and documented
questions.red_flags: No encryption at rest; TLS below 1.2; Database unencrypted; Coverage gaps; Not documented
questions.nc_pattern: Data not encrypted at rest or in transit or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: How are cryptographic keys managed?
questions.guidance: Key management review. Look for: key generation procedures; secure storage; rotation schedule; access controls; key destruction.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Key generation procedures and secure storage and rotation schedule and access controlled and destruction procedures and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No procedures; Insecure storage; No rotation; Access uncontrolled; No destruction process; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Cryptographic key management procedures not documented or key protection inadequate.

questions.question: Are weak algorithms prohibited?
questions.guidance: Weak algorithm review. Look for: deprecated list including MD5 and SHA-1 and DES and 3DES and SSL and TLS 1.0 and 1.1; detection capability; migration plan.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Deprecated algorithms listed and detection capability and migration plan and enforcement and regular review
questions.red_flags: No deprecated list; No detection; No migration; Not enforced; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Weak cryptographic algorithms not prohibited or detection not in place.

questions.question: Provide your secure SDLC documentation.
questions.guidance: SDLC security review. Look for: SDLC policy documented; security activities by phase; mandatory gates defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Secure SDLC documented and security activities per phase and mandatory gates and enforcement and regular review
questions.red_flags: No SDLC documentation; Activities undefined; No gates; Not enforced; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Secure development lifecycle not documented or security not embedded in process.

questions.question: How are security requirements captured?
questions.guidance: Requirements capture review. Look for: requirements process documented; threat modeling input; security user stories or requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Requirements process documented and threat modeling input and security requirements documented and captured early and traced through development
questions.red_flags: No process; No threat input; Requirements not documented; Captured late; No traceability
questions.nc_pattern: Security requirements not captured early in development process.

questions.question: Is secure coding training provided?
questions.guidance: Developer training review. Look for: training program documented; OWASP coverage; technology-specific content; completion tracking.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Training program documented and OWASP covered and technology-specific and completion tracked and regular refresher
questions.red_flags: No training program; OWASP not covered; Generic content; Not tracked; No refresher
questions.nc_pattern: Secure coding training not provided to developers or coverage insufficient.

questions.question: Is security code review performed?
questions.guidance: Code review process. Look for: review process documented; security checklist used; four-eyes principle applied.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security code review process and checklist used and four-eyes principle and records maintained and issues tracked
questions.red_flags: No review process; No checklist; No four-eyes; Records not maintained; Issues not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Security code review not performed or process not documented.

questions.question: Is security testing in CI/CD?
questions.guidance: CI/CD security review. Look for: SAST integration; DAST integration; dependency scanning; blocking criteria defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: SAST in pipeline and DAST integration and dependency scanning and blocking criteria and results tracked
questions.red_flags: No SAST; No DAST; No dependency scanning; No blocking criteria; Results not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Security testing not integrated into CI/CD pipeline.

questions.question: Is security sign-off required for deployment?
questions.guidance: Deployment approval review. Look for: security sign-off process; criteria documented; authority defined; exception handling.
questions.auditor_focus: Can code deploy without security approval?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Security sign-off required and criteria documented and authority defined and exceptions controlled and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No sign-off; Criteria undefined; Authority unclear; Exceptions uncontrolled; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Security sign-off not required before deployment or can be bypassed.

questions.question: How are security requirements identified?
questions.guidance: Requirements identification review. Look for: requirements process documented; security team input; documentation of requirements.
questions.auditor_focus: Are requirements captured for all apps?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Requirements process documented and security team input and requirements documented and captured for all apps and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: No process; No security input; Not documented; Not for all apps; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Application security requirements not systematically identified.

questions.question: Are requirements risk-based?
questions.guidance: Risk alignment review. Look for: risk assessment linkage; threat-driven requirements; proportionate to criticality.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Linked to risk assessment and threat-driven and proportionate to criticality and documented rationale and reviewed
questions.red_flags: No risk linkage; Not threat-driven; Disproportionate; No rationale; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Application security requirements not risk-based or proportionate to criticality.

questions.question: Are regulatory requirements considered?
questions.guidance: Regulatory consideration review. Look for: compliance mapping; regulatory requirements captured; tracked through development.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Compliance mapping conducted and regulatory requirements captured and tracked through development and verified and documented
questions.red_flags: No compliance mapping; Regulatory not captured; Not tracked; Not verified; Not documented
questions.nc_pattern: Regulatory requirements not considered in application security requirements.

questions.question: Are requirements tracked to completion?
questions.guidance: Traceability review. Look for: requirements traceability; testing against requirements; verification documented.
questions.auditor_focus: Can requirements be traced through development?
questions.what_good_looks_like: Requirements traced through development and testing against requirements and verification documented and completion confirmed and audit trail
questions.red_flags: No traceability; Testing not against requirements; No verification; Completion not confirmed; No audit
questions.nc_pattern: Application security requirements not traced through development to completion.

questions.question: How are third-party app requirements assessed?
questions.guidance: Vendor app assessment review. Look for: vendor assessment process; security questionnaires; contract requirements.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Vendor assessment process and security questionnaires and contract requirements and documented assessments and regular review
questions.red_flags: No assessment process; No questionnaires; No contract requirements; Not documented; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Third-party application security requirements not assessed.

questions.question: Are secure architecture principles documented?
questions.guidance: Architecture principles review. Look for: architecture standards documented; security patterns defined; reference architectures available.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Architecture standards documented and security patterns and reference architectures and regular review and aligned with best practices
questions.red_flags: No standards; Patterns undefined; No reference architectures; Not reviewed; Not aligned
questions.nc_pattern: Secure architecture principles not documented.

questions.question: Is security architecture review performed?
questions.guidance: Review process verification. Look for: review process documented; security input required; approval requirements defined.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Review process documented and security input required and approval requirements and records maintained and issues tracked
questions.red_flags: No review process; No security input; No approval requirements; No records; Issues not tracked
questions.nc_pattern: Security architecture review not performed for new systems.

questions.question: Are defence-in-depth principles applied?
questions.guidance: Layered security review. Look for: multiple security layers; no single point of protection; documented architecture rationale.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Multiple security layers and no single point of protection and architecture rationale documented and verified and regularly reviewed
questions.red_flags: Single layer; SPOF in security; Rationale undocumented; Not verified; Not reviewed
questions.nc_pattern: Defence-in-depth principles not applied in system architecture.

questions.question: Are secure design patterns used?
questions.guidance: Design pattern review. Look for: input validation patterns; output encoding; authentication patterns documented and applied.
questions.what_good_looks_like: Input validation patterns and output encoding and authentication patterns and documented and applied consistently
questions.red_flags: No patterns; Input validation missing; No output encoding; Not documented; Inconsistent
questions.nc_pattern: Secure design patterns not used or not consistently applied.

questions.question: Is threat modeling performed?
